loans.name: Denis

texts.es:
El Sr. Denis R. V. tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive en la Calle Arroz de la Ciudad Coronel Oviedo.
Denis es un joven emprendedor, tiene su establo en las afueras de la ciudad, se dedica a la cría de vacas desde muy pequeño con sus padres. Comenta que el oficio es muy sacrificado ya que tiene que levantarse muy temprano para la recolección de la leche, limpieza de utensilios para el ordeñamiento y luego debe salir a repartir su leche en la ciudad, en un motocarro.
Manifiesta también que es muy satisfactorio valerse por sí mismo, tener su propia empresa y de esta manera poder ayudar a toda su familia.
Se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya en busca de apoyo y está muy contento con la institución por haber podido ofrecerle un crédito, de esa forma podría mejorar el servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Denis Román V., 23, is single living in the city of Coronel Oviedo.  He’s a young entrepreneur.  He has a stable outside the city where he has raised cattle with his parents since he was very young.  He comments that the work is very hard because he has to get up very early to milk the cows, clean the milking equipment and then go out to deliver the milk in the city in a motor vehicle.

He states that it is very satisfying to fend for himself, to have his own business and to be able to help all his family this way.

He called on Fundación Paraguaya seeking help and is very happy with the institution because it offered him a loan which will allow him to improve service to his customers.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Fifa Group

texts.en:
The Fifa group of three entrepreneurs are all friends who have stalls in the same market in Calavi, a district on the outskirts of Cotonou, Benin's largest city. This is their third loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments.

Agnes (with her hand raised in the photo) was born in 1968 in Cotonou. She moved to her current location seven years ago, and now lives with her husband Barnabé and their children, all of whom are in school.

For the past 10 years Agnes has run a stall selling clothes in the Akassato market. This loan will enable her to purchase clothes in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market in the heart of Cotonou. She claims to be determined in her approach to business, and always seeks to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Procesa

texts.en:
Procesa Y. is from the city of Dona Consuelo, Ozamiz City. She is 59 years old. Procesa is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Procesa owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Procesa has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Procesa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Procesa has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Procesa is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, candies and soft drinks for sale. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Procesa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, candies and soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés C.  C. vive en Ostional de Guanacaste, es una mujer emprendedora  y es conocida por sus  deliciosos   “tamales” ( comida tradicional a base de maíz)  que vende desde su casa.
Ella tiene problemas en su casa ya que desde hace días las fuertes lluvias han deteriorado el techo de su casa. Es por eso que ella necesita un préstamo de ₡150 000 ( ciento cincuenta  mil colones) para la compra de Zinc para reconstruir el techo de su casita.
Ella desea poder continuar con su trabajo, lo cual conseguirá gracias a este préstamo.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito  Apoyo Comunal Ostional,  una de las 110 Empresa socias de EDESA en  Costa Rica.
texts.en: Inés C. C. lives in Ostional in Guanacaste.  She is an enterprising woman, well-known for her delicious tamales (traditional corn-based food) that she sells from her house.  She has problems with her house and some days ago, strong rains damaged the roof.  For this reason she needs a loan of ₡150 000 (150,000 colones) to buy zinc panels to rebuild the roof of her little home.  She desires to keep working and a loan will let her do that.  She is a member of the Ostional Credit Support Community Bank, one of 110 such groups of EDESA en Costa Rica.

loans.use: buy zinc panels

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora L. is from the village of Balide, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old. Leonora is widowed and has five adult children. 

To make a living, Leonora sells food and drinks for passengers in the bus terminal. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Leonora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Leonora is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to  purchase additional biscuits and candies for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Leonora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional biscuits and candies for sale.

loans.name: Fousseni

texts.fr: Père de 03 enfants, fousseni est âgé de45 ans et marié à une revendeuse. Pour son activité il a eu la brillante idée de vendre des timbres fiscaux vers le port pour les légalisations des pièces dans le déroulement des dédouanements des marchandises et faciliter la tache aux transitaires, et pour cela il s’approvisionne à la mairie, il est également agent de police au commissariat du port .il a commencé cette activité depuis 1986.il souhaiterait s’approvisionner plus en timbre d’où ce deuxième crédit.
texts.en: Fousseni is 45 years old, married to a retailer and father to three children. He had the brilliant idea of setting up a business selling stamps for official documents near the port and he provides these for legalising papers as part of the customs clearance process, easing the task for freight brokers. To do this he gets his supplies of stamps from the town-hall. He is also a police officer at the port's police station. He began this activity in 1986. He would like to get more supplies of stamps and for this reason is requesting a second loan.

loans.use: to buy stamps for official documents

loans.name: Toreka

texts.en:
Toreka is 44 years of age and married with seven children. Toreka owns & operates a business venture, providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  She has 5 years of experience in this business.  Toreka needs a loan of WST $2900 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2006, Toreka joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Toreka's 8th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Thol

texts.en: Thol, age 31, is a weaver. Her husband is a motor taxi driver (a motorbike with a cart attached). Their income is 11 USD per day. They have two children, ages 4 and 2. Every month, Thol has to spend 75 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, 50 USD on transportation, and 40 USD on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of 800 USD to buy a new motorbike with a cart attached for her husband to earn money. The old motorbike is broken and needs to be fixed a lot. If her husband can make a good profit, she wants to feed chickens and pigs at home, and she will send all of her children to study until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy a Tok Tok (a motorbike with a cart attached).

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Cristina has a retail shop that sells beverages, candies and biscuits. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and breads. Cristina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and breads

loans.name: Nhek

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhek, age 61 years-old, is the mother of six children.  She is from Baray district of Kompong Tom Province.

Since 2000, she has sold fish and vegetables in Baray market and she can earn a profit of $2 per day. 

Her husband is 56-years old and is a domestic farmer.  He also catches fish in and around ponds and rivers.  He earns a profit of $2 per day also. They have given birth to six children, five unmarried and one married. Three of the children are employed in different occupations to generate income.  Mrs. Nhek requests a loan in the amount of $800 for the purpose of purchasing a boat and farming. With the rest of the loan, she hopes to build a new restroom for her family’s use.

loans.use: to purchase a boat, to plant a rice crop and to build a new restroom for her family’s use.

loans.name: Benkola 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKOLA 2 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans,  4  enfants et vivant majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, AWA la personne au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5  hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkola 2 Group are married women who, on average, are 39 years old and have four children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Baou, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Awa, sitting in the middle of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing and weeding. She has around 0.5 hectares of farmland to grow rice and groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Baou, Koula, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 40,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Zacapalco Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Zacapalco, está conformado por la señora María Emelia va a comprar con su préstamo masa, manteca, verduras, carne, pollo, requesón, queso, crema, la señora Verónica va a comprar dulces, la señora Norma va a comprar maíz, manteca, hojas para tamal, carne, tomates, jitomates, chiles verdes, la señora Barbará va a comprar Colchas, la señora Petra va a comprar líquidos y follares para su siembra D. caña. La señora Verónica tiene 38 años D. edad, ella es casada tiene 4 hijas todas están estudiando, ella tiene su puestos D. dulces, gelatinas, yogurt fuera D. su casa pone su mesa con su puesto, ella solicito su crédito para comprar dulces paletas, chicles, caramelos, chicharrones, gelatinas y yogurth para surtir su negocio y una parte para repillar una bodega. ella inicio su negocio hace 4 años con un ahorro que tenia, ella aprendió sola la necesidad la hizo iniciar con este negocio que es muy importante para tener un ingreso extra para darles a sus hijas que están estudiando, ella se siente orgullosa por los beneficios que obtiene y D. poder ayudarle a sus hijas en los gastos D. la escuela, ella tiene sus sueños y esperanzas D. estar mejor, vivir mejor, que sus hijas tengan una carrera y estén bien D. salud, ella está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir va a surtirse D. dulces y gelatinas para que se vea más bonito su puesto. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos sus apoyos y que sigan ayudando a más personas y ojala haya más personas como ustedes que nos ayudan a mejorar nuestros negocios y nuestras familias”.
texts.en:
This solidarity Group is called Zacapalco. It is maD. up of Sra. Maria Emelia, who is going to buy flour, butter, vegetables, meat, chicken, curd, cheese, and cream; Sra. Verónica who is going to buy sweets; Sra. Norma who is going to buy corn, butter, leaves for tamales, meat, tomatoes, and green chiles; Sra. Barbará who is going to buy bedspreads; and Sra. Petra who is going to buy liquid foliar fertilizer for her sugarcane planting.

Sra. Veronia is 38, married and has 4 daughters all of whom are studying. She has a stand for sweets, gelatins and yogurt. She sets up a table as her stand outsiD. of her house. She is requesting a loan to buy popsicles, gum, candy, chicharrones (pork cracklings), gelatin and yogurt to stock her business and she will use some of the loan to plaster a pantry. She began her business 4 years ago with some savings she had. She learned on her own, due to her need to start this business since it is very important to have extra income in order to proviD. for her daughters who are studying. She is proud of her earnings and that she is able to help her daughters with school expenses. She has dreams and hopes of being better, living better and that her daughters will have careers and will remain healthy. She is happy about the loan she is going to receive. She will stock her stand so that it will look more appealing. 

The members of the group want to thank Kiva and FRAC and say “We appreciate your support and hope you continue to help more people and we wish there were more people like you helping folks like us to improve ourselves and our families”

loans.use: to buy sweets.

loans.name: Nouvelle Vision Plus Group

texts.en:
Nouvelle Vision Plus is a community bank group which is composed of 16 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. It is located in Kinshasa. 

Pascal sells lamp oil. He has been in business since 1994. His beginning capital was $50. With hard work and determination, and after he joined one of Hope’s groups called “Nouvelle Vision Plus,” his business has prospered. Through his sales, Pascal makes about $60 per week. He plans to use the coming loan from Hope to increase his inventory by purchasing more liters of lamp oil for reselling at profit in order to increase his income.

 Pascal has points of sale within his community. He dreams someday of being an important lamp oil provider in his environment. Pascal is 48 years old, married and the father of two children whose ages are 5 and 18. Both of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase more lamp oil to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Duo Solidario Vida Y Amor Group

texts.es: Duo Vida y amor. Sofia,siendo ella la lider de este grupo de 73 años de edad ella se dedica a la elavoracion de tejidos a mano tipicos desde hace varios años,ella esta esta solicitnaod este credito paa la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos ya que nececita mas capiral para trabajar la igual que la siguiente socia esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos tipicos el sueño de ellas es tener un capital mas grande y estar mejor economicamente.
texts.en: Sofia is the lead of the group Duo Vida Y Amor (Life and Love Duo). She is 73 years old, and she has been making traditional woven items by hand for some years. She is asking for this loan to buy raw material for weaving since she needs more working capital. Like another member who is asking for a loan to buy raw material for traditional weaving, these women’s dream is to have a more working capital and to be better off financially.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make traditional woven items.

loans.name: Elsa Rosa

texts.es:
Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal “Medallitas de Oro II”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, es  conviviente y tiene un hijo, realizó estudios hasta 4to de educación secundaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de de ferretería.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevo soles, comprará tres paquetes de tubos de agua, desagüe, luz y otros accesorios para el negocio.  Trabaja sola en el negocio, su esposo tiene otro negocio venta de flores.
Su sueño es capitalizarse y llenar el kiosco con mucha más mercadería.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la alegría y las utilidades del ahorro.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the “Medallitas de Oro II” community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 30 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child.  She studied up to the fourth year of her secondary education.

Elsa has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles and she invested that money in her business selling hardware.

Elsa will use her new loan for 3,000 soles to buy three packets of water pipes, sewer pipes, fluorescent tubes and other accessories for her business.  She works alone in her business as her husband has another business selling flowers.

Elsa's dream is to capitalize her business and fill her stand with a lot more merchandise.

What Elsa most likes about her community bank is the happiness and the money she makes on her savings.

loans.use: to buy three packets of water pipes, sewer pipes, fluorescent tubes, etc.

loans.name: Simeon Arnulfo

texts.es: Simeón Arnulfo se dedica a brindar el servicio de molino. Desde hace mas de  41 años, que tiene este negocio se levanta desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde todos los días para atender a sus clientes. Simeón tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo  a los cuales tiene que brindarle educación, alimentación y vestimenta. Poco a poco fue mejorando sus ingresos hasta ahora que sigue con su negocio para mejorar los ingresos de su familia. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere con el préstamo realizar mantenimiento de las maquinas y realizarle  mejoras a su local.
texts.en:
Simeón Arnulfois has been working as a miller for 41 years. He has been serving his customers, getting up every day at 5:00 AM and working until 6:00 PM. Simeón has two minor children in his care for whom he must provide education, food and clothing. 

Little by little he has increased his income and now he wants to continue in his work in order to increase the family income. 

He has many dreams about his business and that is why he is asking for a loan, in order to maintain the machines and to make improvements to the premises.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of the machines and to make improvements to the premises

loans.name: Hang's Group

texts.en:
In this group, there are four members that have different purposes of using Kiva’s funds. One of the people photographed is Mrs. Hang, 50. She is the leader of her group loan. She is in the business of rice cultivating and piglet fattening. 

Mrs. Hang has been involved in this business since 1985. She has learned well and gained a lot of experience from her business. That is why she is able to recognize how to choose good piglets for raising, how to fatten them rapidly and to avoid illnesses. Mrs. Hang typically earns $3.50 each day through this business and works hard to support the family. She decided to take out a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. With the profits from her expanded business, she wants to buy many heads of piglets for raising.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married, and the father of four children.

Alaa has been an owner of a shop for the repairing and maintenance of water pumps since 1995. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay annual rent and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es: Don Mario es un humilde  agricultor del municipio de Masaya , junto a su familia , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y lograr construir su vivienda , don Mario desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de cítricos , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes para poder logar darle el mantenimiento adecuado para que las frutas den un buen tamaño , color y sabor .Sus sueños es poder diversificar el cultivo para poder optar a un mejor bienestar ya que si lo logrará esto podría cambiar su vida . Agradece la confianza y el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic Atraves del fondo Kiva ya que sin estos programas de apoyo a pequeños agricultores no podrían salir adelante con su producción.
texts.en:
Mario is a modest farmer, who lives with his family in the municipality of Masaya. His plan for the future is to improve his family's living conditions, and succeed in building his house.  

Mario has been growing citrus fruit for several years. His greatest challenge is not having enough financial resources to adequately maintain his crop, and produce fruit that is of good size, color and taste. His dream is to be able to diversify his crops and strive for better well-being; since if he succeeds, this could change his life. 

He appreciates the trust and support that Afodenic offers him, by means of Kiva funding.  Without these support programs for small farmers, he wouldn't be able to make progress with his production.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with three children two of whom are enrolled in school while the other one is too young for school. Her husband is a seaman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Salome has operated a clothes selling business for the past five years.Iin addition she also sells soft drinks like juices. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 60,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of clothes and passions fruits for making juice for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of their fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes and passionfruit for making juice for sale.

loans.name: Fayzamad

texts.ru: Файзамад проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 50 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Предоставляет услугу, перерабатывает хлопок. В этой области он пять лет. Кредит берет для приобретения нового оборудования.
texts.en: Fayzamad lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 50 years old, married and has five children.  He has a secondary education.  Fayzamad provides a service of processing cotton.  He has been in this business for five years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of new equipment.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 53, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ernesto, a vendor, and is the mother of seven children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Lolita operates a market stall. She sells vegetable, raw products and condiments in the community market. She buys large quantities of vegetables and other common items used in cooking and sells them by the kilo or per piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue running her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more vegetable products and condiments to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lolita dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business and to build her house in her province. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can, she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of vegetables and other products for her business

loans.name: Nemesio

texts.es:
Nemesio tiene 26 años, está casado, tiene dos hijos, vive en su casa de Carapeguá con su esposa Tomasa. Él fabrica pelotas y su esposa trabaja como empleada doméstica. Nos cuenta que aprendió el oficio de su padre con quien trabajó mucho tiempo y lo puso en práctica a su corta edad.
Actualmente vende sus productos por Asunción. Decidió dedicarse al rubro ya que cuenta con una experiencia  además de que le deja un buen ingreso económico. Es un señor muy trabajador, honesto y responsable. Son los valores que sus vecinos resaltan de el.
Necesita el crédito para la compra materias primas para la elaboración de productos, tales como cueros, hilos, etc. Cuenta que su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y hacer llegar las pelotas que hace por todo el país.
texts.en:
Nemesio is 26 years old and married with two children. He lives in his house in Carapeguá with his wife Tomasa. He makes balls, and his wife works as a domestic employee. He tells us that he learned his work from his father, with whom he worked for a long time, and he put it into practice at his young age.

Currently he sells his products around Asunción. He decided to pursue the same line of work because he has experience in it, and it also provides him with good earnings. He is a very hard-working, honest, and responsible man. These are the values that his neighbors emphasize about him.

He needs the loan to buy raw materials to make his products, such as leather, thread, etc. He says that his dream is to continue growing and to be able to sell the balls he makes all over the country.

loans.use: to purchase leather and thread to make balls

loans.name: Jwan

texts.en:
Jwan is 35 years old and a proud mother of four children. She is also a proud and successful Iraqi working woman. For the past three years, she has been working hard in her beauty salon. Her clients are very pleased with the service they receive. 

Jwan is requesting a loan of $2,400 from Relief International-Iraq to make some changes to her salon and improve the working area, which will allow her to hire an employee to work with her in the salon.

loans.use: to improve her salon and create a working area for a potential employee.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a married man. He has two children between 9 and 12 years old. He is an intelligent man. He operates a retail store where he sells home products and paraffin. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a densely populated area. He has both repeat and new customers. His biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more wheat flour, paraffin and cooking fat. Simon's business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour, paraffin and cooking fat

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es: El Grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Elsa tiene 29 años de edad, acompañada, con dos hijos y se dedica a comercializar frito de cerdo con tortillas, atol, tamales esa actividad la viene realizando desde hace 4 años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de carne de cerdo, maíz, leña, cal, hoja de chagüites etc. Martha vende platanitos y Teresa vende leña y tiene una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three entrepreneurial members. One of these is Ella. She is 29 years old, in a live-in relationship, with two children. She makes a living selling fried pork with tortillas, atol, and tamales. She has been performing this activity for four years. 

She will invest this loan in the purchase of pork, corn, firewood, lime, banana leaves, etc. Martha sells fried plantains and Teresa sells firewood and has a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of primary materials, pork, corn, firewood, lime, and banana leaves.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou  est  une  dame   mariée   qui  habite  dans  un  des   quartiers  du  Sénégal   depuis  longtemps. Elle est enseignante et  s’active  dans le secteur de   l’éducation depuis un an. Parallèlement  elle exerce une activité avicole et s’adonne a l’élevage de poussins destiné a la vente de poulets de chair.  Elle a déjà remboursé 2 crédits antérieurs et sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour le renforcement d’activité d’aviculture. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de renforcer son épargne.

loans.use: acheter des poussins et de l'aliment de bétail pour son aviculture

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 37 years old, an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her husband is hawker by trade. He sells newspapers and magazines on a daily basis. He is the only one responsible for earning for the entire household.

Fatima's husband needs to buy newspapers and magazines to fulfill the demand of his daily customers but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to buy this merchandise for his business purposes. Therefore his wife Fatima has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she can financially assist her husband to buy the newspapers and magazines for reselling purposes, so that he can fulfill the demand of his customers and earn more profitable income.

For this financial support Fatima is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy newspapers and magazines in bulk

loans.name: Nonvigbe Reforme Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGBE REFORME est un groupe composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Noëlie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 34 ans. Noëlie est mariée à un conducteur du nom de Moukala. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Noëlie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Noëlie et son mari. Pour cette raison, Noëlie vend des ustensiles de cuisine par la technique de distribution depuis sept ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Noëlie s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Noëlie sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe NONVIGBE REFORME, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des ustensiles de cuisines.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 46 years old. He is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. He owns a guest house and also does agriculture to supplement his income. He grows mainly maize, beans and coffee because they have a higher demand. He will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer and to assist with a coffee plantation that they want to start. He hopes to maintain the crop well in order to get better production and therefore have better income.

In the future, he hopes he can give his family a better quality of life, better economic stability, and that he can continue growing as a person and a producer.

This is the first loan he will receive from UGAFODE. He has never had any other loans from other banks. UGAFODE has promised him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings.

loans.name: Nua Ngam 18 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Tinh, 28, is Lao ethnic woman who has been married and become the mother of a boy and a girl at the age of 9 and 6. They live together happily in a stilt house at a small remote village where agriculture is the main income generating activity. Like other villagers, Mrs. Tinh and her husband work very hard at farming and animal husbandry with plenty of activities such as growing rice, corn, cassava, breeding pig, buffalo, chicken, and fish. Her husband sometimes works for the construction employer to earn extra income and support the family better. Mrs. Tinh has always wanted to develop production in a sustainable way, so she has taken out loans at the Anh Chi Em Program to have enough capital to expand agricultural production. She also frequently receives training and counselling from the agricultural workers of the Program, so she is well aware of the necessity of having pigsty when raising pigs. For that reason, recently she has taken out a loan from Anh Chi Em to build pigsty. She hopes that with the pigsty, the pigs will grow fast and healthily then help her reap good profit and gradually improve income as well as living standard for her family. Mrs. Tinh dreams that her children will study well, enter good college, have a good job, then escape from poverty. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to build pigsty

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en: Mi nombre es Lidia C. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo personal y adornos para el hogar, tengo mi negocio hace 5 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicada en una zona muy transitada, actividad que me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor venta y con las ganancias que obtenga poder darles los estudios a mis tres hijos y mantener mi familia.

loans.use: compra de jarrones, adornos, floreros, esmaltes, sombras, locion, perfumes, desodorantes, cremas, alcancias, cadenas, aritos, ganchos, colas.

loans.name: Bich

texts.en:
Bich is 24 years old and her husband, Binh, is 25. They have a 2 year-old child. The family has no land aside from their home.

To support his family, Binh is a laborer in his village. Bich takes care of their child and sells groceries from home. Because of their low income, only $7-10/person/month, Bich is finding it difficult to keep her grocery store operating.

With a loan of $75 she will be abL. to buy tables, chairs, and other goods that she will then sell from her store. She will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Bich wants a loan to purchase some tables and chairs, and other goods to sell at her home.

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir A. lives in Beylagan. He is 45 years old. He owns a food market in the center of Beylagan. He has been in the food business for 10 years. In 2006 he built his own food market. He has been a client of Normicro since 2005, borrowing $400 in 2005 and $1000 in 2006. He says he owes his success to these timely loans, which were immensely helpful. Now he is asking for a $1200 loan to expand the range of goods he offers for sale.

loans.use: To expand range of goods offered for sale

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: Shahnoza R. and her husband sell gold jewelry made locally. Their business is located at the central market where they have a trading place. Shahnoza buys goods from local producers and her husband helps at the market. The demand for her goods is high because Tajiks traditionally give gold jewelry for different family events. However, the business is difficult because products are expensive and the profits are not large. A year ago, Shahnoza received a loan from Microinvest that allowed her to purchase more jewelry to sell. Now she is requesting a loan of $1200 to finance new stock.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Ragif

texts.en:
Mr. Ragif is a vulnerable, low income person.  He is 25 and lives with his parents in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Every week Ragif sells bulls and cows in the local market and then uses the profit to buy calves.  He breeds them in his cow-shed and in half a year sells them in the market again.  Now he wants to make an investment into his business to increase the profit.  That is why Ragif has applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $500 loan to buy one more cow to make his monthly income higher.  In the Caucasus region the price of a calf is about $100, but in half a year, the price of a breeded bull goes up to $500.

loans.use: To purchase a calf to expand his business

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en:
Kwaku was proud to see the birth of his first child just last week. He is working hard to support his new family and hopes to receive a loan to expand his business. Kwaku sells clothing and polyester. He wishes to expand his stock by purchasing 65 new bundles of polyester. Polyester is commonly used as lining for Ghanaian dresses. With the profit he makes, he is hoping to expand his stall at the local Kumasi market.

His business has already seen a lot of growth in the past couple of years. He has made many connections with distributors and customers around town. He hopes in the future to use these connections to build a successful business in order to spend more time with his family.

loans.use: Purchase 65 bundles of polyester

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
Shavkat F. lives in the B.Gafurov region in Tajikistan. He processes meat and milk products, which he sells in the bazaars. He dreams of purchasing the pedigree horn cattle to increase the meat and milk products. He plans to increase the variety of products, such as meat products, pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, and curd.

Shavkat F. became a client of MicroInvest in 2007, and has a stable business. Now he requests a loan of 2000 TJS (about $600) to purchase the pedigree milk cows, which would allow him to significantly increase the variety of products he sells, and his family's income.

loans.use: Purchase pedigree milk cows

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Mr. K. Saret and his wife Mrs. Chek Ouch have been married in 1959. They have three children—one son and two daughters. All of his children are married and living separate house. Saret and his family are living on an island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. He and his wife are in the business of doing farming since 1973.Currently, he is growing ginger in his farm in the village.  

Saret is requesting his fifth loan with the amount $200. He will use this money for growing ginger.

loans.use: For growing ginger

loans.name: Rajabali

texts.ru:
Rajabali H. lives in Rudaki. He is 40 years old and is married with 4 children. He raises livestock and brings in additional money by providing repair services. These are main sources of income for his family. Rajabali applied for a loan to use it to expand his livestock: he plans to purchase the calves in February, when the prices are low. He will fatten them and will sell them in the spring at a higher price. He is planning to repay his loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Худжаев Раджабали проживает в районе Рудаки, 40 лет , женат имеет 4 детей.Занимается животноводством, а также зарабатывает деньги путем оказания ремонтных услуг.Это основные источники дохода его семьи. Данный кредит клиент запрашивает на животноводство. Он планирует на эти деньги купить двух бычков подешевле,т.к в феврале цены на животных падают в связи с нехваткой корма.Это даст возможность выиграть в цене и продать бычков весной по более выгодной цене. Запрашиваемый кредит планирует погасить в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of calves

loans.name: María Del Refugio

texts.es:
Unfortunately, Maria del Refugio suffers from advanced diabetes and can not work in a company because sometimes she feels very ill. That is why she decided to start her own business in order not to be a burden to her husband.

Moreover, Maria has 6 children and she needs to contribute to the household’s income as her husband’s salary is not enough to sustain them.

Maria sells food and groceries. She started in 2000 selling her food on a small wooden table and 3 different types of meals. Now she has a better stand outside of her house.

Now Maria would like her business to grow even more. Therefore, she requests a loan of $475 that she will pay in 6 months. With this money, Maria will buy more merchandise for her business. With your help, Maria will be able to bring up her family and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Desgraciadamente María Del Refugio padece de diabetes, enfermedad que ya tiene avanzada y por la cual no puede mantener un trabajo en empresa puesto que en muchas ocasiones se siente muy mal. Es por eso que decidió comenzar su propio negocio para no ser una carga para su esposo.

Además de que María tiene 6 hijos a los cuales tienen que mantener y con lo que gana su esposo no es suficiente. María vende comidas y abarrotes fuera de una empresa. Comenzó en el 2000 con una pequeña mesa de madera y tres guisos. Actualmente ya tiene un establecimiento más elaborado fuera de su casa.

Sin embargo María desea crecer más su negocio. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar mercancía para tener bien surtido su negocio. Con tu ayuda María logrará sacar adelante su negocio y a sus 6 hijos.

loans.use: Maria will buy more merchandise for her food and groceries business

loans.name: Mosumola

texts.en: Mosumola L. sells notebooks, textbooks, and greeting cards in her bookshop not too far from Iyano – Ajangbandi community in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 48 years old with 4 children,  two of whom assist her in the shop. She acquired her skill in a year and has been in this business since 2003. She needs a loan of $875 to buy more books and textbooks to sell. She says "thank you!"

loans.use: To buy more notebooks & textbooks for sale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata K. is thankful to Kiva for her previous loan of $200, as her family's income increased. Before the loan, she was hawking door to door, but with the loan she is now able to rent a place in the market and sell her palm oil. She can provide for her family’s needs more than before. Fatmata is the only breadwinner as her husband is unemployed. To expand her business, Fatmata is requesting an additional loan to purchase 90 gallons of palm oil. With this amount, Fatmata believes that she will generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase 90 gallons of palm oil to increase her stock.

loans.name: Ahmirza

texts.en: Ahmirza U. lives the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan with his wife and five children. As is the case with many of his fellow villagers, he raises livestock for a llving. He owns cows, bulls and several rams, and earns his income from selling their milk and meat. Because he has been in this line of work for 40 years, he is very experienced at what he does.  He also occasionally works at the local collective farm. Mr. U. has applied to Kiva for a loan to open up a shop from which to sell his goods.  He will repay the loan in six months.

loans.use: to open a shop.

loans.name: Gagau

texts.en:
Gagau L., 42, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in the taro / banana business. She sells to the village community and relatives and also at the public market 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Gagau L.’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will spend the whole amount of her loan to replace all equipment for her project. Her husband is always the backbone of her project.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, insect sprayer, bushknife, shovel

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
MarieL. is a member of the communal bank “Nobleza”.

MarieL. mentions that, through training, she learned how to invest her money and how to educate her children.

MarieL. is partnered, is 23-years old, and has one child. MarieL. lives with her parents. MarieL. sells meat from a stand in the Central market in the city of Ayacucho. She buys the animals at the markets in the region, where her husband travels to three times per week. They rent transportation and sell their meats in the municipality.

MarieL. needs a loan of 1,000 soles, funds that she will invest into the purchase of pigs and goats.

MarieL. dreams of buying land on which to build a house, of her son becoming a professional, and of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

MarieL. Es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza,

MarieL. menciona que a través D. las capacitaciones aprendió a como invertir su dinero y como educar a sus hijos.

MarieL. es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, MarieL. vive en L. casa D. sus padres. MarieL. venD. carne en un puesto del mercado Central D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho, los animales los compra en las ferias D. L. región a donD. viaja su esposo 3 veces por semana, el transporte lo realiza en carros alquilados, los animales los beneficia en el camal municipal.

MarieL. necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. ganado porcino y caprino.

MarieL. sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casa, que su hijo sea profesional y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Mariela needs a loan of 1,000 soles, funds that she will invest into the purchase of pigs and goats.

loans.name: Cidlia

texts.es:
La señora Cidlia es socia del BC “CORAZON DE JESUS”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia del Dorado y distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de útiles de oficina, adornos y celulares, complementa el negocio con la venta de cosméticos de la marca Esika. Se inició con un capital de S/. 300 en un local alquilado y sólo contaba con mesa, silla y una vitrina.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,300 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 04 meses, comprará colonias, talcos, desodorantes, esmaltes, cremas, lentes en docenas, celulares y otros útiles que necesita para surtir bien el negocio y contar con lo necesario para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Cidlia tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene dos hijos que son estudiantes, quienes la ayudan en atender el negocio. Es una persona amable, positiva y trabajadora. Piensa que no hay barreras si uno tiene las ganas de hacer las cosas bien y salir adelante. Su meta es surtir más el negocio y comprar una casita para que no pague local y así poder apoyar a su esposo en la economía de la casa.
texts.en:
Señora Cidlia is a member of the community bank "Corazon de Jesus" (Heart of Jesus). She lives in the region of San Martín, in the province of Dorado, and in the district of San José de Sisa. She is dedicated to the sales of office supplies, ornaments, and cell phones. She complements this business with the sales of cosmetics from the brand of Esika. She began with a capital of 300 Soles in a rented site and worked with just a table, chair, and a display case. With the loan of 1300 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy talcs, deodorants, nail polishes, creams, dozens of glasses, cell phones, and other supplies that she needs to give her business a good boost and satisfy the needs of her clients. Cidlia is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and has two children who are students and help her with the business. She is a friendly, positive, and hard working person. She thinks that there are no barriers if one has the desire to do things well and move forward. Her goal is to increase her business and buy a little house so that she won't have to pay to rent her business space and in this way be able to support her husband in meeting the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy talcs, deodorants, nail polishes, creams, glasses, etc.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Siliga

texts.en: Siliga I., 23, is married with 4 children. She has 2 years of experience in the Elei business. She sells to the public and village people 6 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Siliga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be use to repair her house. Her husband also works to help out with the financial support.

loans.use: Buy printing board, stencials, paints, brushes, rollers also material, bricks, cement, iron roofing and timber for home improvements

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly P. is a farmer in Tonle Village in Takeo Province. In her plantation, she now faces an obstacle because of infertile soil. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Ly P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Ses Sarin, helps out with his wife's plantation.

Mrs. Ly P. is 51 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr:
Madame W. Adjoa est née le 31 décembre 1978 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de friperie et de pagne. Elle s’approvisionne au marché local de Hédzranawoé et au grand marché de Lomé. Cette activité qu’elle a commencée depuis 2004 lui procure beaucoup de revenu.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter demi ballot de friperie et 12 pièces de pagne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adjoa W. was born on December 31, 1978 in Lomé. She is married and has two children. Her main business is selling used clothing and pagnes (colorful African cloth). She gets her supplies from the local market in Hédzranawoé and Lomé’s main market. The business, which she began in 2004, generates considerable income for her. This first-time loan she is requesting will enable her to buy a half-bundle of used clothing and 12 pieces of “pagne" cloth.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing and "pagne" cloth

loans.name: Mrs. Dara Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people who live in Srae Kouyk village in Kandal Province comprise the village bank. Mrs. Dara T. is the village bank president. She owns a small restaurant where she sells breakfast in the local school. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy plates, spoons, tables, and so on for her current business. Her husband, Mr. Pao Sokhum, is an air conditioner repairer. Mrs. Dara T. is 27 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study.

This is a group loan. Two members have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest of have monthly payment loans. Members with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy plates, spoons, tables and so on for her current business.

loans.name: Daed

texts.en:
Daed is a 52 year old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, a southern suburb of Lebanon with her husband. Daed has been working as a home product salesperson for three years. She sells medicine, cosmetics and cleaning products. Daed does well because she is motivated and wants to open a clothing shop. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others.  When she first started her business, she had difficulties getting clients but she has no problems now. Daed decided on opening her own business because she has always liked working. In the future, she plans on expanding her business and opening a clothing shop
. 
Daed has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for her work. This is the first time that Daed has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena A. is a 25 year old single woman and mother with two children. One is in school and one is a baby.  Abena lives with her family in Abofour.  She sells home products like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates and she has  recently added the sale of bananas to her stock. She makes her sales by ‘hawking’, which is door to door sales in the community. Abena is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to pay for school fees to give her children a brighter future. Abena is asking for a loan of $450 to increase her stock of plastic materials, kitchen sets and bananas to serve her customers. She believes that with the loan she can save enough to rent a store from which to sell her wares. Abena belongs to a village bank called ‘Chance’.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of plastic materials, kitchen sets and bananas.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Margarita es conviviente, tiene 58 años y 1 hijo, Margarita tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, helados, tarjetas telefónicas, gas, también tiene teléfono publico, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Margarita necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de útiles escolares.
Margarita sueña con implementar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Violeta communal bank. She lives with her common-law husband, is 58 years old and has 1 son. Margarita has a convenience store in her house where she sells groceries, ice cream, phone cards, gas and also has a public telephone. She works every day. Margarita needs a loan for 1000 soles which she will use to buy school supplies. She dreams of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es: Verónica tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su pareja hace 14 años y es madre de dos hijas. Desde muy jovencita se dedicaba a los tejidos, arte heredado de su padre y que con mucha perseverancia le ha permitido ser una mujer autosuficiente en su economía. Por ello, cuando la abandonó su primera pareja supo cubrir los gastos de su casa; pero ahora el amor le ha vuelto a sonreír, y desde entonces la felicidad se quedo en su hogar. Ambos producen frazadas y ponchos, a la semana realizan de 4 a 5, y últimamente está teniendo pedidos de otra ciudad. Pero Verónica no depende solo de los pedidos, sino que cada cierta temporada ella viaja con sus prendas a los lugares donde son mejor cotizados, y esto convierte su actividad en un negocio rentable. Por ello está muy feliz, su meta inmediata es hacer entablar el piso de su casa, para que trabajen abrigados durante las madrugadas. Verónica es una cliente que no tuvo problemas de pago en sus créditos anteriores, este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, su dificultad es que por estar de viaje en la venta de sus productos ha faltado a algunas reuniones de su banco comunal, pero siempre deja alguien encargado para que realice su pago y le informe de lo convenido. El dinero que solicita ahora es para la compra de pellejos de carnero, para la elaboración de frazadas.
texts.en:
Verónica is 33 years old, lives with her significant other of 14 years and is the mother of two daughters. Since she was very young Verónica has been knitting, an art that she inherited from her father and with much perseverance has made her a financially self-sufficient woman. For that reason, when she left her first significant other she knew how to cover the cost of her house. Now love has returned and made her smile again and since her home has been happy.

Both Verónica and her significant other produce blankets and ponchos, completing between 4 and 5 each week. Recently she has had orders for her products from another city. But Verónica does not only depend on orders, with each season she travels with her products to the areas where they are most sought-after, and this makes her business profitable. For that she is very happy and her immediate goal is to construct the floor of her home so that she and her significant other can work in the mornings in warmer conditions.

Verónica is a client that has not had problems paying back her previous loans, this is her 3rd loan with MFP. Her difficulty is that she travels to sell her products and has missed some meetings of her communal bank. But she always leaves someone in charge of making her payments and is informed of what happened. The money that she solicits now is for the purchase of sheepskin to make blankets.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sheepskin.

loans.name: Kimlun

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimlun S., 35, is single and lives on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has living with her, two brothers who attend school and one sister who is a silk weaver. Besides her brothers and sister she also has one aunt living with her.

Kimlun has been a silk weaver since she was fourteen years old. It is a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished product to the middleman who then takes it to sell at market in Phnom Penh.

Kimlun is asking for a loan of $250 to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 39 years old and lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. He has been working in electrical repairs for 23 years, mending electrical motors, agricultural tools and other electrical products. Ali went into this line of business because of his experience and his desire for independence in his work. At first, he had difficulty networking, but today he is successful because he does a good job for his customers, who are his friends, neighbors and other local people.

Ali requested a loan of $1000 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña María T. cuenta con 52 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios Comerciante, “Compra y venta de ropa típica” cuenta con un negocio de , habita junto a  sus 3 hijos, ella y sus hijos se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 12 años de vender Ropa Típica en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Paxocol del Cantón Paquí , del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y tener mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
María T. is a 52-year-old single merchant, saying she "buys and sells typical clothing." She lives with her three children, and they all make a living in the same trade. María has 12 years experience selling clothes from her home in Paraje Paxocol del Cantón Paquí, department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently the demand from her clientele is growing, but with the economic conditions she's unable to increase her capital, which is why she has turned to Kiva partner Asociación ASDIR. She is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials for her business and in this way increase her sales. She's also hoping to make headway for her children and improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes to increase her inventory

loans.name: Houdada

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur est un jardinier, il fait aussi  la culture des fleurs, il est sollicité pour  arranger, tailler ou implanter des jardins publiques et  privés. En ce moment il a besoin de certains produits nécessaires à son activité de jardinage. N’ayant jamais obtenu de WAGES, il sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter 06 sacs de NPK, 04n sacs d’urée, 04 boîtes de carotte, 02 litres de deltacal, 04 kg de mémacur, 01 litre d’agri-stomp, 01 pulvérisateur.
Il est marié et a 01 enfant, c’est avec le revenu de son activité de jardinage qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a gardener. He also grows flowers. People seek him out to arrange, shape, or plant public and private gardens. At the moment, he has need of certain products necessary for his gardening business. Never having had a WAGES loan, he's requesting his first loan to buy six sacks of NPK, four sacks of urea, four containers of carrots, two liters of deltacal, four kilos of mémacur, a liter of agri-stomp, and a sprayer. He is married and has a child. The revenues from his gardening business is what supports his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy NPK, urea, deltaca, mémacur, and other gardening products

loans.name: Vany Manuel

texts.es: Vany Manuel R. C. tiene la edad de 40 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 5 hijos a su cargo y con muchos sacrificios todos estudian. La actividad económica es la venta de pescado. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios se dan por que Vany no poseía un trabajo para mantener a su familia, por lo que decide instruirse en el en la pesca artesanal, por lo que no fue nada fácil ya que el no poseía conocimientos de pesca pero el deseo de superación y salir adelante le ayudaron con su trabajo. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de pescado como pargo, curvina, camarones y chuletas entre otras cosas. Su deseo es conseguir un lugar donde pueda ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Vany Manuel R. C. is forty years old. He is married and has five children that he supports. With much sacrifice, the children are all able to study. Vany has been selling fish for twenty years. In the beginning Vany did not earn enough to support his family. This is why he decided to focus on specialty fish. It wasn’t easy because he did not know a lot about fish. His drive and the desire to succeed helped his business. The purpose of this loan is to allow him to purchase fish such as porgy, corvine and shrimp as well as other things. He wishes to find a place to sell his products.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.en:
Z. Hikmatullo has been selling cattle, together with his father (pictured), for more than four years. This has helped him move on in his business. Hikmatullo is married and lives with his parents. He has no children yet but is already working hard in order to improve his family's standard of living and be ready to fulfill a father's responsibilities. One of his main needs is to purchase cattle in order to improve his business. For this reason, Hikmatullo requested a loan of $600 USD from Kiva partner, IMON International. Not only will his business benefit from it, but so will his family. Your support will really help him.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Okyeso Nyame Group

texts.en:
Mercy is 38 years old. She is a married woman with three boys. All her children are in school. She is a baker who has used flour for her production for eight years now. She bakes bread and retails it to her customers. She supplies them by herself in the market center, and people also take bulk delivery bread from her. Her only problem now has to do with inadequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are going up. She requests loan support to remain in business. With the loan, she believes she can provide for her family and, most especially, for her children's education.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called "Okyeso Nyame," which means "God of Abundance." She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, and firewood

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia R., from the village of Landing, Camella Talakag Bukidnon, is a 41-year-old married mother of eight school-aged children. To make a living, Eufemia owns and operates a specialized retail store that sells a variety of vegetable products including string beans, potatoes, squash and others in the local community. Eufemia has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Eufemia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: George Thuita

texts.en:
George is married and has a business partner.

George's loan is an asset loan and he has no loans from other MFI's. He was introduced to KADET by other KADET members.

He plans to use the loan to buy another motorcycle which he uses to transport people. His aim is to use the extra revenue generated from this loan to purchase a plot of land so he can build rental houses.

George believes that he is hardworking and his hopes and dreams are to support his siblings so that they can be self reliant and uplift their living standards.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: The client will use the loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Louange Limonade Group

texts.en:
The “Louange Limonade” or “Praise of Limonade” Group is a made of twenty male and female entrepreneurs. They are all excited about expanding their current businesses with the reception of their firS. loan. The group has a variety of businesses from cosmetics to clothes and from seasonal items such as notebooks to ice in both large and small amounts. Nelcia G.  is one of four representatives of the group. She is a 36yr old wife and mother to three children.
Nelcia is very in touch with her community and accordingly varies her merchandise with seasons. She has a few staple products that she knows her clients always need, including sugar, flour, rice and oil. With the opening of school she said she will stock up on notebooks and other supplies for children going to school. She hopes to be able to grow her business and create more financial security for her family. On behalf of Nelcia, Louange, and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: notebooks, pens, pencils, sugar, oil, rice, flour

loans.name: Jesica

texts.en:
Jessica, 45, lives in the simple village of Baculud, Amulung, Cagayan. She is happily married to Joel, a farmer in their village. They are blessed with two children: Jhon Joel, age seven, a second grader and Ayannah Marie a six year old kindergarten student.

Jessica manages a sari-sari store (community based store) in their village. Due to lack of capital, she is asking for financial support from KIVA lenders to maintain her business. She would like to borrow at least PHP13,000 to purchase stocks for her store like rice, soft drinks, canned and bottled goods, noodles, soap and other basic commodities. Through hard work and the help of lenders, Jessica dreams of becoming successful in business.

She also hopes that her children will continue and finish their studies so they have a bright future. By helping each other and with her husband, Jessica knows it will come true.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
La socia Manuela; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; UBICADOS EN EL DISTRITO DE Andahuaylillas a 5 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 55 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 1 hijo , la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años, al engorde de ganado vacuno, y a la venta de pasto, también nuestra socia cría cuyes, aves de corral, chanchos; la socia  también tiene un terreno el cual lo alquila o lo da en anticresis para invertir ese dinero y comprar mas animalitos para la venta, nuestra socia a su vez vende leche de vaca fresca cerca de 15 litros al día o en un par de días, ella lleva a  ofrecer a diferentes lugares donde ella ya tiene sus caseros (personas que la conocen y siempre le compran). Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en la compra de  más animales vacunos o de animales menores.

La socia agradece el préstamo que se le otorgara para hacer crecer su negocio y así seguir prosperando.
texts.en:
Manuela is a member of the "LAS TRIUNFADORAS" communal bank which is located in the Andahuaylillas district which is 5 minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 55 years old, married, and has one son. She alternates her household chores with retail sales. For the past 10 years she has been involved in cattle raising and fodder sales. She also raises guinea pigs, barnyard fowl and pigs. In addition, she owns a parcel of land which she leases out or takes in tenant farmers using the income to buy additional small beasts to raise and sell. Manuela also sells about 15 liters of fresh cow's milk daily or every couple of days. She sells to her regular customers. She requests financing to buy more cattle or small farm animals. She is grateful for the loan that will be granted for it helps her business grow and continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle and small farm animals.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
La señora Jenny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mariscalense”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 61 años y 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando, y es el orgullo, para seguir trabajando.

Jenny, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a ofrecer productos de belleza de la línea Avon,  de un familiar. Poco a poco, fue ahorrando y generando  su propio capital, así de esta manera decidió implementar su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos, con el que en la actualidad continua, pero ya siendo de ella misma y contando con un local propio muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, que día a día van a su local.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo seguirá formando su propia red de representantes de la línea Avon.

Jenny, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Jenny is a member of the Mariscalense Communal Bank, which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 61 years old, single, and the mother of one dependent child who is attending school. She is proud that she is able to continue working.

Jenny is a woman who has overcome many difficulties throughout her life. She offers beauty products from the Avon line, a well-known brand. Little by little, she generated and saved her own capital, and eventually decided to open her own business selling cosmetics. Jenny continues to manage her business to this day, but now she has her own location that is suited for welcoming customers who come by her shop day after day to shop.

With her loan of 2500 soles, Jenny will buy beauty products to add to her inventory such as perfumes for women and men, crèmes, pressed powders, lipsticks, and nail polishes. She also continues to provide support to her own network of Avon representatives.

Jenny has become a mature role model for other women who want to start a business. With perseverance, she was able to achieve her dreams. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her own business and supporting other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products to add to her inventory

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 44-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Khalil has been working as a hairdresser since 2004. He also offers beauty products and beauty treatments like manicure and pedicure, hair removal, and makeup. Khalil requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase beauty products for his salon. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him improve his work, and consequently his financial situation. 
Khalil is special in his work because he knows how to treat his client and is open every day of the week, even during holidays. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Khalil decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by opening a second salon.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for his salon.

loans.name: Martha Lizeth

texts.es:
