la Joven. MARTHA LIZETH A. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con un pequeño negocio denominado "MARTHA's BOUTIQUE" tiene mas 2 años dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y durante todo
este tiempo le ha ido muy bien, esta soltera y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres a los que apoya  con algunos gastos en el hogar.
Actualmente es pasante universitaria en la carrera de Pedagogia a la que asiste a distancia los fines de semana, es una muchacha emprendedora con deseos de superacion, en su negocio tiene un bonito surtido de prendas a la moda y a un buen precio. 
nos solicita el credito para surtir mas su negocio ya que se aproxima la temporada de mayor venta del año.
su meta a corto plazo es poder graduarse de la universidad.
texts.en:
The young lady MARTHA LIZETH A. is an entrepreneur. She has a small business called “MARTHA’S BOUTIQUE”. She has been working in this business for the last 2 years, and during this time, it’s done very well. She is single, with no children, and lives with her parents whom she helps with some of the household expenses. Currently she is a student pending graduation at the university. She studies Education online on the weekends. She is a hardworking girl with the goals of getting ahead. In her business she has a nice assortment of stylish clothing at a good price. She is asking for a loan to stock up more for her business since this is the season of the highest sales of the year. Her aim is to graduate from the university in the near future.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for women and men, hangers, pony tail holders, and cosmetics

loans.name: Nicasio Gustavo

texts.es:
Nicasio E. de 51 años de edad, tiene una casa de cemento con dos servicios básicos que son agua y luz no cuenta con alcantarillado, su casa esta ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, Nicasio comenzó su negocio con la idea de un amigo que pusiera una tapicería de muebles porque no había en el sector este servicio y el le ayudaría con el primer ingreso.

Ahora Nicasio trabaja laqueando y tapizando muebles desde las 08h00 hasta las 19h00, una de las mayores complicaciones en su negocio son los ladrones, la esposa trabaja con el ayudándole a coser los muebles, tiene hijos pero ya son mayores de edad.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar 200 metros de tela, 400 armazones y 200 esponjas, en el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio de tapizado para asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Nicasio E. is 51 years old and has a cement house with two basic services, water and light, but no plumbing. His house is located in the outskirts of Guayaquil. Nicasio began his business with an idea from a friend who pointed out that there was no furniture upholstery store in that part of the city. His friend helped with the first payment. Now Nicasio works lacquering and upholstering furniture from 8am to 7pm. One the major challenges faced by his business is thieves. His wife works with him sewing the furniture. They have two grown up children. With the loan, he would like to buy 200 meters of fabric, 400 frames and 200 pieces of foam. In the future he would like to increase his upholstery business to secure the future of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fabric, frames and foam

loans.name: Kireku Group, Mukono

texts.en:
Joselyne K. is a hard-working and devoted married woman. She is a businesswoman with a retail shop in Kireku that she has owned for eight years. From her sales, Joselyne is able to make 80,000/= (Ugandan shillings) in profit each week and these help to restock her shop with more goods and to pay her children's school fees. She has six children who are all in school. 

Joselyne dreams of expanding her shop further to have more stock so she can make more reasonable profits. This is her second loan and she is grateful for the positive contribution that the first loan made to her shop.

loans.use: Restock her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Qasr-E- Kabul Number 2 Group

texts.en:
Bibi Sanam is the group leader of Qasr-e- Kabul Number 2 group. There are four members in this group. Bibi Sanam is a married woman with three children. She wants to use her loan for purchasing a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

Bibi Sadaf wants to take a loan for her husband’s business, which is a battery-charging shop. He wants to buy necessary materials for his business. 

Norya wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of selling vegetables from a cart. He needs money to buy a new shop for the business. 

Also, Mansor wants to take a loan for his business. He has a bicycle-repair shop. He is confident that after the loan he will be able to work in a better way and will support all his family members.

They requested a group loan of 56000 Afghani. They would like to mention the effectiveness of the Kiva process and its effect on their business progress.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: Sohkna

texts.en: Sohkna N.'s business revolves around importing goods from neighboring Gambia. She purchases porcelains, men's clothing, and shoes and brings them back with her to her home town of Diourbel. Ms. N. received an initial loan from a local women's solidarity group, FDEA, which had helped get her business started. Despite her divorce, she says she has managed to take care of her five children as God has supported her throughout. With the loan of 100,000 Francs, Ms. N. plans to travel again to Gambia to continue her trade. Ms. N. lives in the Ndayane neighborhood of Diourbel, a town about 150 km from Dakar. The voyage from Diourbel to the Gambian border takes about four hours, passing through many small villages along the way.

loans.use: Importing porcelain and clothing

loans.name: Mrs. Thuok Uon Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nineteen people who live in Mreah Prov village in Takeo province make up the village bank loan and they will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Thuok U. is the village bank president. She was selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Heng Lorng, is a construction laborer. This family has a problem because their house is too old to live, but they do not have money to build. Thus, in order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Thuok U. decided to ask for a loan to buy timber to construct her house. She is the mother of five children. One child is employed in garment factory, three attend the local public school, and one is too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy timber to construct her house

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a produce dealer, operating his business from Karuguuza, Uganda. Besides selling produce, he also sells local brew which he makes.

A breadwinner for his family of seven people, Joseph is married to a peasant farmer and has been dealing in produce and local brew for the last ten years. He wishes to educate his children up to university level and intends to buy a motor vehicle in the future so as to market his produce and local brew easily.

The purpose of this loan is to buy maize to sell and for making local brew.

loans.use: To buy maize to sell and for making local brew

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo S., aged 53, is widowed and resides with her six children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business sewing and designing clothes, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family's expenses. The family is also assisted by four of the children who are currently employed at different workplaces. Their standard of living has improved since Keo S. and her children have had these businesses.

Keo S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase supplies and equipment as a chef for ceremonial occasions. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner. (Keo S. is pictured with her daughter and her grandchild.)

loans.use: To buy kitchen supplies to start a new business as a chef

loans.name: Jackeline Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Jackeline del Rosario B. Z., tiene 28 años de edad es casada y su esposo es mecánico, ellos tienen 3 hijos pequeños y que dependen económicamente de ellos, ellos habitan en el Barrio Los Martinez.

Los planes de la familia son las mejorías continuas a su hogar, para el bienestar de sus hijos, pero uno de los principales problemas que los agobian continuamente, es la escases de agua potable que no abastece a su comunidad, ellos tienen un pequeño taller mecánico y dentro de los planes esta la remodelación de su negocio,  es por esta razón que solicitan de un préstamo para la compra  de materiales de construcción, que favorezcan las comodidades del negocio a prestar mejores condiciones para su clientela, esto apoyara económicamente a los ingresos de la familia favoreciendo las condiciones para futuros proyectos familiares, asi mismo la recuperación de sus niveles de vida.
texts.en:
Jackeline del Rosario B. Z. is 28 years old and married. Her husband is a mechanic and they have three dependent children. The family lives in the Los Martinez neighborhood. The family plans to make continual improvements to their home for the well-being of their children. One of the persistent problems that they face is a lack of potable water in their community. They have a small automotive repair business and among their plans is to remodel their shop. They will use this loan to purchase the necessary construction materials to make their shop more comfortable so they can offer better service to their customers. This will increase the family's economic resources which will support their plans for future projects and improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodeling of their business

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El comité de nombre Santa Lucia se conformó en fecha 17 de noviembre de 2.008, con 18 mujeres todas amigas y vecinas, quienes se encuentran trabajando en el 5º ciclo todas ellas  muy contentas con el programa.
Se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como venta de frutas y verduras, venta de carnes, venta de golosinas, venta de canasto, venta de ropas, venta de gallinas y huevos, venta de mandioca, venta de comestibles, venta de carbón, etc.
La señora Justina solicita un préstamo para la compra de gallinas, ella anteriormente realizaba otro trabajo pero como no le fue bien quiere dedicarse a la venta de gallinas.
Ella desea implementar la venta de gallinas faenadas y lo ofrecería en los negocios del  barrio al principio, luego desea contar con sus propio gallinero para criar, engordar y vender ella misma ya este procedimiento le dejaría mayor ganancia.
Agradece por la oportunidad que le Brinda la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva mediante el préstamo y se compromete en dedicarse al máximo a su trabajo.
texts.en:
The Santa Lucia Communal Bank was formed on November 17th, 2008, with 18 women. They are all friends and neighbors. They are working in their fifth cycle, and they are all very happy with the program. They work at different activities like selling fruits and vegetables, selling meat, selling sweets, selling large baskets, and selling charcoal, etc. Justina is requesting a loan to buy chickens. She previously did other work, but because it did not go well for her, she wants to work selling chicken. She wishes to establish a business selling slaughtered chickens. At first she would sell to the neighborhood businesses. Then, she wants to have her own henhouse to raise, fatten, and sell the chicken herself. This will leave her with greater income. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan offered by the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, and she promises to devote herself to the maximum in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens

loans.name: Ayda Luz

texts.es:
La señora Ayda Luz G. R., es madre soltera de dos hijas adolecentes, ella tiene la edad de 44 años, se gana la vida como docente desde hace 5 años, permitiéndoles una mejor educación a sus sucesoras.

Su hogar es una morada humilde que limita el buen vivir, por la falta de comodidades que posee, es por tal razón que la señora Ayda solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción y puerta de madera que mejoren la fachada de la casa, las condiciones de techo y paredes de su hogar, esta inversión le brindará a la señora G. la satisfacción necesaria de poder ofrecerle a sus hijas, un lugar digno donde habitar, debido a  que por las edades que poseen le demandan mejores condiciones socio-económicas que preocupan día a día a su madre.
texts.en:
Ayda Luz G. R., 44, is a single mother of two adolescent girls; she has earned her livelihood as a teacher for the last 5 years making a better education possible for her heirs. Her home is a humble dwelling that limits their quality of life because it lacks many comforts. Because of this, Ayda is asking for funds to buy building materials and supplies as well as a wood door that will improve the façade of the house, the roof and its walls. This investment will provide Mrs. G. with the satisfaction of offering her daughters a proper place to live, something their mother worries about daily, especially now that they are at an age when they are asking for better socio-economic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her home's façade.

loans.name: G.s. Salmo 91 Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario compuesto por dos personas, tienen 3 créditos y es uno de los grupos muy responsables con sus cuotas. Natividad Ivette vende  mercadería en general como ropa, cosméticos, zapatos desde hace 20 años, tiene 44 años de edad y junto a su esposo se han esforzado para sacar adelante la familia, ya que es una de sus prioridades es que su hijos logren salir adelante, solicita un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima del negocio, ella vende su producto en sus comarcas. La señora Marta Lorena también vende mercadería en general, realiza la compra de sus productos en el mercado oriental donde los precios son más favorables a si ella puede ganar un poco más, además recibe ayuda de su esposo el cual trabaja como transportista en una moto taxi, juntas están solicitando un nuevo financiamiento ya que se acerca el día de las madres y ella desean aprovechar esa fecha  para realizar mejores ventas.
texts.en:
This group consists two members. They have three loans and are one of the most responsible groups when it comes to repayment. Natividad has been selling general merchandise, such as clothing, cosmetics and shoes, for the past 20 years. She is 44 years old and she and her husband have worked hard to get their family ahead. Having their children come out ahead it a top priority for them. She is asking for this loan in order to buy inventory for her business. She sells her products in her neighborhood. Marta also sells general merchandise and buys her products in the west market where she can get them for better prices. This way she can earn a little bit more. She also gets help from her husband, who works as a mototaxi driver. Together, these ladies are asking for a new loan, now that mothers' day is approaching and they want to take advantage of this day and increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Aner Eliu

texts.es:
La señora Aner Eliu S. S., tiene 25 años de edad vive en Veracruz, Ticuantepe, en la capital de Managua, es soltero y tiene su moto taxi que realiza servicios de transporte en la zona, vive con su padres y espera tener los recursos para mejorar las condiciones de habitad de ellos.

Dentro de otros de sus planes principales esta la siembra de media manzana de tomate de unos terrenos que heredo, este joven solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan la continuación de las remodelaciones del hogar de sus padres, ahora solicita para la edificación de unos cuartos con la intención de poder ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones que permitan un óptimo esparcimiento. Ha sido ocn la ayuda de Afodenic con los Fondos Kiva, que le han permitido estas comodidades.
texts.en:
25-year old Aner Eliu S. S. lives in Veracruz, Tichantepe, in the capital city Managua. He is unmarried. He earns his living by transporting people around on his motobike taxi. He lives with his parents and hopes to have enough money to improve the house where they live. One of his main plans is to plant tomatoes on one of the 1/2 manzana (about 0.8 acre) lots which he has inherited. Aner is asking for a loan to buy construction material to continue the renovation of his parents’ house. He wishes to build some more rooms so that his family can have better living conditions and more space to spread out. He has been helped by Afodenic and Kiva before, and this assistance has been very useful to him.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build more rooms

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita L. is a 55-year-old married woman who lives in Prk. Tulay, Brgy Day-as, Corcova, Cebu City. She earns a living by owning and operating a general store, videoke machine, and computer games business.

Bernardita’s husband, Sergio, is a 58-year-old jeepney driver, and they have four children who are between 18 and 33 years old. One child is currently going to school and also helps Bernardita and Sergio in the business as part of daily chores. Two other children are already working. The fourth has a family.

Bernardita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 hoping that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of their family's life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in these businesses. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000 from her business activities.

Bernardita is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 was used to fund operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 13th cycle loan, the amount of PHP 14,000, which she intends to use on her general store, videoke machine and computer games business. Bernardita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for businesses

loans.name: Tosam Nkwain

texts.en:
Tosam Nkwain E. is married and has one child. Health problems have rendered him not strong enough to cultivate crops, which is the main economic activity in his community. As a result, he has resorted to retail trade, which is less strenuous. Due to inadequate capital, he could not raise enough revenue to meet the needs of his family. Motivated by other GHAPE members in his community, he joined the program in 2007 and has received and repaid loans two times with no repayment problems. He now intends to obtain his third loan, which will be used for the purchase of bread, rice, salt and drinks.
  
The profit he gets from the loans will be used to complete his house and cater to his child’s education. His community will benefit from this in that there will be more locally made bread from the urban city of Bamenda available and the people won't have to go far to buy it. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase bread, salt, rice and drinks

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena B. lives with her her family in Akhlatyan village in the Syunik region of Armenia. Elena is a pensioner and the main income for her family comes from the family's farming business. They keep cattle and cultivate the land. Their machinery is very old and often breaks down. With the help of this loan Elena and her husband will be able to fix the machinery and buy diesel fuel and seeds.

loans.use: fix the machinery and buy diesel fuel and seeds

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona A. is 26 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  Mona has 4 years of experience in this business.  Mona needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 550 talas or US $229 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Mona joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Mona's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Avema

texts.en:
Avema G. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 52 years old. Avema is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Avema owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling pork and chicken (meat products) in the local community. Avema has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Avema joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Avema has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Avema is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Avema from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Elizabet

texts.es: Elizabet de 35 años, es una mujer muy honesta y trabajadora, está casada con Ivan de 28 años,  y vive con sus dos hijas, Camila de 4 y Yamila de 2 años, en la casa  de su tío, ubicado en la localidad de Palcamayo. Ella vende todos lo viernes hortalizas en la feria de su localidad, gracias a sus seis terrenos de cultivo, de los cuales dos de ellos están arrendados. Hace 6 años que se dedica a la agricultura, tiempo suficiente para lograr abastecer la demanda que genera las verduras en la capital y esta muy contenta del éxito obtenido, afirma que se dedica al 100 % en su siembra y asegura que todo cultivo  es rentable,”solo tienen que aprovechar al máximo las temporadas de siembra”, menciona.  En estos meses ya cosechará una gran cantidad de espinaca de buena calidad gracias al cuidado y dedicación que les brinda, confiesa además que le gusta cuidarlas y verlas crecer. Próximamente sembrará lechuga y zanahoria; por lo que espera completar sus ahorros y poder comprar más terrenos de cultivo. Es el primer crédito con MFP y esperar aprender mucho de las capacitaciones que ofrecen en su banco comunal. Con los mil soles, comprará semillas, abono y medicina para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Elizabet, age 35, is a very honest and hard-working woman. She is married to Ivan, age 28. She lives with her two children, Camila, age 4, and Yamila, age 2, in the home of her uncle, in the town of Palcamayo. She sells vegetables in the local market every Friday, thanks to her 6 plots of land, two of which are leased. She has been farming for 6 years, which is enough time to generate demand for her vetetables in the capital. She is very happy with the success that she has obtained. She says that she is 100% dedicated to her crops and that all of her crops are profitable; "we just have to make the most of the planting seasons", she says. In the past few months, she has already harvested a large quantity of good-quality spinach thanks to the care and dedication that she provides them. Furthermore, she says that she enjoys caring for them and watching them grow. Next, she will plant lettuce and carrots; so she hopes to finish saving up and to be able to buy more lands to plant. This is her first loan with MFP and she hopes to learn a lot about the training that they offer in her community bank. With the 1000 soles, she will purchase seeds, fertilizer and medicine for her next sowing season.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her next sowing season

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida por las hermosas playas que recorren todas sus costas y que son muy visitadas por los turistas nacionales e internacionales.

Para la señora Carmen este es su segundo ciclo en este Banco, nos cuenta que estuvo en otro Banco hace mucho tiempo pero decidió retirarse porque no había una buena organización, en cambio este le gusta porque existe una muy buena organización y las compañeras son muy unidas. Tiene 47 años de edad y quedó viuda hace 17 años, cuando enviudo estaba embarazada del último de sus 5 hijos, tres de ellos aun viven con ella.

Vende arroz por quintales y otros productos, los cuales deja a crédito y va cobrando por semanas o quincenas, al ser productos de consumo masivo tiene muchos clientes que le compran sus productos, le compran por las facilidades de pago, ella gana porque al dejar a crédito aumenta el precio un poco y gana más y los clientes ganan porque tienen tiempo para pagar en cómodas cuotas. Sus productos se los traen desde Charapoto.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar para pagar el pedido que tiene en este mes.
 
Su sueño es tener una gran distribuidora.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Unidas [United Women] meets in the residential area of San Alejo in the gorgeous city of Portoviejo, capital of the province of Manabi, known for the beautiful beaches that run along its entire coastal region which are very popular with both domestic and international tourists. 

For Carmen this is her second loan cycle in this Bank. She tells us that she was with another bank a long time ago but decided to withdraw because of the poor organization there. On the other hand, she likes this one because it is very well-organized and the members are highly supportive of one other. She is 47 years old and became a widow 17 years ago when she was pregnant with the last of her five children, three of whom still live with her. 

She sells rice by the quintal (approx. 100 lbs ~ 46 kg) and other products which she delivers on credit and for which she receives weekly or biweekly payments. As she sells products of large-scale consumption she has many customers, who buy from her on account of the favorable payment arrangements. She wins because, by delivering on credit, if the price goes up a little she earns more and the customers win because they have time to pay in convenient installments. She brings her merchandise in from Charapoto. 

She will use this credit to pay for this month's order. 

Her dream is become a large distributor.

loans.use: To purchase quintals of rice

loans.name: Ropani

texts.en:
Ropani S. is currently in the business of selling medical drugs at the medical clinic and is requesting a loan to stock more drugs to sell. Ropani is 25 years old and is married to a businessman. They do not have any children. 

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build some wards for admitting patients.

loans.use: Stock more medical drugs to sell

loans.name: Ros' Group

texts.en:
Eight members are forming a village loan. They live in Kbal Chrouy village, Kandal province. Mrs. Ros N. has been selected by the village members to be a village bank president. She is a 32 year old married man. Each members will use their portion of the loan with different purposes.

Mrs. Ros N. is a seamstress in the garment factory, where she can receive a little salary to support her family. Her husband,Mr. Kheng Bopha, work as tailor at the local. In order to support and to expand the tailor business,
Mrs. Ros N. would like to ask for a loan to buy more clothes to enlarge her husband current business. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy more fabric to enlarge his business activities.

loans.name: Cheruiyot

texts.en:
Cheruiyot  is a resident of Litein Town, in Rift Valley, and has been a dairy farmer for 4 years. He is also in the motorcycle transport business.  He earns income by producing milk and selling it locally.  He has two children aged 9 and 3.

Cheruiyot has applied for this loan of 33,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He hopes this loan will improve his family’s income and standard of living. Animal feed remains his greatest challenge.  He wants to get better quality animals in the future and expand his land ownership.  He appreciates the impact of Juhudi Kilimo loans.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Mrs. Saren C. (pictured here) is 26 years old and her husband, Mr. Borey Sang is 27 years old.  They live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2003 and have two young children (one son and one daughter).  

Saren is a weaver. Her husband is a security guard. She is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and purchase a new motorbike for her husband to replace his old one.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and a replacement motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To enlarge his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Navil

texts.es:
Navil es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad, que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos en el distrito de Zaña, una zona agrícola ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a crianza y venta de ganado vacuno y animales menores. El cría los animales en su casa y los vende a los compradores ocasionales que visitan su zona, también comercializa la leche que producen sus vacas entre sus vecinos. Estos negocios son la única fuente de ingreso familiar por lo que da todo de sí para sacar su negocio adelante.

Actualmente Navil desea invertir en la alimentación de sus animales adquiriendo alimento balanceado de modo que su producción mejore y pueda percibir mejores ingresos, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Navil ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y de su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad pudo adquirir una vaca, con lo cual su negocio pudo crecer y brindarle más ganancias, por ello el se encuentra bastante agradecido con las personas que le apoyaron a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Navil is a family man who is 30 years old and who lives together with his wife and their two children. They live in the district of Zana, an agricultural region located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

He is a farmer who raises and sells cattle and small livestock. He raises his livestock form his home and sells them to the buyers who visit the region. He also produces milk and sells it to the neighbours. These businesses are the only source of income for the family, which is why he gives his all to make them work. 

Navil wishes to invest in the purchase of feed for the animals to secure an improved quality, and to improve his earnings. IN order to meet his objectives he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. 

Navil has had a previous Kiva loan, disbursed through Edpyme Alternativa and its affiliate Capital Semilla. In that experience he was able to purchase a cow. His business increased and his earnings increased. He is very grateful to the individuals who supported him through Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer, es un dueño de un lugar turístico de montaña, reside en Arambala departamento de Morazán, él es casado y vive con su esposa y seis hijos de 18, 15, 13, 10, 8 y 5, todos son dependientes,  su negocio tiene 18 años de existir, trabaja a tiempo completo dando mantenimiento al local, piscinas y atendiendo a los visitantes.
Por el momento tiene en sus planes la construcción de un muro y mejorar el parqueo para los vehículos, este dinero le servirá para mejorar la infraestructura del turicentro, logrando mejorar la vistosidad del lugar y que los clientes se sientan cómodos y tranquilos disfrutando de su visita.
Wilmer aspira para un futuro construir un hotel de montaña que ofrezca para sus clientes todo lo necesario, habitaciones equipadas, restaurante y piscinas, en su familia pues quiere que sus hijas sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Wilmer is the proprietor of a tourist center in the mountains.  He lives in Arambala in the Morazán department.  He is married, and he lives with his wife and their six children.  The children are 18, 15, 13, 10, 8, and 5 years old.  They are all dependents.  

His business has been in existence for 18 years.  He works full time providing maintenance to the place, the pools, and taking care of the visitors.

He now has plans to build a wall and improve the parking area.  This money will serve him to improve the infrastructure of the tourist center.  This will make the place more attractive, and the customers will feel comfortable and peaceful as they enjoy their visit.

In the future Wilmer wants to build a hotel in the mountains that offers the customers everything they need, well-equipped rooms, a restaurant, and pools.  

Regarding his family, he wants his daughters to become professionals.

loans.use: Buy materials to build a wall

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia A. is from the village of Bugo, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 58 years old. Delia is married and has eight adult children. 

To make a living, Delia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Delia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Delia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Bugo, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Adriana Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra C. labora como operadora de fotocopiadora  es acompañada, tiene una persona a su cargo,  es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece  la oportunidad que le brindan esta institución con  este  desembolso, para poder mejorar su vivienda, comprar materiales de construcción como  cemento madera cinz, cemento, mano de obra, para hacer un porche .
texts.en:
Sra. C. works as a photocopy machine operator. She lives with another person who is a dependent.

This is the first loan she has received from CEPRODEL. She is grateful for this opportunity being given to her. The funds will be used to make an improvement to her home. She will buy construction materials such as concrete, wood, zinc, as well as pay for labor to build a porch.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials & pay for labor to build a porch

loans.name: Sergo

texts.en:
Sergo M. is 28 years old and lives in the village of Tsilkani, Kartli Region.  He lives together with his big extended family, consisting of himself, his wife, daughter, parents, brother and grandmother. The family has been running an agricultural farm for 15 years which now counts four cows, seven calves, nine goats and 27 chickens. 

The family produces cheese and sells it in a grocery shop in Tbilisi (capital of the country). They also sell eggs and goat's milk. Agriculture is the main source of income for Sergo’s family, along with the salary he gets for working as a policeman. Sergo’s parents work in the farm, and his wife is busy with their 1-year-old daughter. 

With the loan Sergo plans to add two milch cows to the farm. It will allow them to produce more cheese and increase the income of the family. Increased income will allow Sergo to spend more on family well-being and he also plans to put aside some savings to reinvest the funds in further development of the farm.

loans.use: to purchase two milch cows.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is a 60-year-old married woman. She lives in Surallah, South Cotabato. She is engaged in farming and primarily grows rice. She sells her harvest to the market. Aside from farming, Melba also makes and sells chorizo and dried fish to the people in her community. Melba said she has to find ways to provide for her family's needs since farming isn't really enough for them.

Melba's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for her family to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura B. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Laura is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Laura owns & operates a service-based business, providing computer games and machine services to local community members. Laura has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Laura joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Laura has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase tools needed to provide this service. Laura is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools & utilities needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Laura from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools & utilities needed for the maintenance of the service-based business.

loans.name: Auysh

texts.en:
Auysh is 48 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a ger, the Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her two older children are students while her younger one is a pupil. Her husband is a driving instructor at a private driver training school. 

Auysh manages a computer and Canon service business besides her accounting job at Hovd Uho Co.,Ltd. However, she is planning to quit her job in order to conduct her own business in the future. The reason is that her employer never pays her salary on time and her own business is much more profitable compared with her accounting job. She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase equipment for servicing computers.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for servicing computers.

loans.name: Gansukh

texts.en:
Mr.Gansukh is 29 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. Gansukh was born in the countryside and his family moved to Darkhan in search of a better life. In 2004, he married his wife. His wife looks after the kids at the moment. 

Gansukh has been working at a mill factory as a flour packer since 2004. In 2011, he bought a plot of land and a small house with his savings. The house was cheap, but really run down and needs proper renovation and insulation from the cold. 

Mongolian winter is one of the harshest in the world reaching minus 40 to 45 degrees at night. Houses without insulation require burning coals for the whole night to keep the warmth. Plus it requires more use of coal, which is costly and pollutes the air and environment as well. Therefore Mr.Gansukh wants to do a proper renovation of the house, making it warmer. The loan will be used to buy all the necessary building materials to renovate the house and to replace the coal-fired heating system with a low pressure central heating system.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials to renovate his house and replace the coal-fired heating system with a central heating system

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy more firewood and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea lives in a small house in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. She is a rice farmer, and she always plants her crops in the field according to the season, whether the rainy season or dry season. Her husband runs a motor taxi service at the busy market. They earn a profit of approximately of US$3.60 per day to use for their expenses.

Mrs. Chea is asking for her first loan in order to plant vegetables and rice. The couple is blessed with a kid who is enrolled in school. In the future, Mrs. Chea has planned to expand her crop-planting business, to enlarge her current house, and to support her only child to finish a high level of education.

loans.use: to plant vegetables and rice

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.en: Cristeta, 56 years of age, is widowed and a mother of four children. She's engaged in food vending, particularly rice cake vending. She's been doing this business for almost 32 years. Her net income is 5,000 PHP a month. She's asking a loan for 12,000 PHP to purchase additional raw ingredients for her business. She would like to continue receiving loans to aid the growth of her business and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw ingredients

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Oun, aged 40, works in the casino. Her husband is a chief construction worker; their income is $10 per day. They have two children, one of whom is studying and the other works in the casino with his mother; he can earn income of $3 per day. Oun has to spend around $100 per month for all her family's expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a plot of land for planting Khmer potatoes. She also wants to support her youngest child's studies until she finishes university and gets a good job.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land for planting Khmer potatoes

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario, 65, a resident of Binondo, Manila, Philippines. She is a mother of three children, all of whom are already in college, and married to Vinerando, a vendor. By the grace of God, Rosario has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. This is a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Rosario as she herself has been an undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Rosario operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Rosario dreams to be able to give her children a high quality education through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products she uses in her food stall

loans.name: Benkola C Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKOLA C sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le mil, le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution et MAGNINE ALOU  qui est la deuxième assises à droite avec une écharpe blanche, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz.
Les productions des femmes seront gardées pendant un temps puis seront vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the BENKOLA C group are married women with an average age of 32 and three children on average. They mostly live in polygamous families in Baou, one of the villages of the rural community of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali.

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops cultivated are, among others, millet, rice, and peanuts. They are on their first collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso and MAGNINE ALOU, seated second on the right with a white scarf, intends to use her loan to buy farm inputs and small agricultural equipment and pay for plowing to maintain about 0.5 hectares of rice.

The produce of these women will kept for a time and then sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou, to a clientele composed of retailers and consumers. They expect to make an average profit of 25,000 F CFA, more or less, each season.

loans.use: to pay for laborers, farm inputs, and small agricultural equipment.

loans.name: Milton Ruben

texts.es:
Milton Ruben tiene 24 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con un hijo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA ESPERANZA, se encuentra ubicada recinto JESÚS DEL GRAN PODER, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl.

Milton se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol . Compra sus productos en Comercial Roca en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl, para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, urea, abonos orgánicos y semillas de maíz fréjol y arroz para la producción.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente  a toda la familia para poder suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y construir la casa para la familia. 

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Milton Ruben is 24 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and their son in Ventanas Canton, de los Ríos Province. 

The members of the communal bank Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) live in the JESÚS DEL GRAN PODER precinct, which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural work like planting corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Milton makes his living in agriculture; he plants corn, rice and beans.  He purchases his products in Roca's Stores in Ventanas and sells them in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Milton is requesting the loan to plant corn, rice and pigeon peas, and to purchase compost, chemical fertilizers, herbicides, urea, organic fertilizers and corn, bean and rice seeds for production.  The loan will help him and his family financially to they can meet their needs.  Milton faces challenges such as plagues and plant disease.  His dream is to purchase a plot of land and build a house for his family.

Milton likes to exercise.

loans.use: to purchase compost, chemical fertilizers, herbicides, urea and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 38 años, es una mujer alegre, emprendedora y sobre todo muy responsable, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en la casa de sus suegros.El trabajo de Rosa, consiste en la venta de bebidas gaseosas, lleva realizando este trabajo ya por cuatro años lo hace sola y dice que el clima de la región le da muchas ganancias, ya que siempre hay clientes buscando refrescarse ante el incremento del calor en la ciudad.Lo que le gusta d su trabajo es que siempre hay clientes, siempre esta en actividad y sobre todo tiene tiempo para poder hacer otras cosas y otras actividades que le generen mas ganancia. Ella espera poder mas adelante hacer crecer su negocio, poner una fuente de soda o al menos poco a poco poder ir incrementando su stock.Este es el cuarto préstamo entre MFP y Rosa, le gusta mucho trabajar con su grupo ya que todos se muestran responsables, espera poder seguir trabajando de esta manera con ellos y con la institución de quien esta muy agradecida ya que siente que le apoyan mucho.Con el monto solicitado, 2500 soles ella comprará mas bebidas para poder ampliar su negocio y asi poder crecer junto a MFP.
texts.en: Rosa is 38 years old. She is a cheerful, enterprising and above all responsible woman. She lives with her husband and two children in her parents in law's house. Rosa's work is selling soft drinks. She has been doing this for four years and she says that the regional climate brings her a lot of earnings, since there are always customers looking for refreshment with the rising heat in the city. What she likes about her job is that there are always customers and there is always activities that generate more income. She hopes in the future to be able to grow her business, opening a soda fountain or at least little by little increase her stock. This is her fourth loan with MFP and Rosa really likes working with her group since everyone is responsible. She hopes to be able to continue working in this way with them and with the institution to which she is very grateful since she feels it supports her a lot. With the amount she has asked for, 2,500 soles, she will buy more beverages to expand her business and thus be able to grow with MFP.

loans.use: to buy more beverages to expand her business and grow with MFP.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: Ignacio, tiene la edad 22 de años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos. El pretende con el credito compra los medicamentos e insumos para el cuido de ellos. El cuenta con los establecimientos adecuados par la explotacion de estos animales  y con la experincia para faciltar todas la labores que se necesitan paran el proyecto. El quiere tener el alimento necesario para aplicarle a sus cerdos y los medicamentos por si los animales se enferman. El quiere darle un buen cuido a sus animales y así poder venderlos de buena calidad al mercado y así generar las meyores ganancias y poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y poder ayudar a sus padres con las responsabilidades del hogar.Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ignacio, age 22, is single and lives with his parents and siblings.  

He has the appropriate facilities for working with these animals.  He also has the experience to facilitate all of the work needed for this business activity.  He intends to use the loan for medication and supplies to take care of them.  He wants to have the feed that is needed for his pigs, and he wants to have medicine in case the animals get sick.

He wants to provide good care for his animals.  That way they will be of good quality, and he will able to sell them at the market.  This is the way he will generate greater income and be able to offer his family a better quality of life.  He will also be able to help his parents with the household responsibilities.

This is the first loan he has had with FUDECOSER.  He has had no prior loan with state banks.  FUDECOSUR provided the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PRO DESARROLLO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Pisaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ceferina; ella tiene 57 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia prepara platos como pollo al horno, lomo saltado, cuy al horno entre otros platos, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, azúcar y verduras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “PRO DESARROLLO” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Pisaq, which belongs to the province of Calca,  department of Cuzco.

This member's name is Ceferina. She is 57 years old, single and has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business. She makes breakfast, lunch and dinner, preparing dishes such as baked chicken, strip steak, baked guinea pig and more. She works from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. With this business she gets her children ahead. She wants to expand her restaurant and is asking for the loan to buy products to cook such as rice, sugar and vegetables.   

Ceferina is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy products to cook such as rice, sugar and vegetables.

loans.name: Las Rosas 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.es:
Flor es L. coordinadora del Grupo Las Rosas 1, 2, 3. Este grupo está compuesto por 15 mujeres dedicadas a las ventas D. ropas, zapatos, cosméticos, entre otros, algunos D. modo ambulante y algunos tienen sus negocios en sus casas. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en L. ciudad D. Santo Domingo, en una comunidad D. pocos recursos localizada al norte D. L. capital D. L. República Dominicana. Su familia está compuesta por 2 hijos y su pareja sentimental, actualmente Flor no vive con ningunos D. sus hijos, ya han crecido y han formado sus propias familias. Nos dice que disfruta compartir con sus hijos y nietos, y escuchar música.

Flor está muy emocionada D. recibir su tercer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, el cual invertirá en su Cafetería, L. cual inicio después D. que su hija, quien era L. propietaria anterior, quedo embarazada y al dar a luz, tuvo que dedicarse a cuidar a su bebe, L. cafetería está ubicada en unas D. las escuelas D. su comunidad. También Flor venD. habichuelas hervidas (mujeres en L. comunidades suelen comprar habichuelas hervidas para cocinar, D. esta manera evitan comprar las habichuelas enlatadas).

Sus ganancias serán re-invertidas en sus negocios y para cubrir algunas necesidades D. su hogar. Uno D. sus sueños es ver a sus hijos con vidas estables, tanto en L. estructura D. sus familias como económicas.
texts.en:
Flor is the coordinator of the 'Las Rosas 1, 2, 3' group.  This group has 15 [female] members who sell clothes, shoes, cosmetics and other products.  Some make their sales as street vendors and others have their businesses in their homes.  This group is located in a poor community in the north of Santo Domingo, the capital city of the Dominican Republic.  Flor's family consists of her two children and her partner.  She does not currently live with either of her children because they are grown up and have their own families.  She tells us that she likes to spend time with her children and grandchildren, and listen to music.

Flor is very excited to be receiving her third loan from Esperanza Internacional.  She will invest the money in her café which she started running after her daughter, who used to own it, became pregnant and had a baby.  Her daughter then decided to look after her baby.  The café is located in one of the schools in the community.  In addition, Flor also sells pre-boiled beans (women in the community usually buy pre-boiled beans to cook.  In this way, they can avoid buying canned beans).

Flor's profits will be reinvested in her businesses and she will also use some to cover some of her household needs.  One of her dreams is to see her children with stable lives, both in terms of the structure of their families and their financial situation.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, cookies, sweet treats, beans, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a father of 10 adult children, but two of whom still stay with him as they pursue their post-secondary education. He is age 62 and has been in farming for 30 years, farming being his sole source of income. His farm currently produces tea, milk and French beans for the local market.

Samuel has requested a loan of 63,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the income generated will help improve his family's livelihood. He intends to start dairy breeding business in the future.

Samuel says he will repay the loan and request more, but he laments of unstable market prices.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 30-year-old married woman with 2 children who are enrolled in school. Her husband Thomas, who is employed, also contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. Florence owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.

Florence has operated a grocery for the past two years; she operates her business from the market. Her potential clients are the people who come to the marketplace to shop, and her major challenge is transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

She plans to use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase more vegetables and foodstuffs for her grocery. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access capital to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and foodstuffs for her grocery.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Elva; la socia tiene 37 años de edad, la socia es casada, La socia tiene 2 hijos ; La socia tiene un negocio de venta de salchipapas,ella tiene un carrito donde vende salchipapas en forma ambulatoria desde las 5:00 p.m hasta las 11:00 p.mn y en las mañnas la socia se sigue dedicando a trbajar como docente,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de salchipapas . La socia desea el crédito para comprar insumos para preparar las salchichas como papa,salchicha y platos al por mayor.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member is Señora Elva; she is 37 years old and married, with two children.  The member has a business selling salchipapas (hot dogs and fries).  She has a small cart from where she sells the salchipapas as a street vendor, from 5 p.m. until 11 p.m.  During the mornings, the member works as a teacher, and by means of this business she has been able to move her children ahead in life.

The member would like to expand and improve her salchipapas business.  She wants this loan to purchase ingredients at wholesale for preparing salchipapas, such as potatoes, sausage, and plates.

The member is grateful for the support which is being provided to her, and likewise, she commits to making her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase supplies at wholesale for preparing salcihipapas (hot dogs and fries), such as potatoes, sausage, and plates.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is 45 years old, and a married woman with four children between the ages of 3 and 16 years. All of them are in school. She has had a business of selling clothes in Buluk, South Sudan for three years.

Fouzia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Karanpil

texts.en:
Karanpil is 66 years old.  She lives in the village of Kesali in East Georgia. Karanpil is married and lives with her family: husband – Takhmaz, their 46-year-old son, their daughter-in-law and two grandchildren (17 and 16 years old).  The children go to school. 

All adult family members are involved in the family's agricultural activities, which is the only source of income for them. They have a small dairy farm. Karanpil produces cheese and sells it in Gardabani (a nearby town).  The family also owns a plot of land where various vegetables are grown. The family sells vegetables locally to the green grocery retailers.  The total average monthly income for the family is 1000 Laris. 

Karanpil requested credit to purchase 2 additional milk cows.  This will increase their production and sales of cheese, which will increase the income for the family and allow them to purchase needed household goods to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: purchase 2 milk cows

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 8 años.
María se dedica a la venta de repuesto de carros, siempre tuvo el negocio, pero su capital era muy poco, ahora con Finca ella pudo crecer como negociante y como mujer, las capacitaciones le ayudan a poder ser mejor esta muy feliz en Finca y trata siempre de cumplir con todo, agradece que con los ahorros pudo comprarse un terreno, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Llapanchik Communal Bank. She has been a member of Finca Perú for 8 years.

Maria makes a living selling car parts. She has always had the business, but her capital was very small. Now with Finca she can grow as a businessperson and as a woman. The training helps her to be better. She is very happy with Finca and tries to always do everything that is asked of her. She is grateful that she was able to buy some land with her savings. She will put this loan towards the purchase of parts.

loans.use: to purchase motor starters for cars.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 33-year-old mother of two. She has a degree in business and economics and ample knowledge to create a successful small business. Iman decided to tackle her family’s economic stability and purchased a local bookstore. The 15-year-old bookstore was slated to close until Iman stepped in to not only revitalize the store but fortify her family. In order to make the store profitable, Iman decided to diversify its stock and introduce additional book types, gifts and toys.

Iman needed this loan to restock her bookstore and expand its product range.

In the future Iman wants to overcome the seasonality of her bookstore by expanding with products that will draw customers throughout the year.

loans.use: To restock her bookstore and expand its product range.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married and has 3 children. She sells bush meat and also cooks banku for sale at Mpredwow, which she has done for 20 years. Her husband is a farmer. Aba uses her income to help her husband pay their utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase bush meat to sell and maize for the preparation of the banku she sells. With the new profits, Aba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bush meat to sell and maize for the preparation of the banku she sells.

loans.name: Jose Marcelino

texts.es:
José  nació en la ciudad en la parroquia Toacazo de la provincia de Latacunga, perteneciente a la República del Ecuador, esta zona se caracteriza por sus habitantes que se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales menores y ganado de leche y de carne,  tiene 48 años de edad, actualmente se encuentra casado, tiene por el momento 1 hijo a su cargo, viven en casa propia.
Ha sido para él muy satisfactorio sacar a sus hijos adelante con lo poco que en esos momentos tenían, su esposa  es y ha sido un pilar fundamental en su vida y en su hogar ya que por la necesidad ha tenido que salir a trabajar además ella es quien en un inicio empezó con la crianza y venta de animales menores.
Con el esfuerzo de sus padres pudo terminar la primaria, por la difícil situación económica  de su familia tuvo que trabajar desde muy pequeño y así poder ser un gran apoyo para él y su familia. Aprendió de esta actividad ya que es muy común en la zona, por ser un sector rural, trabaja de 6 a 8 horas diarias en el cuidado de los animales.
Se le hace un poco difícil el transportar su ganado para las diferentes ferias ya que no cuenta con un transporte propio para ello, pero pese a esto no se ha hecho mayor problema, al contrario le ha motivado para salir adelante por el bien de él y el de su familia.  Por el momento solicita un crédito de $700 dólares para poder adquirir una vaca lechera, la misma que servirá para obtener más rentabilidad utilidad con la venta de la leche.
Jorge y su esposa  quieren extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
José was born in the city in the parish of Toacazo in Latacunga province, part of the Republico of Ecuador. This area is defined by its inhabitants who make a living raising and selling small animals and cattle for milk and meat. José is 48 years old and currently married. At the moment, he has one dependent child. They have been living in their own house for 49 years.

It has been very fulfilling for him to help his children get ahead with the little that they have at this time. His wife is and has been a strong pillar in his life and home because of his need to leave to work. In addition it was she who started raising and selling small animals.

Due to his parent’s labor, he was able to finish primary school. However, because of his family’s difficult economic situation he had to start working when he was very young. Thus he was able to be a great source of support for himself and his family.

He learned this business because it is very common in the area, since it is a rural sector. He works from 6 to 8 hours a day caring for his animals. It has been a little difficult to transport his cattle to the different markets because he does not have his own transportation. Nevertheless, despite this it has not been a major problem. On the contrary it has motivated him to get ahead for his own and his family’s wellbeing 

At the moment, he is requesting a loan of $700 so that he can buy a milk cow. This will enable him to earn more profits by selling milk. 

Jorge and his wife want to extent their sincere appreciation and congratulations to Fundación Alternative in Ecuador and to Kiva for making their growth, both professional and personal, possible.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and increase his profits.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 65 years old lady, married and blessed with 2 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 in order to benefit from enterprise development and financial management training.
She does maize and beans farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer that will help increase her yields thus more income. She will use the anticipated income to cater for her family’s needs such as food, shelter and pay school fees for her children.
Grace is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer  that will improve on  yields thus more income to cater for her family needs such as food, shelter and pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: susan would like to buy 2 bales of clothes and different varieties of jewelleries

loans.name: Jiponi

texts.en:
Jiponi O. is married with two children and an Acholi by tribe. He was born in Pader district and came to Kampala in October 2002 due to the rebel war which was terrible in that region of Northern Uganda and led to displacement of many people like him. When he came to Kampala, he had to settle in Acholi quarters where most of the displaced Acholi people live.

While in Acholi quarters, he was working as a private security guard with the Hwan Sung company. That job came to an end when the company decided to recruit guards from a security organization. He had nothing to do until he joined the women in the Acholi quarters in making paper beads. That paved way for him to join Life in Africa in September 2006 when there was a position open for a security guard. He worked as a security guard in Life in Africa until February 2007 when he was given a position in a craft production team that earns him a better living.

Since he joined the organization, he has been so helpful to the organization and the other members. Through others members who have acquired this loan, he has seen how a small loan can change someone's life. That has inspired him to also try.

For his plan, he has discovered that building materials like stone are in a higher demand than ever before as there is massive construction and renovation of houses and roads in Kampala to meet the Commonwealth heads of government conference (CHOGM) due November 2007 in Uganda.

The Acholi Quarter is located on a rocky hill, where stone can be easily sourced and laborers who know this work are available. When Jiponi gets this loan, he will begin by paying for the site right away, then hire people to dig out the stones. This may take him about a week. Then he will have the stones moved out of the pit, while those doing the crushing are also doing their part. In a week, the stones will be out, and about one and a quarter deliveries may be ready for sale, making a total of three deliveries per month. This work does not need much supervision, so all measurements and payments of laborers shall be done by him when he gets back home in the evenings.

To make this project successful, he is seeking loan in the amount of 250,000 Uganda shillings (UGX), and he will be able to repay in six months. (1 USD = 1,722 UGX). Jiponi hopes to make a profit of 150,000 UGX per month. Below is his estimated budget:

Hiring a site..........20,000 UGX

Extraction labor.......20,000 UGX per delivery

Porters........... 7,000 UGX per delivery

Crushing labor ........ 32,000 UGX per delivery

Sub-total = 79000 x 3 deliveries..... 237,000 UGX per month

Contingencies ........ 13,000 UGX

Total................250,000 UGX

loans.use: Renting a stone quarry site and digging out stones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying sewing machines and materials

loans.name: Lale

texts.en: Lale S. and her husband (pictured here) own and operate a household items store in the town of Devechi, located on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Lale and her husband have three children and have been running this business for the last 10 years. This couple has successfully paid back two other loans with Norwegian Microcredit, the last loan being for $800, thus proving they are reliable clients. They are looking for funding so that they can further invest in their store to include better, higher quality items in their inventory.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and quality of their inventory

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Mr. José P. (59) is married to Miriam (48), and they have lived in a rental house for more than 10 years with their two grown daughters. One of them has a snack bar near the regional hospital; the other is a student at the university and works in the city of Encarnación.

He is a shoemaker by profession, owner of a shoe store located 50 meters from the bus terminal for over 30 years. His wife used to work providing catering service, which she quit in order to help her husband in the shoe store so that they could fill all the orders from customers and have a better income.

Mr. José's dream is that his younger daughter complete her studies in the university, so that in the future she can be a professional and obtain better opportunities in life. She is the only one among her siblings who has had the opportunity to attend the university.

He is requesting this loan of $300 for the purchase of materials for making shoes, such as glue, shoemakers' thread, leather, etc. In this way he will be able to fill all the orders without any inconveniences.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

EL Señor José P. (59) casado con Miriam (48), viven en alquiler hace mas de 10 años con sus dos hijas mayores de edad. Una de ellas posee un copetín cerca del hospital regional; la otra, es estudiante universitaria y trabaja en la Municipalidad de Encarnación.

El señor es de profesión zapatero, propietario de una zapatería ubicado a 50 mts de la terminal de ómnibus hace más de 30 años. Su Señora trabajaba realizando servicios de viandas (catering) la cual tuvo que dejar para poder ayudar a su marido en la zapatería para así concretar todos los pedidos de los clientes y poder tener mejor ingreso.

El sueño del Sr. José es que su hija menor culmine sus estudios universitarios para que en el futuro pueda ser una profesional y obtener mejores oportunidades en la vida, ya que es la única que tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar entre sus hermanos.

El cliente esta solicitando este crédito de $ 300, para la compra de materia prima para la zapatería, como ser pegamentos, hilo de zapatero cueros etc. y así poder realizar todos los pedidos sin ningún inconveniente.

loans.use: to buy materials for making shoes, such as glue, shoemakers' thread, leather, etc.

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta is married to a farmer from Tiavea. She is 21 years old and has one child. Her business is taro plantation, and she sells her crops in front of her house. She also sells at the market twice a week. She makes about 250-300 Tala ($100-$120 US) which she also she uses to support her family and to pay for her kid school fees.

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en: Mrs. Maiya S., a resident of Wolkhu, Lalitpur, lives with her husband, two sons and a daughter. Most of the people in this area are engaged in business. Mrs. S.’s older son works in a private office and her younger son is studying in grade 11. Her daughter works in a department store. Mrs. S. and her husband, Mr. Barja Ram S., are engaged in their own business. They make papads, colorful chips, and other varities of snacks in their own home, and have for eight years. They sell their products in grocery shops. They want to buy more raw materials for preparation of snacks. As they have good experience in their business, their snacks items are very popular among the people. Mrs. S. is requesting her third loan to buy food materials for their work.

loans.use: To buy foods and materials for her work

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en: I am a widow Khursheed Anwar. I am a mother of three boys and two girls. None of my kids could attend school due to the death of their father.
