The loan will be really useful for her business. With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy more supplies for her grocery store

loans.use: She will buy products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro B. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. He is 55 years old. Pedro is married and has five school-age children. To make a living, Pedro owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. Pedro has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2011, Pedro joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedro is requesting a loan of 29,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Pedro from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Marjorie Antonia

texts.es: Marjorie tiene 32 años, con2 hijos a su cargo. Ella se dedica a brindar el servicio de alquiler de sillas. La señora ya tiene 3 años de haber empezado con su negocio, inicio por la necesidad de sufragar los ingresos de su hogar y la de su familia poco a poco fue haciéndose de inventario hasta llegar a tener el negocio que hoy en día posee. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mesas y sillas plásticas. El sueño siempre ha sido realizar mejoras a su casa, por lo que se encuentra muy contenta por saber que tiene un apoyo para salir adelante.
texts.en: Marjorie is 32 years old, and has 2 children in her care. She offers a chair hire service. She began this business 3 years ago, out of the need to help with the household and her family's income, and little by little she has been growing her stock to what she has in her business today. The loan will be used to buy plastic tables and chairs. Her dream has always been to make improvements to her home, and she is very happy in knowing that she has support to get ahead.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, age 32, owns and operates a bar. He launched this business two years ago using the capital of 800,000 shillings, and he now has 1,500,000 shillings. His primary business hardship is clients breaking his bottles while inebriated. 

Joseph has requested this loan in order to buy bottles of beer to offer for sale in his bar. His vision for the future is to move into a more spacious bar and to ensure the education of his children. 

He and his wife have seven children. The family lives live in a house that he owns in Kasese, Uganda.

loans.use: to buy bottles of beer to offer for sale in his bar

loans.name: Asyl

texts.en:
Asyl E. is 55, married, and has two daughters. She worked as a nurse for a long time but her wage was too low to cover the expenses of her children. For this reason, in 1990 she engaged in a business of breeding cattle. Starting with the initial capital of 5,000 KGS she managed to develop a farm with two milk cows and fifteen sheep. With the revenues from selling milk and meat products, she was able to pay for the education of her elder daughter who dreams to be a designer. 

Asyl has applied for a loan of 70,000 KGS to purchase more cattle. It will allow her to further broaden her business. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Luzbeidy Aracely

texts.es:
Luzbeidy tiene 26 años, es casada y  tiene un hijo de edad escolar.  Su pareja se dedica a trabajos como obrero de construcción.  Residen en el distrito de Chepén, ubicado a 1 hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.
Se dedica a la venta de comida rápida en un carrito sanguchero (una unidad móvil no motorizada, que sirve para preparar comida rápida, como hamburguesas, salchipollo y salchipapa).  Los ingresos que percibe en su negocio le ayuda a mantener a su familia, y apoyar a su pareja con los gastos familiares.  Asimismo ella vende bisutería y ropa interior a cómodos precios.
Luzbeidy desea comprar más mercadería de bisutería y ropa interior para venderlo y obtener mayores ingresos.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un crédito de 800 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Luzbeidy is 26 years old, married and has a school-aged son. Her husband is a construction worker. They live in the district of Chepén, located 1 hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque.

She sells fast food in a food cart (an unmotorized mobile unit where fast food is prepared, like hamburgers, salchipollo [chicken sausages] and salchipapas [fried sausages and potatoes]). The income that her business provides help to maintain her family and support her husband with the family costs. She also sells jewelry and undergarments at affordable prices.

Luzbeidy wants to buy more jewelry and undergarments to sell and get more income. This is why she has thought it necessary to ask for a loan of 800 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry and undergarments to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kumarhan

texts.en:
Kumarhan B. is 52 years old and lives with her three children in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in her older brother's backyard. All of her children are in school. 

She manages a meat-trading business at a rented stall at a local market. She has been managing her business for six years and has built a strong customer base. Her monthly rent fee is 6,000 MNT. She usually sells her products to cafes and restaurants. Her daily earning is 20,000 MNT with a monthly net profit of 150,000 MNT. 

She is a polite woman who says, "My happiness is my children. I am ready to give them everything they want to have. But I am proud that I was able to teach them about starting a business with low working capital." 

She is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase meat and meat products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase meat and meat products.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.en:
Edilberto is married and 49 years old. He has a retail shop where he sells vegetables and daily used products such as soap, shampoo and toothpaste in the local community. He has had this business for almost 10 years now.

Edilberto is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional items such as canned goods, biscuits and soft drinks that would increase the capacity of sales from his business. Each month he earns about PHP 5,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Edilberto hopes to meet all his customer's demands for consistent, high quality products that would help to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as canned goods, biscuits and soft drinks.

loans.name: Shenhav

texts.en:
Shenhav is a 36-year-old mother of seven from the Negev region. For years, she and her family have scraped by on welfare struggling to move out of poverty. After taking part in a business development course and researching what type of businesses area residents want and are lacking, Shenhav decided to open a cleaning supplies, paper and plastics products store. Disposable plates, cups and party supplies are in high demand during holiday and wedding seasons. Shenhav has a perfect location close to her home which includes a separate room with its own entrance.

Shenhav needed this loan for renovations to the store; for plaster, paint, windows and additional stock. Shenhav is putting in 50% of her own money and 50% from the loan.

Shenhav dreams of strengthening her business even further, but most of all, she wants to provide a better future for her children and continue to move out of the cycle of poverty.

loans.use: to make renovations to the store and to purchase additional stock.

loans.name: Thuấn's Group

texts.en:
Thuấn is a 31-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Thuấn is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Diên Lộc nhóm 05 (5).


Thuấn is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Thuấn owns & operates a business making & selling bedroom furniture to local businesses and community members.  Thuấn has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


Thuấn joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy raw materials for production of beds, wardrobes, tables, chairs, purchase additional inventory & for working capital.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by Thuấn from SEDA.  Thuấn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Lịch is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to buy food for her pigs and chickens. 

2.  Yến is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to buy food for her pigs.


3.  Quý is a 58-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


4.  Cường is a 28-year-old male who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support his furniture making business.


5.  Quang is a 24-year-old male who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support his business making furniture like tables and chairs.


6.  Phương is a 33-year-old male who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support his business raising pigs.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thuấn là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Thuấn là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Diên Lộc nhóm 05 (5).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị trong phòng ngủ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thuấn thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thuấn kiếm được khoảng 4.500.000 VND.  Thuấn đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND để mua nguyên liệu sản xuất giường tủ, bàn, ghế.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Lịch  là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là  5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi và mua thức ăn cho lợn gà.


2.  Yến là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là  5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Quý là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là  5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Cường là 28 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là  5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


5.  Quang  là 24 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là  5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


6.  Phương là 33 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là  5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to buy raw materials and additional inventory & use as working capital

loans.name: Muratbek

texts.ru:
Муратбеку 40 лет, женат и воспитывает четыре дочки, самой старшей из которых - 11 лет.
Муратбек родился в простой семье чабана. Он был самым старшим из братьев, у него было два младших брата, и поэтому большую часть времени посвящал домашним хлопотам. По окончании школы Муратбека призвали в армию. Отслужив два года, Муратбек  поступает в местное училище, по специальности тракторист механик широкого профиля. Отучившись, он устроился на работу в родном колхозе трактористом. В 1995 году Муратбек женился и в этом же году у них родился первый сын. Первое время Муратбек со своей молодой семьей жил у родителей, пока колхоз не выделил ему участок земли под строительство дома, а также - землю для выращивания сельхозкультур. Муратбек приложил все силы для развития своего бизнеса в полеводстве и смог на доходы от урожая закупить скот. Со временем, вкладывая прибыль от перепродажи откормленного скота, он выстроил небольшой дом со всеми необходимыми для бизнеса  хозпостройками. 
В 1998 году с распадом колхоза Муратбек решил взять в аренду сельхозтехнику и предоставлять услуги населению в обработке земли. Семья Муратбека потихоньку растет, растут и потребности. В связи с этим,  он решил получить кредит в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) и купить грузовую автомашину для предоставления услуг населению по грузоперевозкам. 
На данный момент благодаря упорству и трудолюбию Муратбека, в хозяйстве у него насчитываются 3 дойных коровы, 5 бычков и 4 телочки. В планах у Муратбека приобретение собственного трактора, а также увеличение поголовья скота. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en: Muratbek is 40 years old.  He is married and is raising four daughters, the oldest out of whom is 11 years old.  Muratbek was born in a simple family of a shepherd.  He was the oldest out of his brothers and had two younger brothers, which is why he spent a majority of his time doing household work.  Upon finishing school, Muratbek was drafted into the army.  Having served two years, Muratbek attended a local college and learned the profession of a wide-scope tractor operator and mechanic.  After finishing college, he got a job as a tractor operator at his native collective farm.  Muratbek got married in 1995 and had his first son this same year.  At first, Muratbek and his young family lived with parents up until the collective farm allocated a plot of land to build a house and land to grow agricultural products.  Muratbek put all of his efforts toward developing his farming business and was able to use his profit from the harvest to buy livestock.  Over time, Muratbek invested profits from reselling grown livestock into building a small house with all of the storage sheds necessary for the business.  When the collective farm dissolved in 1998, Muratbek decided to lease farm equipment and offer land treatment services to the public.  Muratbek's family is slowly growing, with their needs growing as well.  To better meet their growing needs, Muratbek decided to obtain a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) and buy a heavy-duty truck in order to offer transportation services to the public.  Currently, thanks to his persistence and hard work, Muratbek has three dairy cows, five bulls and four heifers.  Muratbek plans to buy his own tractor and increase the quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a truck

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a widow with 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elena is 48 years old and has 1 child who is in school.

Elena has a business buying and selling fish and spices in the Philippines. Elena requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish and spices to sell. She has been in this business for 19 years. 

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish and spices to sell

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is a 54-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur. She has three children between the ages of 17 and 33 years old.  She is a widow. 

Since 1997, she has been selling traditional cloth called bitenge.  Her business is going well and it has enabled her to look after her children.  

She will use this loan to buy more bitenge, from which she will generate more profits.  With the profits she will pay school fees for her children and continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase traditional cloth called bitenge that she will sell

loans.name: Shirley Del Rosario

texts.es: Shirley Del Rosario tiene 30 años, se dedica a la venta de alimentos para animales. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio. Es una persona muy conocida en su negocio pues siempre está al pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan para no perderlos. Siempre se caracteriza por brindar un buen servicio. Shirley a se levante todos los días temprano para recibir a sus clientes. Ella solicita este crédito para aprovechar esta temporada lluviosa y comprar concentrado, maíz, trigo, sorgo entre otros. Sueña con establecer un negocio mucho más grande.
texts.en:
Shirley Del Rosario is 30 years old and has been selling animal feed for more than seven years. She is well-known in her business because she is always aware of what her customers need so as not to lose sales. Shirley is always known for providing good service. She wakes up early every day so that she can attend to her customers.

Shirley is requesting this loan so that she can take advantage of the rainy season and buy concentrated feed, corn, wheat, sorghum, and other products. She dreams of establishing a much larger business.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed, corn, wheat, sorghum, and other products.

loans.name: Victor Raul Honorato

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor Raúl es soltero, no tiene hijos, se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, trabaja desde hace 5 años en  esa labor, sus desafíos que enfrenta es el no tener  su propia familia y también esa es una de sus metas, formar su propia familia. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  engorde (comida) para su ganado, el Sr. Víctor esta muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado a su persona.
texts.en: Victor Raul is single, has no children and works as a farmer of beef cattle, has done this for five years, one of his goals is to form a family, which is also one of his challenges.  The loan will be invested in the purchase of feed for his cattle, Victor is very thankful for the loan given to him.

loans.use: to buy feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une enseignante à l'école primaire de son villaget .Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant dont elle a  la charge ainsi que sa propre mère.En marge de l'enseignement, elle a ouvert une boutique de vente de produits vestimentaires sur un premier pret de l'UIMCEC de 100000F. Son activité lui permet de s'occuper  de sa fille, de sa mère et de payer la location de sa boutique.Afin d'augmenter son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 300000F pour acheter 20 pieces d'habits pour enfants, 20 paires de chaussures , 15 coupons de tissus ainsi que des pièces diverses. Son ambition est de devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
This borrower is a teacher at her village’s grade school. She is married and the mother of a child, her own, who she supports. Aside from teaching, she opened a store selling clothing with an initial loan of 100,000 francs from U-IMCEC. Her business enables her to take care of her daughter and her mother and to pay the rent for her store. 

In order to increase her working capital, she is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy 20 pieces of children’s clothing, 20 pairs of shoes, and 15 samples of fabrics, as well as various items. Her ambition is to become a wholesale merchant.

loans.use: to buy 20 pieces children's clothing, 20 pairs of shoes, 15 samples of cloth, as well as assorted items

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
San Francisco es un grupo solidario muy bueno y se encuentra en su 1º ciclo. Esta conformado por 6 mujeres muy trabajadoras las cuales se dedican al comercio, para así poder ayudar a sacar adelante a sus familias; sus reuniones semanales están ubicadas  en el municipio General Escobedo. Ellas desdieron ponerle ese nombre al grupo, ya que así se llama la calle en donde se encuentran las viviendas de la mayoría.

Beatriz es integrante del grupo, tiene 43 años de edad, 5 hijos la mayoría ya casados y trabajando y vive felizmente casada en la ciudad General Escobedo, Nuevo León. Beatriz se dedica a la venta de comida por recomendación de su esposo (en la fabrica en donde labora) e hijos, ademas de que sus vecinos y conocidos les hacen pedidos por tener un esquisto y rico sazón.

Ella acaba de recibir su primer crédito para poder no solo mejorar, si no elevar sus ventas en su micronegocio y así poder salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos en casa.

Beatriz es una mujer muy luchadora que desea salir adelante y progresar en la vida; una de las mayores metas de Beatriz es construir una parrilla de concreto ya que actualmente tiene que cocinar con leña lo cual le parece un poco difícil e incomodo, aunque eso no ha sido un impedimento para salir adelante, con mucho empeño seguir vendiendo y extender sus ventas a mas lugares.
texts.en:
San Francisco is a very good and supportive group in its first cycle. Six very hardworking women who are engaged in trade, in order to help and provide for their families, formed it. They meet weekly and are located in the municipality of General Escobedo. They decided on the name of the group because this is the street where most of them live.

Beatriz, a member of the group, is 43 years old and has 5 children, most of them working and happily married, living in the city of General Escobedo, Nuevo León. 

Her husband and children suggested that she sell food, at a factory where he works, and neighbors and people she knows also order her food because of its exquisite and delicious flavor.

She just received her first loan not only to improve, but also to increase her sales in her micro-business in order to provide for the family and help her husband with the household expenses. Beatriz is a fighter who wants to succeed and go forward in life. One of her major goals is to build a concrete grill since now she has to cook with firewood, which is a bit difficult and uncomfortable. However, that has not stopped her from getting ahead. With hard work she continues to sell and expand to more locations.

loans.use: to build a concrete grill

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de San Jeronimo en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Victoria, la socia tiene 45 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos, la socia se dedica  a la elaboración de comidas típicas; la socia también vende gaseosas, la socia trabaja vendiendo sus comidas en un colegio estatal la socia trabaja desde hace 11 años,  ella vende las comiditas a los profesores y alumnos, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus diversos potajes y gaseosas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus meriendas.
La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Victoria, 45, is a member of the “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) communal bank located in San Jerónimo District in Cusco Province and Department.

She has a spouse and five children.  She prepares traditional dishes and also sells soft-drinks.  She sells her meals at a state school where she’s worked for the last 11 years.  She sells meals to teachers and students.  

She wants the loan to buy ingredients to prepare her various meals and to buy soft-drinks.  She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients to prepare meals.  She is grateful for the support she’ll be granted and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare her dishes.

loans.name: Muyundo Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Muyundo SHG Group in Western Kenya! Florence is the facilitator of the Muyundo SHG Group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Florence takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to the best prices and in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and insure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Florence had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Florence was only able to harvest two bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Florence and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With the income from maize sales, Florence will educate her children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Muyundo SHG Group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is 35 years old. She is married with 4 children. Raquel is involved in raising cattle intended for sale. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy food and vaccine maintenance. Raquel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Raquel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and food for the cattle

loans.name: Miyasuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Miyasuren, 30, is a taxi driver around Kherlen, a border town.  She lives with her son and husband in a old house which is located in the slum district. Just a year ago, she started her taxi business and already has a lot of permanent customers. 
For the past several years, her house has been damaged and requires maintenance and upkeep.  It has a damaged roof, no insulation on the walls, broken windows etc.  Therefore she is taking a loan to purchase the building materials to fix and maintain her old house, before the arrival of the cold winter months.

loans.use: To fix and maintain her old house before this cold winter.

loans.name: Batsuren

texts.en:
Batsuren is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan Province, Mongolia. His wife babysits their two infants and the eldest son is a school student. He started his dairy retailing business in 2001 by renting a counter at the local market. Now he goes to the rural areas by himself to collect the supplies and sells them. With the business profit, he has expanded his counter space and has bought a car. 

During winter, dairy products' prices become high: before then, he needs to save some supplies. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "My business is highly competitive. I need to work even harder in order to support my children". He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy milk and livestock.

loans.use: To buy milk and livestock

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 39, is single with one child who is five years old. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a cosmetic business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With this loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase facial gels, soaps, and food oil for her cosmetic shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase facial gels, soaps, and food oil for her cosmetic shop.

loans.name: Dariimaa

texts.en:
Dariimaa is a 28-year-old educated woman who lives with her parents in an outer ger district, which lacks basic infrastructure, of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. 
Dariimaa has been working as a head of “Scholarship Education” training center since 2008. Her training center’s mission is to create opportunities and to place students on scholarship programs. The center also manages foreign language training. In 2010, Dariimaa published her first book. Today she plans to republish the second edition. So she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 Mongolian Turgriks (MNT) to publish this edition. 
In the photograph, the book that Dariimaa is holding is the second edition draft. Dariimaa is a very hardworking and ambitious young lady who desires to give teenagers an opportunity to obtain a world-class education.

loans.use: to publish the second edition of her book.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.fr: Sonia est mariée avec un enfant . Elle est commerçante et a pour activité la vente des tenues tout-cousus, chaussures, sacs et fournitures scolaires dans sa boutique. Elle s'approvisionne preque toutes les semaines. Dans le but de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, elle souhaite bénéficier d'un renouvellement de son micro crédit à Finadev visant à maximiser ses intérêts et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire .
texts.en:
Sonia is married and has one child. She sells ready-to-wear clothing, shoes, handbags and school supplies in her store.

She gets new supplies almost every week. Eager to satisfy the needs of her clientele, she would like to obtain a new loan from Kiva's partner, Finadev, in order to maximize her revenue.

loans.use: to buy 20 packs of 200 pagnes (colorful African cloth), 30 packs of 100 paper sheets, and 3 packs of ballpoint pens ("Bic" and other brands)

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 61 years old and married with six children.

Allen works hard to provide for her family.  She runs an ambulant store of grocery items in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Allen has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the ambulant store of grocery items for 15 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Allen aspires to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила замужем. Ее супругу зовут Михаил.  У них трое детей. Людмила имеет свой бизнес.

Людмила выращивает ранние овощи. Этим делом она занимается на протяжении 15 лет. Людмиле нравится это направление. Она целеустремленная и трудолюбивая, живая и предприимчивая.  Этот бизнес содержит ее семью.

Людмила просит предоставить ей кредит на сумму 15,000 гривен на закупку семян, пленки, дров и на ремонт теплицы. Кредит поможет ей увеличить прибыль и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Ludmila is married.  Her husband's name is Mikhail, and they have three children.  Ludmila has her own business.  She grows early vegetables and has been involved in this business for 15 years.  Ludmila likes this business focus.  She is a goal-oriented and hardworking, lively and entrepreneurial.  This business supports her family.  Ludmila is requesting a loan in the sum of 15,000 hryvnia to purchase seeds, plastic, wood, and to repair a greenhouse.  This loan would help her to increase her profit and improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, plastic, wood and materials to repair a greenhouse

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Unisa Ilela Group

texts.en:
Walter is a 50-year-old married man with seven children. Four of them attend secondary school. He has been growing coffee, maize, beans and cassava for over 10 years. He faces agricultural problems due to the lack of fertilizers and crop diseases. 

Walter is working to get more funds to buy fertilizers and insecticides. He is also working hard to increase his scale of production from 7 to 15 in the coming five years with the expectation of earning more income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana is a 45 year old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan who helps support 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy clothes and blankets which she will be selling. She is planning on opening a store to sell these items. She hopes to increase her income to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes and blankets to sell

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn is married. She works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish and from pig fattening. Jerlyn is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Jerlyn has sustained her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca tiene una edad 57 años, tiene un grado de educación secundaria el cual no termino llegando hasta el tercer curso de ciclo pues no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando y sacar una carrera profesional por la falta de recursos económicos. Ella se casó a los 16 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos pero actualmente todos y cada uno de ellos tiene sus propios hogares habitando únicamente ellos dos su casa de habitacion. Tiene 8 años de dedicarse al cultivo y siembra de café, también hace semilleros para hacer viveros y vender la planta. La siembra de maíz y frijoles es otras actividades que realiza por temporadas con el cual le va bien ya que el conocimiento adquirido es aprovechado de la mejor manera posible. El terreno donde esta cultivada la plantación de café está ubicado en la misma comunidad al cual se trasladan en vehículo. El sueño de doña Blanca es hacer de su propiedad productora al 100%, realizar mayor cantidad de viveros de café permitiendo esto obtener mayores y mejores ganancias ya que como agricultores su medio y fuente de ingreso depende del trabajo que en el campo se realiza. Doña Blanca solicita crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, pagar mano de obra y dar a su propiedad el mantenimiento que necesita para obtener una cosecha exitosa ya que la planta está floreciendo y es el momento donde tiene que aplicar los insumos para dar protección a la misma.

loans.use: Para compra de abonos, foliares, fertilizantes, pago de mano de obra para aplicar y asistir su plantación de café

loans.name: Si Se Puede Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SI SE PUEDE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Angela ella es soltera y tiene 18 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere estudiar en la universidad, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche,galletas, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de artesania.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Si Se Puede".  This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco. 

Angela is 18 years old, single, and works in her grocery store.  She sells basic goods such as rice, sugar, milk and oil.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  With this work she wants to attend university.  She already has one year in this business and it is going very well.  Her dream is to expand the grocery store. She is requesting the loan to buy milk, biscuits, sugar, oil and rice to sell in her store. 

The other members work in food sales, clothing sales, grocery sales, and artisan goods.  Angela appreciates those who are part of this dream through this process and is committed to making repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy food for her grocery store.

loans.name: Bhabi's Group

texts.en:
Bhabi,standing to the right hand side in the photograph is a married lady and is a farmer by profession.She is a resident of a small village of Koraput district,Odisha,India. The village does not have access to a proper source of drinking water.The village where she lives sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. Many people in her locality are affected by the water borne diseases due to unavailability of clean and safe drinking water.

Therefore,in order to protect her and her family's health,Bhabi along with her group member is requesting for a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum.She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a water purifier so that she will be able to get clean water to drink and can increase her savings which she is spending now to purchase medicines in order to protect her from diseases.

Bhabi is in dire need of your kind help and is eagerly awaiting for the same.

loans.use: to purchase a water purifier

loans.name: Theophilus

texts.en: Master Theophilus I. is a communications service provider who lives in a community of about 12,000 people, including many students. Due to the high demand from his clients, he needs a loan of $900.00 from Kiva to expand his operations. He is trustworthy and has participated in KSF\'s TEACH program for years. He has also received training in simple record keeping and accounting from KSF.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.en:
Maria is married and has a 6 year-old son. Her husband, José, is a mason and with the salary he receives it is not possible to support their family. This is why María decided to work, and for two years she has been working in shoe sales. This job has been very useful to her and her family because it has allowed her to pay her son’s school fees and offer him a good education. The demand for the shoes that María sells has increased and she has many orders that she hasn’t been able to fill. For this reason she is requesting a loan of $200. You can contribute to the growth of this business. Today you can help someone who is in need—María and her family appreciate it.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

María es casada y tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad. Su esposo José es albañil y con el salario que recibe no es posible sustentar a su familia, por lo que María decidió trabajar y desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de calzado, para ella y su familia ha sido de gran utilidad este oficio, pues le ha permitido pagar las colegiaturas de su hijo y ofrecerle una buena educación a su hijo. La demanda por el calzado que ofrece María se ha incrementado y tiene muchos pedidos que no ha podido surtir, por lo que ella solicita de un préstamo de $ 200 dólares, tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, María y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beads in bulk

loans.name: Mahiye

texts.en: Mahiye S. sells women’s and children’s clothing out of a stand in the town of Devechi, which is located on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Mahiye is looking for funding so that she can increase the variety of her inventory and increase her customer base.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of her inventory

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty B. is a mother of two children. Thirty years old, she is engaged in selling rice. Although she started her business two years ago, she could not earn much at first due to the lack of sufficient capital.

With her previous loan Mabinty was able to make a profit that enabled her to pay her children’s school fees and buy other school requirements. She is now requesting a loan of $200 to further expand her business.

loans.use: Increase her supply of rice for resale

loans.name: Pua

texts.en: Pua is one of the new members at the Alaoa T borrowing centre. She is 21 years old and has one child. She joined the loan program last week when she needed help for her small business selling chips to her fellow villagers and delivering them to the shops in town. She can earn 100-200 Tala ($40-80 US) a week which she can use to pay back family remittances from relatives overseas.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her chips business

loans.name: Akissi Kouakou

texts.en: Mrs. H. Epse Kouakou Akissi is a dynamic and brave 54-year-old woman. She is married and has four children. Her eldest daughter is married, and the youngest has just completed his Accounting diploma. She lives with her family in Yopougon-Sideci, a suburb in the north of the Abidjan disctrict. Mrs. H. has sold smoked fish and frozen meat (pork leg) for many years, in the Yogougon-Sideci market. She purchases fresh fish from fishermen early in the morning every day. She then smokes and grills the fish before selling it. This business allows H. to take care family household and education expenses for the children. Her husband is retired from the public transportation company. Mrs H. is also the President of the cooperative of micro businesswomen of Yopougon-Sideci. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 so she can increase the volume of fish she buys and sells.

loans.use: To purchase fish from fishermen

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
For over 12 years, Akou G. has been a baker. A widow for over three years, she is 39 years old and the mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She manages to provide everything that she and her family needs due to the profits from her sales. Also, she employs two people who assist her with various tasks. She would like to use this loan to buy five bags of flour and three boxes of sugar and to have a second oven constructed.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Depuis une douzaine d’année madame Akou G. est boulangère. Veuve depuis plus de 03 ans elle est âgée de 39 ans et est mère de 04 enfants qui sont tous à l’école. Madame Akou arrive à subvenir à toutes ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants grâce aux bénéfices de ses ventes. Elle a aussi engagé deux personnes qui l’aident dans ses diverses tâches. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter 5 sacs de farine de blé, 03 cartons de sucres et se faire construire un second four.

loans.use: To buy 10 bags of flour, 5 boxes of sugar, and to build another oven

loans.name: Euis

texts.en: Euis is 22, married, and has a son. Everyday, she sells clothing door-to-door and earns $15.00 a week. Her husband sells vegetables at the market and earns $10.00 a day. She will use this loan to add to her business capital.

loans.use: Increase business capital

loans.name: Ruziboi

texts.en:
Ruziboi is 34 years old and is married with five children. He has a private cattle business in which he breeds cattle and sells two cows a month. In addition, Ruziboi grows fodder for the cattle on rented land. The business is stable and is the main income for Ruziboi's large family. 

Ruziboi is applying for a loan for the first time. He requests 2,000.00 Somoni (US $600.00) for 12 months. The loan will be spent on the purchase of cattle for breeding and selling.

loans.use: To expand a cattle business

loans.name: Velida

texts.en: Velida was born in 1980 and she is married. Her husband has a full time job and his monthly income is 900,00KM. They have two children. Velida wants to use this loan of 800,00KM ($650 USD) to buy food for her livestock in order to improve her business. She breeds cows and sells milk products.

loans.use: For buying food for livestock.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
In the neighborhood where I live the houses are very close together. I am in need of installing a fence around my house so that my family can be more protected. We will feel more comfortable knowing that we are more secure. I am requesting $500.00.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

En la colonia donde vivo, las casas están pegadas unas a las otras y tengo la necesidad de colocarle una barda a mi vivienda para tener más protegida a mi familia y obtener una mayor comodidad en ella a sabiendas de tener mayor seguridad, de esta manera solicito la cantidad de $ 500.00 dlls.

loans.use: To build a fence

loans.name: Arinzechwkwu

texts.fr:
Born on October 14, 1964 in Umunze in Nigeria, Monsieur Arinzechukwu O. is single with four children in his care. In 2002 he opened a telephone center called “TELECOMMUNICATION CENTER." In his centre he sells mobile phones, telephone accessories and bottles of gas. He also has a telephone kiosk.

This first loan that he is requesting will allow him to purchase 20 Nokia cell phones and three bottles of gas.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Né le 14 octobre 1964 à Umunze au Nigeria, monsieur O. Arinzechukwu est célibataire avec 4 enfants à charge. Il a ouvert un centre de téléphonie qu’il dénomme « TELECOMMUNICATION CENTER » en 2002. Dans son centre, il vend des téléphones portables et ses accessoires, des bouteilles de gaz. Il dispose également d’une cabine téléphonique.

Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir 20 cellulaires de marque NOKIA et 3 bouteilles de gaz.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and bottles of gas.

loans.name: Carmelo De Jesús

texts.es:
Carmelo B. is a humble laborer who comes from a simple family that has taught him the value of hard work. Carmelo works as a mechanic, a job that has supported him the past 20 years.

Carmelo is single and has two sons, 8 and 9 years old, for whom he works hard to provide daily meals. He also tries to be a good example for his sons so that in the future they will be good people. Thanks to his dedication to his work he was able to become independent, as he began as an assistant mechanic.

Carmelo hopes for a future in which he can open her own workshop. But, for now, he will increase the safety of his house by building a wall which will protect him from the delinquents that live in his neighborhood, Hialeah.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Carmelo B. es un humilde trabajador, que proviene de una familia sencilla que le enseñó el importante valor del trabajo. Carmelo se desempeña como mecánico, actividad que le ha dado el sustento durante 20 años.

Es soltero y tiene 2 hijos varones de 9 y 8 años por los cuales el trabaja arduamente, tanto para darles el sustento diario así como darles un buen ejemplo y que en un futuro sean personas de bien. Gracias a la dedicación a su trabajo pudo independizarse, ya que éste empezó como ayudante.

Desea en un futuro poder poner un taller de mecánica. Pero por el momento dará seguridad a su casa de habitación, construyendo un muro que le pueda dar seguridad y protegerlo de la delicuencia que vive el barrio Hialeah donde éste habita.

loans.use: Building a wall in her house.

loans.name: Marcia Melina

texts.es:
Melina is 29 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her 5 year old son.

She is a very hardworking woman, who makes her living selling groceries from her own tiny convenience store. She was able to open the store a year ago with a great deal of effort. She is now working on improving her business. She works all day, tending to her clients and offering products of the highest quality. What she most appreciates about her business is that she is able to share her working hours with her small son, who requires a lot of attention. Her store requires lots of her attention, and as well and she is determined not to neglect it. Lately, the prices she pays for her products have increased and she is not able to keep up with the increased costs, which has limited her ability to offer her clients the best.

As a result, Melina would like to invest in the the purchase of food products and merchandise in order to stock her store well. She wants her store to be a place where people come and find what they need.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Melina tiene 29 años, es madre soltera y vive con su pequeño hijo de 5 años.

Es una mujer muy trabajadora, dedicada a la venta de abarrotes dentro de su pequeña bodega, la cual pudo instalar con mucho esfuerzo hace 1 año, ahora trabaja en mejorarla, para ello le dedica todo el día, atendiendo a sus clientes y ofreciendo los mejores productos de calidad.Lo que más le agrada de su negocio es que puede compartir horas de trabajo junto a su pequeño hijo, quien requiere de muchas atenciones, al igual que su tienda la cual no puede descuidar.Pero es estas últimas temporadas, los productos subieron sus precios y Melina no puede lidiar con ello, limita su posibilidad de ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.

Es así, que Melina desea invertir en la compra de productos y mercadería, para así surtir su bodega y ser una tienda donde las personas recurran y encuentren lo necesario para sus necesidades.

loans.use: Invest in additional inventory in order to better stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas II”, vive en la Región y Provincia San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de Salchipapas, pollo broster, arroz chaufa y refrescos, vende frente a su casa, el cual está ubicado en el Jr: Ramón Castilla Nº 227, lugar donde acuden diariamente sus comensales, los cuales son moradores de su barrio y visitantes de otros lugares. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará un licuo extractor, mesas, sillas, cremas como salsa de tomate, mostaza en baldes, huevos y otros insumos que necesita para la preparación de los alimentos que a diario oferta a sus clientes.

En estos últimos tiempos se incrementaron las ventas gracias al trato amable, higiene, sazón y un local acogedor.

Gloria, de 51 años, es una mujer decidida, alegre y buena administradora. Tiene como meta implementar el negocio con más mesas y sillas,  porque su clientela va en aumento.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria, a member of the Las Aguerridas II (The Veternas) village bank, lives in Tarapoto, San Martin, Peru. She sells hot dog dishes, roasted chicken, fried rice, and drinks; she sells from the front of her home on Ramon Castilla Street. Her daily customers are primarily her neighbors and visitors from other places. With this $350 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase a liquid extractor, tables, chairs, ketchup, mustard, eggs, and other ingredients that she needs for the preparation of the food she offers to her customers. Lately, her sales have increased due to her friendly treatment of customers, the cleanliness of her locale, and the great taste of her food. Gloria is 51 years old and a determined, happy woman who is a good manager of her business. Her goal is to add tables and chairs to her store since her clientele is increasing.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of assets (liquid extractor, tables, chairs) condiments, and other ingredients

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer A. is 41 years old. He and his wife have 2 children. Azer`s children are small now, but he already is working hard to ensure the best future for them. Azer is the only breadwinner in the family and is very hard-working. 

Azer has a shop in the local central market. For more than three years he has sold a wide range of detergents, cereals, cookies at attractive prices. His shop is very popular in his neighborhood and brings in a steady income. Azer applied for a loan of 1200 USD to expand his inventory. Your support will really help him. Let's get behind this dedicated father and help him with make his children's dreams a reality.

loans.use: to expand his inventory

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr:
SOKHNA S. EST COMMERCANTE DE TISSUS THIOUB PRETS A PORTER , SACS ,CHAUSSURES,... DEPUIS 03 ANS.
AVEC LE PRET ,IL COMPTE RENFORCER SES ACTIVITES. ELLE EST MARIEE ET HABITE AU QUARTIER CHAMP DE COURSE DE DIOURBEL.
texts.en:
Sokhna S. has been selling "thioub" (hand-dyed cloth), as well as ready-to-wear, handbags, and shoes for 3 years.

With this loan, she hopes to boost her business. She is married and lives in the Champ de Course neighborhood of Diourbel.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: re-selling cloth, etc.

loans.name: Coca Cola Group

texts.es: El Grupo "Coca Cola" esta representado por la señora Maria Luisa, ella posee una pequeña tienda D. barrio en la cual venD. dulces, abarrotes y productos en general, mas D. la mitad del grupo se dedica a la agricultura o a la cria D. vacas, chanchos y pescados, algunos tienen pequeños puestos D. venta en el mercado central. Son gente emprendedora y con ganas D. progresar ellas(os) ya se encuentran cumpliendo su tercer ciclo en la Fundacion Agrocapital, por lo que conocen el trabajo en grupos solidarios. En el periodo D. tiempo que trabajaron con la Fundacion han demostrado puntualidad y esmero en los pagos y cumplimiento con la Intitucion y a su mismo grupo. El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento D. productos a la venta, asi como para la compra D. Insumos, Herramientas y materiales para sus diferentes actividades en especial para la epoca naviD.ña donD. se incrementa la venta D. los diferentes productos y animales.
texts.en:
The "Coca Cola" group is repesented by Maria Luisa. She owns a small neighborhood store where she sells candy, groceries and basic goods. More than half of the group works in agriculture or raise cattle, pigs or fish. Some have small stands in the central market. They are hard-working people with a desire to get ahead. They are completing their third cycle with Fundacion Agrocapital and are familiar with group loans. During the time they have worked with Fundacion they have shown punctuality and great care in meeting their payments with this institution and with the group. The purpose of this loan is to increase their inventory as well as to buy supplies, tools, and materials for their different activities, particularly for the Christmas season when sales increase for their different products and animals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Samphors S. is the group leader for four people who all live in Sontouch village in Kampong Chhnang province. She sells vegetables and fish in the local market. Since she now has a lot of customers who need many things, she wants to expand her business. Thus, she has decided to request a loan to buy more vegetables and fish for her business. She would use any left-over money to purchase rice seed to grow on her field.

Mrs. Samphors S. hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this new loan. Her husband, Mr. Kim Sambath, is a construction worker. Mrs. Samphors S. is 26 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the younger one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fish for her business

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 35-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Jihad has been selling vegetables and fruit for 14 years. He also works as a schoolbus driver. Jihad requests a loan of $1200 USD from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his business and do some maintenance work on his bus. This is the first time that Jihad has requested a loan.
Jihad is speciA. in his work because he sells good vegetables and fruit. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Jihad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his business and to do some maintenance work on his bus.

loans.name: Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
el grupo Luchadoras lo conforman tres mujeres que residen en la colonia 28 de marzo y se conocen desde hace varios años, Victoria Zenobia F. de 39 años de edad se dedica a la venta de nacatamales, cosmeticos, panes y tortillas, Lorena A. de 20 años de edad es la mas joven del grupo pero ella tiene un sentimiendo emprendedor heredado de su familia y se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y sandalias.
Maria O. de 34 años de edad tiene como fuente principal de ingresos la venta de tortillas, tambien vende ropa y cosmeticos, las tres integrantes son vecinas y se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo, por lo que se respaldan entre ellas, todas son madres de familia, resposables que luchan por sacar adelante a sus hijos, ellas en este momento necesitan un credito para poder sacar adelante sus negocios y asi mismo poder sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "Luchadoras" group is made up of three women who live in the 28 de marzo neighbourhood and have known one another for a number of years. Victoria Zenobia F., aged 39, sells nacatamales (a typical food), cosmetics, breads and tortillas. Lorena A., at 20 years of age is the youngest in the group, has inherited an entrepreneural spirit from her family; she sells cosmetics and sandals. Maria O., aged 34, makes most of her income selling tortillas but also sells clothing and cosmetics. The three members are neighbours and have known each other for a long time as they are supportive of each other; they are all mothers, responsible women who work hard to give their children a good start in life. They now need a loan to bolster their businesses and as a result give their children a good start in life.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, cornflour, salt, lime, cosmetics and breads.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Анвар мужчина 32 лет ,женат имеет пятеро детей. Жена дома занимается  с детьми дома домашними делами. Сам Анвар  пастух в колхозе Урунходжаева. Вместе с семьёй он откармливает несколько голов баранов. Для закупа ещё баранов он обратился в Микроивест. Колхоз ему заработную плату не платит, а выдаёт вместо денег продукты питания. Для увеличения оборотного капитала и повышения уровня жизни семьи Анвар хочет в кредит закупить скот.
texts.en:
Anvar is a man of 32 years of age, he is married and has five children. His wife stays at home with the children and does housework. Anvar works as a shepherd at the collective farm of Urunhodjaev. Together with the family he raises several heads of sheep. To buy more sheep he has come to MicroInvest. At the farm he does not receive a salary, but is paid by food and produce instead of money. To increase his working capital and improve the quality of life of his family Anvar wants to buy cattle in credit.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising of cattle and sales

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel es socia del Banco Comunal Trigales.
Raquel es soltera y tiene 23 años, Raquel se dedica a la venta de comida, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hermana, sus ventas los realiza ambulatoriamente en el terminal de una empresa de transporte urbano.
Raquel necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo.
Los sueños de Raquel son construir su casa y tener un negocio mas grande.
texts.en:
Raquel is a member of the Wheat Field Communal Bank. Raquel is single, 23 years old. She sells meals, something that she does with the help of her sister. She makes her sales from an urban public transport station. Raquel needs a loan of $300, which will be used to purchase rice, sugar, and pasta. Raquel's dreams are to build a house and have a larger business.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, and pasta

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.en:
P. Abdulaziz has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married with two children.

Abdulaziz has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. He began this enterprise eight years ago with a starting capital of $600, thanks to his perseverance and dedication. Over time he expanded his business and today this business has become domestic and his son (pictured) helps him with the business.

Today he needs to buy additional foodstuffs for increasing the range of his goods. For this purpose, Abdulaziz is requesting a loan of $1100 for the term of 12 months. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita V. is a member in good standing from Katipa, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.  She is sixty-one years old and has eight children.  She is currently engaged in a fish-vending business and had only $10 for her start up capital.  Amazingly, she manages her business well. Teresita would like Paglaum, one of Kiva's field partners, to finance her needed capital.  She applied for a loan of $425 to buy more fish to sell and to help with the maintenance of her fishing boat. She wants to save for her old age and to live simply with her children around her.

loans.use: To buy more fish and to maintain her boat.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
" This is my second time on KIVA. I ended my previous loan successfully, and I want to use the same program through CEVI. I started my farming business using a one-hectare farm. I also raise ducks, more than 400 and counting, to be able to support all the needs of our two children," says Nelia T., farmer, duck raiser and a mother from Agusan Del Sur in Mindanao.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 6,000 (US$ 125) from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase feed for the ducklings and fertilizers for her rice farm. 

"My previous loan has really helped me in my business. I am hoping that I will be able to achieve the same success with my new loan," she said. 

CEVI helps small businesses grow. They provide clients with not just credit but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the ducklings and fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Ankabenkélenkan 2. 9 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2. 9 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Fonfona de la ville de Koutiala  région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles cultivent principalement  du riz et de l’arachide comme activité  secondaire.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser  leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Ankabenkélenkan 2 .9 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre premiers   prêts, elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence de riz d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au marché de Fonfona, M’pessoba et Zansoni. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au marché de M’pessoba et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail et en gros, au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2. 9 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 65 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Ankabenkélenkan 2. 9 is a group of married women of the village of Fonfona in Koutiala City, Sikasso region (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. They have an average age of 35 and at least 5 children. They grow mainly rice, and they grown peanuts as a secondary business. Concerned about making their farms profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program five years ago. After having correctly repaid the first four loans, they are now on their fifth farm loan. The current loan will be used to buy a sufficient quantity of seeds for planting rice and peanuts, some minor supplies and equipment, and fertilizers and such, for farming. Supplies are gotten at the marketplaces of Fonfona, M’pessoba, and Zansoni. Following the off-season, the crops are stored for a certain time, so that they gain in value. Then the crops are sold retail and wholesale in cash transactions at the M’pessoba market and at surrounding markets. Their customers come generally from large cities. After selling their produce, the group members each intend to realize a profit of 65,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to cover common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and minor supplies and equipment

loans.name: Reina Maria

texts.es: Reina María S. Céspedes tiene la edad de 38 años, madre soltera, tiene dos hijos a su cargo. su  actividad económica es el comercio de ropa nueva  desde hace más de seis años que se dedica a este negocio. Surge por la necesidad de poseer una fuente de ingresos para su familia y poder sustentarse. Sus dos hijos de diferentes edades el mayor veinte años y siete años el menor, no asisten a la escuela debido a la falta de ingresos económicos.  La solicitud del crédito será utilizada para capital de trabajo, para comprar ropa nueva, perfumes, pantalones, camisas y cosméticos. Ella ofrece sus productos de forma ambulante, la mercadería entre sus clientes que son amigos, familiares y compañeros de trabajo. Reina S. anteriormente ha recibido préstamos de parte de la Fundación, mejorando su  forma de vida y sus ingresos de esta forma ha podido subsistir durante este tiempo. Como cualquier persona tiene aspiraciones y su meta es tener un negocio propio y ser ella misma su jefe.
texts.en:
Reina María S. Céspedes is 38 years old, and a single mother of two. Her business is the sale of new clothes, and she has been in business for more than six years. She works because of a need to have a source of income for her family and to be able to sustain herself. Her children, the older twenty years old and the younger seven years old, do not attend school because of a lack of income. Reina's loan will be used for working capital, to purchase new clothing, perfumes, pants, shirts and cosmetics. She offers her products door-to-door among her customers, who are friends, family and co-workers. Reina S. has received prior loans from Fundación, and improving her lifestyle and her income in this way has allowed her to subsist during this time. Like anyone, Reina has aspirations, and her goal is to have her own business and be her own boss.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús tiene 40 años, es un hombre serio y responsable, felizmente casado con la madre de sus 2 hijos de 18 y de 13 años con quienes viven en su casa propia hecha a base de adobes. Sus padres eran agricultores, por ende él aprendió todas las técnicas de esta actividad y desde que se casó trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja en la siembra de papas, arvejas y habas. De todos los cultivos que realiza se sienten más identificado con las arvejas, porque le generan mayores ganancias y son de poca inversión, pues aprovechan de sembrar en las chacras donde hayan crecido las papas y de ese modo usa la fertilidad de esas tierras. En cierta temporada, Jesús se dedica netamente a la papa y se siente muy a gusto labrando la tierra, por ello que trata de sembrar alternadamente diversos productos para que de ese modo no deje de generarse ganancias, pues gracias a ellos mantiene a su familia y cubre la educación de sus hijos. Actualmente Jesús tiene pensado adquirir más terrenos cultivables para que de ese modo pueda cubrir la educación superior de sus hijos. Durante los 8 préstamos consecutivos que tuvo con MFP ha pagado puntualmente todas sus cuotas y para este crédito hace el mismo compromiso de seguir siendo responsable. Jesús tiene la característica de dar opiniones muy acertadas durante las reuniones de su banco comunal, las cuales son escuchadas con mucha atención por sus demás compañeros. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos que acompañarán a la semilla y de ese modo su siembra esté garantizada.
texts.en:
Jesús is 40. He is a serious and responsible man who is happily married to the mother of his two children. Their children are 18 and 13, and they live together in their own house made of adobe. His parents were farmers, and he learned all about the work. Since he got married he has worked together with his wife planting potatoes, peas, and beans. Of all of his crops, he favors the peas because they generate the most income with little investment. He plants them in the fields where potatoes grew, and he takes advantage of these fertile grounds. In certain times Jesús works only with the potatoes, and he really likes working the land. He tries to alternately plant diverse products so that he is always generating income. Thanks to the crops, he can support his family and cover his children’s educational costs. Jesús is currently thinking of acquiring more fertile land so that he can cover his children’s high school expenses. During the eight consecutive loans that he had with MFP, he made all of his payments on time. With this loan he makes the same promise to keep being responsible. Jesús characteristically gives wise opinions during his community bank meetings. Because of this, his colleagues pay a lot of attention to his opinions. The money he is asking for is to buy chemical fertilizers to go with the seeds. This way his plants are guaranteed.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
K. Jane is the leader of Twezimbe group in Kigunga. She is 40 years old and a mother of 4 children (2 girls and 2 boys) and she cares for 2 dependants. Jane is a very hard working lady with a tailoring business that she has been running for 5 years. At the moment, she works from the main street outside another person’s shop plus working from her house.

She has a dream of one day owning her own business premises where she can even start a tailoring school mostly to admit young girls that would want to start something for the future. Jane needs a loan to be able to buy sewing and clothing materials for her customers’ orders and to display.

loans.use: To buy  more clothing materials for her business.

loans.name: Mary Njoki

texts.en:
Mary Njoki is 49 years old and single. She lives in Kirigu, Kikuyu, where she has rental houses. She has been a landlady for the last two years.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who was a member of one of the groups. Mary has not borrowed from any other sources before.  However, she has already taken out and repaid two loans on time with KADET. This will be her third loan.  

Mary is very hardworking and industrious. She plans to use the funds to diversify her business into other areas so she can maximize her returns. This includes digging a water bore hole so that she can sell water because the area has a water shortage and to buy a water tank to store water. She also engages in dairy farming and desires to buy another cow for milk soon.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: investing in a water bore hole and buying a water storage tank

loans.name: Mrs. Met Hort Group Loan

texts.en:
Mrs. Met H. is the group leader for four members who all live in Konlaeng Kha village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Chhenh Thoeun, is a basket middleman. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more baskets to resell to earn more income to support the family. Mrs. Met H. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is a 25-year-old mother of two children who are too young to work or study.

One member in this group loan has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. EoT borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more baskets to resell

loans.name: Francisca Jessenia

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Francisca R. se dedica arduamente a la venta de accesorios para vehículo como lo son alfombras, tricos, forros para timón, antenas, entre otros.

Ella require inverter en la compra de los productos y por ende acudió a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito oportuno y de esta manera abastecer su negocio de los accesorios para automóvil y así continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the department of León, Sra. Francisca R. sells vehicle accessories such as floor mats, wiper blades, tire rims, antennas, and other items.

She needs to purchase more products, so she has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan. Francisca will acquire more auto accessories so that she can continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase automobile accessories

loans.name: Phoeun
