texts.en: The smiling face we see in this photo belongs to Mrs. Phoeun S., who earns a small income by raising pigs near her home and growing rice during the dry season. She is 30 years old, married and has two children who are in their teens. Her husband makes a living as a fisherman, and the family lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. Because raising pigs is her main hope for earning more income, S. has applied for a loan to buy piglets to feed and raise.

loans.use: To buy piglets to feed and raise

loans.name: Hermilina

texts.en: Forty-eight-year-old Hermilina, a married woman with two children, loves making dresses and other types of clothing. Her skills encouraged her to open up a dress shop, and by God’s grace, she was able to send her children to school. Now Hermilina is applying for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. which she will use  to purchase cloth and other supplies she needs for her business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim, age 32, is a responsible father of 5 children who has always watched over his family’s financial security. Ibrahim breeds cattle and sells them at market. He would like to increase his herd. With this goal in mind, brahim is requesting a loan of $ 2100 that will serve him as business capital. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve the living conditions for his household and also to make some investments.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 47-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Alice has owned a clothing shop since 2004. Alice is notable in her work because she offers competitive prices. Her clients are her friends and neighbors.

She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is her second loan cycle and she has always paid on time.

When she first started her business, she had no problems. Alice decided on opening her business because she wanted to have independent work and be financially independent. In the future, she plans to expand.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
At her young age, she is blissfully married to Leo M., 26 years old, and makes sets of furniture from bamboo. They are happily living on the Island of Talim, Binangonan Rizal. She is blessed with her two children, Adrian and Francis May.

She is a poor woman, and because she wanted to rise from poverty, she encouraged herself to join ASHI, an MFI and Kiva field partner, to access capital to start up a business. She received the amount of 5,000 PHP for her first loan, and she was able to utilize it in her business, the making of bamboo sets (furniture). The business still exists. On her fourth loan she is asking for 17,000 PHP for the same business. She will purchase bamboo, rolls of bamboo strips, nails and other equipment for making furniture. She also plans to expand her business to get involved in double-deck making (bunk beds) for more income.

She wants to have savings for their future needs, especially because she hopes to send her children to school until they finish college. She dreams that her children will be professionals in order for them to live a happy and contented life.

That is the story of a simple, baby-faced and courageous mother, only 23 years old, Jocelyn M..

loans.use: to buy bamboo, bamboo strips, nails, etc. for the growth of her business

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama N. est âgée de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du BANC VILLAGEOIS de SIMBANDI depuis 7 ans et a eu 14 expériences avec le crédit. Depuis plusieurs années, elle vend des céréales, des arachides, de l'huile de palme et du miel. Cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de prendre en charge ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adama N. is 51 years old, married, and the mother of five children, who are in her care.  She has been a member of BANC VILLAGEOIS de SIMBANDI for seven years and has had fourteen experiences with borrowing.  For several years, she has been selling grains, peanuts, palm oil, and honey.  This business brings in the profits enabling her to support her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Advancing her commercial business

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame Awa W. est une jeune femme mariée  âgée de 29 ans qui habite à Ouakam. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle a déjà bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur. Elle a intégré le commerce de tissus, sacs, chaussures et divers produits depuis plus de 4 ans. Madame W. a eu la chance de naitre dans une grande famille ou presque tous les membres sont des commerçants. Sa mère voyage périodiquement en destination de la Chine de l’Inde ou de d’autres pays dans le monde.  C’est a partir de la qu’elle s’est exercée  en prenant les marchandises qu’elle  essayait d’écouler jusqu'à ce qu’elle se soit approprie une clientèle. Par conséquent elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs pour renouveler et accroitre son stock de marchandises. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins personnels qui ne peuvent pas être réglés avec l’argent qu’il reçoit de son mari.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs Awa W. is a young lady, aged 29, who lives in Ouakam. She is married and the mother of three children. She was already granted a previous loan. She has been for four years in the trade of cloths, handbags, shoes and various other items. She was fortunate to be born in a large family where nearly everyone becomes a merchant. Her mother travels regularly to China, India and other countries throughout the world. Mrs W. learnt her selling skills as she took these goods and sold them to a clientele that she steadily built up.

Currently she applies for a loan of 200,000 CFA francs to renew and increase her inventory. Her profit enables her to satisfy her personal needs that cannot be met with the money she gets from her husband.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting people in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Fifty-three-year-old Lolita T. is a fish buyer. She has nine children; the eldest is thirty-seven years old. Lolita says that she has a great market for selling fish. She dreams of being able to meet all of the needs in her family every day, of having good health, and of repaying her loans. She is reapplying for a loan of PHP 8,000 to enable her to add capital to her business; she hopes to receive a loan to buy more fish to resell in the market.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell in the market

loans.name: Auxiliadora Modesta

texts.es:
La señora Auxiliadora G. se dedica a la venta de frutas vendiéndolas a diario en el mercado la Terminal en León. Realiza compras de cosechas en Masaya las que son recolectadas por su núcleo familiar y  trasladado por camión al mercado La terminal ubicándose en su puesto de venta desde la mañana y ofreciendo las frutas a los clientes que le visitan a diario.

Ella solicita un crédito porque tiene la necesidad de invertirlo en la compra de las frutas para así venderlos en el mercado y de esta manera obtener dichos ingresos para su propio desarrollo y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Auxiliadora G. sells fruit every day at the terminal market in León. She shops for produce in Masaya. Her family comes to pick up the produce and ship it by truck to her vending stall at the terminal market, where customers come by on a daily basis in search of the fruit that she offers.

The loan she is requesting will be used to by fruit to sell at the market. This will help generate income needed for her own development and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit

loans.name: Daya Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
"GUSTI AYU S. (0) is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of TEGAL CANGKRING.  GUSTI AYU is the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is DAYA PERTIWI (MUK-0006).

GUSTI AYU is married and has 2 very young children.  To make a living, GUSTI AYU owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  GUSTI AYU has been engaged in this business for over 4 years.

In 2008, GUSTI AYU joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  GUSTI AYU is requesting a loan from MUK for the first time. She is now requesting a loan of 1,700,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  GUSTI AYU plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation, and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





GUSTI AYU S. (0) merupakan 32 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota TEGAL CANGKRING.  GUSTI AYU adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah DAYA PERTIWI (MUK-0006).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  GUSTI AYU sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun.  0  Dalam 2008, GUSTI AYU bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  GUSTI AYU meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,700,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena tiene 42 años, ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 pues los créditos han sido de buen provecho para su negocio. Su actividad económica es la venta de tortillas, es una actividad muy humilde pero muy importante pues le ha dado lo necesario para mantener a sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuando sus clientes llegan sonrientes a comprar sus productos pues esto le produce una gran satisfacción. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo así podrá comprar maíz, cal, leña. Su deseo es mejorar las condiciones de su local.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena is 42 years old. She has worked with the León 2000 Foundation for a long time, since the loans have been an excellent resource for her business. Her work is selling tortillas. It is a very humble but very important job, because it has provided her with the means to support her 2 children, for whom she is responsible. What she likes most about her work is when her customers arriving smiling to buy her products, since that gives her great satisfaction. The financing she is currently requesting will be used to provide working capital, so that she can buy corn, lime and firewood. Her desire is to improve the condition of her sales stand.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita D. is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Barangay Delicioso, Ilog, Negros Occidental.  She is married and has seven adult-aged children.  To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling different products in the local community.  Margarita has been engaged in this business for over eleven years and earns approximately $220 a month from these activities.

In May of 1999, Margarita joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from NWTF. Margarita is now requesting a new loan of 29,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be her 16th loan from NWTF.  Margarita plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand the business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called "honorable", meaning that they have earned the respect of their community through hard work and determination. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda G. is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a general store and a networking business of beauty and herbal products. She lives in Barangay Mambagaton, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental, with her 40-year-old husband, Ramie, and their three schooled children who are from 8 to 16 years old. Rosalinda has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and her networking of beauty and herbal products business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 12,000. Rosalinda is now borrowing Php 27,000 so that she is able to expand her general store and networking businesses. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 26,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Rosalinda aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Fernando Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. Fernando Jose C. S., tiene la edad de 40 años, es casado tiene dos hijos menores de edad que estudian la escuela primaria y dependen económicamente de ellos, la familia habita en el Barrio Medardo Andino, su esposa se dedica a las tareas domésticas diarias, el señor es fontanero y trabaja para la Empresa Nicaragüense de Agua Potable desde hace 6 años, siendo esta la fuente de ingresos de la familia C.. 

Dentro de sus Objetivos de vida, está el tener los recursos necesarios para poder brindarle a sus  hijos los estudios profesionales y que se valgan por ellos mismos a un futuro y les apoyen a sus padres a la sobrevivencia diaria, los recursos económicos de la familia son bastante limitados y es por esta razón que no han podido realizar mejoras a la infraestructura de su hogar, la idea principal de esta inversión es lograr que los hijos tengan una mayor privacidad con la construcción de sus cuartos independientes, la ayuda que se le proporcione a esta familia aportara al bienestar económico social de todos los miembros y marcara positivamente  al desarrollo de los pequeños.
texts.en:
Fernando Jose C. S., age 40, is married and has two minor children. The children go to elementary school and are economically dependent upon them. The family lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood. His wife devotes herself to the daily household chores. He is a plumber, and has worked for the Nicaraguan Potable Water Company for six years. This is the source of income for the C. family. One of his life objectives is to have the necessary resources to provide his children with an education to become professionals. This will allow them to support themselves in the future and to help their parents with their daily survival. The family’s resources are pretty limited. That is why he has not been able to make improvements to the infrastructure of his home. The main idea of this investment is for his children to have greater privacy by building their separate rooms. The help given to this family will contribute to the socioeconomic well-being of all of the members. It will positively effect the development of the little ones.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon A. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. He is 35 years old. Marlon is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Marlon owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marlon has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 60000 PHP during harvest season.

Marlon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlon is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marlon from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: El Gran Esfuerzo (Grupos 3, 7) Group

texts.en:
Juan is the coordinator of his group "El Gran Esfuerzo" (The Great Effort).  His story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom have recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. His group is located in Hato Mayor, an agricultural area in the east of the country, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home there in a simple structure with his long-term partner and their children.

Juan is excited to be taking his sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loans and grown his business. He plans to use this one to invest in his fuel business and to buy more gasoline and charcoal for sale. He will use the profits to make improvements to his house and buy school supplies for his children. Juan hopes this will contribute to the well-being of his family and to the education of his children. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and charcoal.

loans.name: Barot

texts.ru: Султонов Барот проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 65 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Более 12 лет занимается растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает овощи и фрукты. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений. Барот хочет получить хороший урожай и вынести на рынок.
texts.en:
Barot S. lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 65 years old, he is married and has six children. He has secondary education. He has been in agriculture for more than twelve years. He mainly grows fruits and vegetables. He is taking out the loan to buy mineral fertilizer. Barot wants to collect a good harvest and sell it on the market.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El solicitante es casado, tiene 2 hijos menores los cuales estan estudiando en primaria; su esposa le ayuda en en negocio que tienen en su casa una pequeña tienda. El destino del credito es para incrementar su capital e invertir en com´pra de mercaderia.
texts.en:
This borrower is married and has two young children attending primary school. His wife helps him in the small shop they have installed in their house. The loan he is requesting will be used to increase his working capital and to buy core products.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his working capital and to buy core products.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local Sudanese alcohol (siko) at home and is requesting a loan to stock more brewing materials like yeast (kemira) to brew more siko to sell. Rose is 49 years old and married to a peasant. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to stock crates of beer and open up a bar.

loans.use: Stock more brewing materials like yeast (kemira) to brew more siko to sell

loans.name: Dim Din I Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Dim Din I” group. They are women with small-scale businesses based in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Isatu J. who is age thirty-two and was born in Kono, eastern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and has one child. Her child is attending primary school.

For five years now, Isatu has sold slippers/flip-flops, underwear, and cosmetics. With her share of this loan, she will improve on the size and quality of her business by buying more of the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy more slippers/flip-flops, underwear and cosmetics to add to her stock

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom E., age 46, is the leader of this group loan, having been selected by the other members of the group. They are located in Krapeu Ha village in Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses.

Mrs. Sokhom E. is a grocery seller while her husband, Mr. Lors Khann, is a Khmer cake seller in the local village. With both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family.  

In order to support these businesses, Mrs. Sokhom E. will use the loan from AMK to buy more groceries to resell and to buy a flour mill to support her husband's business. This couple has five children; one is on the staff of an organization while the other four are students and also help their parents' businesses.

loans.use: buying groceries for resale; buying a flour mill

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer muy dedicada al trabajo como a su familia, hoy en día tiene un pequeño kiosko donde vende una variedad de golosinas, gaseosas, repostería, tacos, hamburguesa entre otros. 
Vende en una parada de bus muy concurrida lo que es de beneficio para su venta. Iniciando hace tres años con apoyo económico de su esposo el cual se desempeña como conductor. 
Su objetivo es comprar un carrito de hogdog y lograr  captar clientes nuevos ya que por ser ricos y accesibles de precios se venden mucho.
Es por eso hará esta mejora atreves del financiamiento de la institución y lograr una alternativa de venta y de ingresos que falta que le hace a su hogar ya que todo está caro y hay que trabajar mucho para lograr satisfacer las necesidades alimenticias como gastos básicos.
texts.en:
Rosa is very dedicated to her family. She has a small kiosk where she sells a variety of snacks, soft drinks, desserts, tacos, and hamburgers, among other things. She sells at a very well visited bus stop, which benefits her sales. She began the business three years ago, with financial help from her husband who works as a driver. Her goal is to buy a hot dog cart and attract new customers, because hot dogs taste good and are easy to come by and sell well. For this reason she will make this improvement through financing from the institution, and establish and alternative for sales and income, which her household needs, because everything is expensive and one must work very much to be able to satisfy the basic necessities and expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hot Dog Cart

loans.name: Rajani

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Rajani B., who is married and has three children aged 19, 17 and 13. In 1990 she established her goat-raising business, supporting her family by working seven days a week, five hours a day. Now requesting her first loan from Patan BPW, Rajani wants to purchase food for the goats, and in the future plans to expand the business. Rajani thanks you for your support.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to its clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: To buy food for goats

loans.name: Segundo Marcos

texts.es:
Segundo es un padre de familia que tiene 47 años de edad, reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Pacasmayo, una zona que es la capital de la provincia del mismo nombre y que se encuentra ubicada a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de 15 años a la venta de limones y ajíes en un puesto situado en el mercado de su distrito. El suele ofrecer estos productos por las mañanas y debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles que siempre acuden a su puesto porque prefieren su buen trato y la calidad de los productos que ofrece.

Segundo se vale de estos ingresos para sustentar a su familia. Actualmente desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más verduras para ofrecérselas a sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Segundo es una persona honrada y bastante trabajadora. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Segundo, 47, is a father living with his family in Pacasmayo district, a place that’s the capital of the province of the same name, located over two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

For over 15 years he has sold lemons and chilies in a stand located in the district market.  He usually works during the morning and due to the length of time he’s been in business he has a base of regular customers that always come by his stand because they prefer the good treatment and quality of products he offers.

Segundo avails himself of this income to support his family.  He wants to enlarge his business buying more vegetables to offer his customers.  He has, therefore, thought it convenient to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

Segundo is an honest, quite hard working person.  He has had previous loans with Edpyme Alternativa and has been punctual and responsible with his repayments.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita B. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 60 years-old and married with five adult children. To make a living, Conchita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling ready to wear clothing and shoe products in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Conchita joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Conchita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital.

loans.name: Nyambayar

texts.en:
Nyambayar M. is 25 years old and lives with her husband and son in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a rented apartment. Her husband is an accountant and works in a private company. Nyambayar operates a retail clothing business in the Republic of Tuvans. Her siblings currently live and work in Kyzyl, the capital city of the Republic of Tuva.  They rent and sell a variety of consumer goods in the local community.

Nyambayar is responsible for importing products from China while her sibling is responsible for selling the products in the market of Kyzyl. She began her business in 2008, first selling consumer goods, and has since expanded her product line by selling a variety of construction materials along with her goods-trading business.

For the future, she plans to have her own factory space. Nyambayar says, "Nowadays, a traveling business is not enough to support an entire family. I am planning to establish a manufacturing business by producing a variety of items so that my business might be profitable. Unfortunately, I cannot obtain a loan for a high amount, so therefore my earnings are not sufficient enough for my business."

She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan in order to import children's clothing items as well as construction materials from China which her sibling can sell in the foreign market.

loans.use: To import children's clothing items

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon K., 41, sells old tires at Kayole Estate in Nairobi. Kayole is near a slum called Soweto, and Simon's customers are low class people. He is married to Beatrice Munee who is a dressmaker and together they have two daughters: Linet (11), and Cynthia (2). He has been running this business for 13 years, and he gets a monthly profit Kshs 20,000 and his wife also supports him financially.

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by existing clients. This will be his second loan, and he plans to use the Kshs 40,000 to buy more old tires for resale. If the loan boosts the business, he will open another shop for the same business and employ someone to help him.

In the future, Simon who describes himself as hardworking and trustworthy hopes to open a vehicle spare parts shop and provide higher education to his children.

loans.use: To increase stock of tires for sale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: To make a living, Teresita G. sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 41 years old, married and has one school-aged child. They are from the village of Esperanza West. Teresita has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en:
Marvin S. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 29 years old. Marvin is married and has 3 children aged 10, 9 and 8. To make a living, Marvin owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale.

Marvin joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marvin has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Marvin is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
Luis Felipe es padre de familia, muy dedicado a sobresalir adelante con su familia de dos hermosos hijos. Labora como maestro de obra desde hace doce años. 
Iniciando como albañil, en donde obtuvo mucha experiencia, y hoy en día lo ejerce más profesional. Cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposa quien trabaja como estilista.
Luis su casa la ido construyendo poco a poco con financiamientos que la institución ha otorgado, siendo su séptimo ciclo en donde con este nuevo préstamo comprara materiales de construcción para cambio de sistema eléctrico como compra de azulejos para poner en el baño. Con la ventaja que el mismo hace los trabajo.
texts.en: Luis Felipe is a father who is very dedicated to succeeding with his family. He has two handsome children. He has worked as a master builder for twelve years. He started off as a bricklayer, obtaining a lot of experience, and today he is much more professional. He counts on his wife's economic support; she works as a stylist. Luis has been building his house bit by bit with the loans that the institution has authorized. This is his seventh loan cycle, and with this new loan he will purchase construction materials to change the electric system, and he will purchase tiles to put in the bath. He has the advantage of doing the work himself.

loans.use: he will purchase materials such as: tile to put in the bath, and he will improve the electrical system

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra B. is from the village of Malinao, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 28 years old. Myra is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Myra owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling animal feed and farm-related products for pigs and chickens in the local community. Myra has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Myra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. Myra is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like pig and chicken feed. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Myra from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like pig & chicken feeds

loans.name: Damas De Hierro Group

texts.es:
El comité Damas de Hierro nació hace más de dos años.
Este comité es de San Lorenzo, en estos dos años de intenso trabajo han crecido económicamente.
Nélida es la presidenta de este grupo y ella se dedica a preparar comidas para vender a las personas que acuden a su pequeño negocio, siempre trata de aumentar la calidad de sus productos para que sus clientes queden satisfechos.
La mayoría de las integrantes son madres y buscan progresar para poder brindar a sus hijos una mejor vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
The group named Damas de Hierro (Iron Women) was formed more than two years ago. 

Nelida is the president of this group and she works preparing food for people who come to her small business. She is always trying to improve the quality of her products so that her clients are satisfied. 

This group is located in San Lorenzo. And following two years of intense work they have managed to grow financially. The majority of the members are mothers who work to provide their children with a better life and wellbeing.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, rice, flour, tomatoes, lettuce, onions, potatoes, meats, eggs. etc.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn M. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 34 years old. Madelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Madelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Madelyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Madelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Madelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Madelyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Madelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es: El Sr A.  labora como lector  es casado, tiene dos personas a su cargo, vive en managua,  es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece la oportunidad de  este  desembolso, para compra de materiales como bloque, hierro cemento, madera, para hacer un cuarto para darle mejor condicion de vida a mi familia ya que esta creciendo el numero de hijos  que tengo , esta muy bueno lo que estan haciendo esta microfinanciera favoreciendo a mucha gente por que sin ustede no podriamos salir adelante con nuestra familia.
texts.en: Mr. A. works as a reader and has two people under his care. He lives in the city of Managua. This is his first loan authorized by Kiva partner CEPRODEL, and he is grateful for the opportunity to purchase materials like blocks, iron, cement and wood to make a room in his home so he can provide his growing family with better living conditions. He thinks microfinance is doing a very good thing and helping a lot of people because without it he would not be able to make headway for his family.

loans.use: Make improvements to his home

loans.name: Sonia Isabel

texts.es: Sonia Isabel de 52 años, reside en el barrio de la paz, vive con su esposo y dos hijos. El negocio es la venta de mercadería en general, que atiende desde hace 4 años, todos los días de la semana ya que está instalada en su casa de habitación y de manera ambulante. Ella actualmente necesita un préstamo para comprar calzado, ropa en general, cosméticos, tratamientos, polvos pues esta compra es muy necesaria para el negocio, pues esta mercadería es demandada por los clientes, lo cual doña Sonia debe tener siempre disponible para vender.Ella aspira tener un negocio amplio, lleno de mercadería, clientes satisfechos por el buen servicio y una familia unida trabajando por progresar juntos.
texts.en: Sonia Isabel is 52 years old and lives in the La Paz neighborhood with her husband and two children.  She works selling general merchandise and has been in this business every day of the week for the past four years, as she sells from her house and by foot.  She currently needs a loan to buy shoes, general clothing, cosmetics, medicines, and powders.  This purchase is very much needed for her business since these items are demanded by her customers.  For this reason, Sonia must always have them available to sell.  She aspires to have a large business full of merchandise, satisfied customers from her good service, and a close-knit family working together to progress.

loans.use: to buy shoes, general clothing, cosmetics, medicines, and powders

loans.name: Haik

texts.en: Haik M. lives with his wife and three children in Irind village. Together with his wife, Haik is engaged in agriculture – the family’s main source of income. In his free time Haik also works in construction. Haik has applied for this loan to purchase four young bulls. This addition will increase the family’s income and help them have a more sustainable life in the village.

loans.use: to purchase four young bulls

loans.name: Sarwar's Group

texts.en:
Sarwar belongs to Pakpattan, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture and dairy industry. She has been living there in the area of Maday shah with her family in a three-room brick house for the past 20 years. Her husband’s name is M. D. and he operates a Punjabi food restaurant business. He sells local traditional food like Daal Chawal (made with chickpeas and served with rice and pickle), chicken and bread. He has a good number of clients due to the good quality and taste of the food. Sarwar is the mother of a son who is married and 28 years old. He helps his father in his business. Sarwar is a very good housewife and does her household responsibilities very well. She also assists her husband in his business by preparing food. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to further improve his business. With the loan, he will buy flour, chickpeas, cooking oil, spices, etc to prepare good quality food and to increase his profits. He has been operating this business for the past five years and Sarwar is hopeful that the loan will help him grow his business and make better profits. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She has established a good credit record with her previous loan and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour, chickpeas, cooking oil and spices

loans.name: Abla

texts.en: Abla is a 45-year-old single woman living in Chtoura. Since 2001, she has owned a grocery store. Abla is a hard worker whose clients are mostly her friends and neighbors. She is requesting her first loan from A. Majmoua to add new products such as ice-cream and cold drinks to sell during the spring and summer season. This will increase her business capitA. as her business increases during the warm weather when many people come to her area to spend their vacations until their children go back to school. Abla is looking forward to expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to add products such as ice-cream and cold drinks to sell during the spring and summer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Stella has a business of a small retail shop, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Stella hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Stella hopes to own a bar.  Stella is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her to be hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Jenie

texts.en: Married and with a fish-vending business in the Philippines, Jenie works hard to support three children. She has requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit Cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking for her family. In addition to saving money, Jenie is also aware that using the Cookstove will help the environment and reduce health and fire hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit Cookstove.

loans.name: Gaudioso

texts.en:
Gaudioso, 56 years old, is a married man from the town of Sto. Nino, South Cotabato. He has two children. He is a farmer and has been tilling their rice farm for 20 years now.

Gaudioso utilizes his income to provide his family with their basic needs. Receiving a loan would help him buy the farm supplies he needs like fertilizers and seeds.

In the future, Gaudioso hopes for his farm to grow. He also hopes to uplift his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Aynura

texts.en:
Aynura is 34 years old. She is married and has two children. She is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of food such as sweets, soft drinks, juices, preserved foods and many others in her grocery store. 

Aynura is not alone in this business. Her husband actively helps her with sales. Currently her monthly net profit is about 350 USD. 

Today Aynura is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN to increase her stock. She is ready to work even harder to provide her family with a better life and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe her perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in her small business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Viateur

texts.fr: Viateur est un salarie, il est célibataire. Il  a   43ans, il a 1 enfant de 12 ans, et son enfant étudier. Il  a 6 ans des études secondaires, il est ne au République Démocratique du Congo(RDC). C’est son quatrième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des matériels de construire une maison destine à la location  (planche, clous, sable, tôles,) payer la main d’œuvre. Il  n’a aucune difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de renouvelle sa maison pour la valoriser pour que le revenu venant de la location soit élevé. Pour ses ambitions il voudrait construire des salles polyvalentes à louer, construire d’autre maison pour sa famille, et payer le minerval pour son enfant.
texts.en:
Viateur is a salaried worker. He is single, 43 years old and has one child, who is 12 years old and a student. He was born in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, and has 6 years of secondary education. 

This is his 4th loan cycle with ACB. He will use the loan to buy material to build a house to rent out (wood, nails, sand, sheet metal..), and to pay for labor costs. He does not anticipate any difficulty in paying back the loan. His strategy for increasing his business is to renovate his house, increasing its value so that rental income will go up.  His ambition is to build multi-purpose rooms to rent out, to build another house for his family and to pay his son's school fees.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a house to rent out (wood, nails, sand, sheet metal) and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Katia Iveth

texts.es:
Katia de 20 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Castilla que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesanía.

Katia se dedica a la venta de ropa, a colocado un bazar donde ofrece todo tipo de productos para el uso diario en su domicilio, desde hace 5 año, también trae a pedido la ropa, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para implementar comprando otro tipo de mercadería como productos de primera necesidad, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando en su bazar para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida, para seguir apoyando económicamente a sus padres.
texts.en:
Katia, 20, lives with her parents.  The family house, in the Peruvian "departamento" of Piura, has electricity and running water.  Piura is a rural area and the people there work at farming, livestock-rearing and making and selling handicrafts.

Katia has owned a clothing business for 5 years.  She operates the business in an arcade where you can buy all kinds of everyday merchandise.  She also supplies clothing to order, a good way of increasing demand for the merchandise she sells and, in turn, her income.  

Her business is becoming more prosperous by the day so she's decided to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new soles loan to buy a wider rang of products.  She wants her customers to continue buying her merchandise so that she can improve her standard of living and go on helping her parents.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothing business.

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Sreyneang, 57, is a grocer. Her husband is a priest, and their income is $3 per day. She has three children; none of them are studying but are instead working, making $3 per day each. 

Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy grocery goods to sell, and to buy a motorbike for her son's commute to work. She hopes to have enough money to repair her house to be better than it is now.

loans.use: To buy groceries for resale, and to buy a motorbike for her son

loans.name: Alvaro Octavio

texts.es:
Alvaro conoce muy bien la ley del rebusque, pues desde hace más de 20 años se ha dedicado a trabajar como independiente. Actualmente y después de quebrarse en su negocio anterior de confecciones debido a que sus clientes en muchas ocasiones no le pagaron, con la ayuda de un amigo puso un punto de venta de ropa en el centro de Medellín. 

Este emprendedor necesita de un préstamo para comprar diversidad de mercancía y así ofrecerle otros productos a sus clientes y mejorar así sus ventas.
texts.en: Alvaro knows very well the law of earning a living as he has more than 20 years of experience being self-employed.   Currently, and after his previous tailoring business went bankrupt because many times his customers didn't pay him, he set up a clothing sales business with the help of a friend in downtown Medellín.  This entrepreneur needs a loan to buy a variety of merchandise so he can have more products to offer his customers and improve his sales.

loans.use: purchase clothing.

loans.name: Florcielo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLORCIELO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Luisa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Producción de leche y ganado, tienda de barrio, taller de costura de chamarras.
 
La señora Luisa,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de la asesora de crédito. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de leche que viene trabajando hace cuarenta años, aprendiendo el mismo de su mamá. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar capital (compra de vaca) que adquirirá de la feria 16 de julio (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto)  y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permitirá generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y nueve hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud y capacitación.
texts.en:
The Florcielo Communal Bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani community center.  The group is comprised of seven members.  It is run by a Board of Directors, which is headed by Luisa.  The members of the Communal Bank engage in various business activities such as milk production and livestock, a neighborhood store, and a seamstress shop making jackets.

Luisa points out that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer.  She became a member by invitation from the treasurer.  Luisa currently has a milk production business.  She has been working for 40 years, learning from her mother. 

The loan that she will now take is to increase capital (to buy a cow) at the 16 de Julio fair (commercial place in the city of El Alto).  She will later sell at the fairs.  This type of work will allow her to generate income to support her family.  She is married and has nine children.

When asked what she like about Pro Mujer she said she likes the health services and the trainings.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Anta, perteneciente a la provincia D. Anta,  y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Leonor; ella tiene 56 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. leche y venta D. sombreros, ella trabaja en forma ambulatoria y también la socia es docente del nivel primario, la socia por medio D. estos pequeños negocios saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. sombreros y venta D. leche. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar leche y sombreros al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Leonor is a member of the Communal Bank “Amanecer Anteña” which is located in the District and Province of Anta, Department of Cusco.

She is 56 years old, married, and has three children. Leonor divides her time between her daily activities and her businesses of selling milk and selling hats. She works as a street vendor, but she is also an elementary school teacher. Through these small businesses, Leonor is able to move her children forward. She wants to expand both her businesses of selling hats and selling milk. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy milk and hats in bulk.

Leonor is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy hats and milk in bulk.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 28 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Michael de 31 años y sus 02 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. Con mucho esfuerzo Lidia ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella siembra plantas de cacao y palillo, productos que una vez cosechados los lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de Santa Rosa, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus productos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y ayudar con los gastos familiares, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar su siembra, ya que se siente muy feliz haciéndolo, lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta los centros de acopio. Más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su primer crédito y esta contenta de  saber que tendrá el apoyo de ustedes, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su proyecto planeado y por ello se compromete en devolver puntualmente sus cuotas. Lidia solicita el crédito para comprar varios sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras y volverlas productivas con el transcurso del tiempo.
texts.en:
Lidia, 28, is a happy and hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her partner Michael, 31, and their two beloved children, whom she hopes to give a better future.

With great effort Lidia has managed to work her land and make it productive.  She grows cacao and tobacco plants, products that, once harvested, she takes to the city of Santa Rosa to sell wholesale.  Her crops have given her the income necessary to support herself and help with the family expenses.  This is why she hopes to put all her energy into getting this business ahead.

What she likes most about her work is sowing, since she feels very happy doing it.  She has been doing this work for five years and she considers the most difficult thing to be transporting her products to the distribution centers.  She wants to buy more land in the future to increase her crops.

This is her first loan and she is happy to know that she will have your support, since in this way she will feel sure of moving forward with her planned project.  For this reason she is committed to making her payments punctually.

Lidia is requesting the loan to buy several sacks of fertilizer to fertilize her fields and make them productive again in time.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Joseph Abu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to introduce to you this group of teachers, from the eastern city of Koidu/Kono. They have requested for a loan 10,900,000.00 SLL from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to solve their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and repays SMT/Kiva lender on their behalf. 

Joseph is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in a place call Gbalahun, in eastern Sierra Leone, 61 year old Joseph has been in the teaching profession for 43 years. He is married and has 10 children – 2 in primary school, 3 in secondary school and 5 grown-ups. Joseph has applied for this loan in order to buy house building materials and to invest the rest in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy house building materials and invest the rest in agriculture

loans.name: Tsedevsuren

texts.en:
Tsedevsuren is 28 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic tent) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and his son goes to kindergarden.

He started his cellphone sales and repair business in 2006 by renting a counter in a market. He is well known for his excellent service and quality of his work. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "Now that cellphones are getting advanced, my equipment is unable to operate. Therefore, I need new equipment and some raw materials."

He is requesting 2,500,000 to purchase new equipment.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment

loans.name: Chuluuntsetseg

texts.en:
Chuluuntsetseg is 30 and lives with her son in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her son is a student at school. 

She started her bakery business in 2003 by baking at home. Now she has her own workshop and two employees. Her baking technique is unique and tasty. She has many regular customers in the neighborhood. 

Her customer demand is increasing; however, her machinery isn't working properly. In order to meet customer demand, she has to renew her machinery. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "My business is shutting down. In order to work, I have to replace certain equipment". 

She is requesting 3,800,000 MNT to purchase new machinery.

loans.use: to purchase new machinery

loans.name: Luzanaka Group

texts.en:
Moses is the facilitator of the Luzanaka group. Moses and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Moses takes care of two children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to have quality farm produce and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Moses had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Moses was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Moses and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Moses will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Luzanaka group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Bassem

texts.en:
Bassem is a 51-year-old Lebanese man. He is married and lives with his wife and three school-aged children. He is the main source of income for the family and does his best to fulfill their needs. 

He has been working as a taxi driver for the past five years, responding to customers' requests.  

Today he is requesting a loan of $2900 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to carry out necessary maintenance on his car, including welding and painting. This will certainly facilitate his business and allow him to attract more clients. 

In the future, he plans to buy a new van and organize trips for tourists.

loans.use: to perform necessary maintenance on his car such as welding and painting

loans.name: Honsiyata's Group

texts.en:
Honsiyata's group is comprised of four hard-working women. Honsiyata is 20 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Honsiyata has been working hard to manage her small business selling maize. 

To help expand her business, Honsiyata has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize for resale, and will help Honsiyata to generate greater profits and pay her family's medical expenses. Honsiyata hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a home. 

Honsiyata is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Honsiyata's future prospects by helping her learn how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Donald

texts.en:
Donald works hard to support his family.  He is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Donald requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle maintenance.

Donald has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, he would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.ru: Биби проживает в городе Куляб. Она замужем. Ей 50 лет. У нее пятеро детей. Ее дети находятся в России. Сама она занимается торговлей детской одежды. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 12 лет. Кредит берет для покупки костюмчиков и шапок.
texts.en: Bibi lives in the city of Kulob.  She is 50 years old, married and has five children.  Her children are in Russia.  Bibi is involved in selling children's clothing.  She has been in this business for 12 years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase suits and hats.

loans.use: to purchase suits and hats

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man who lives with his parents and two siblings. He owns an internet cafe in his town and he welcomes customers from different areas and villages to enjoy their time. Mohammad is responsible for providing for his family's expenses and covering the high costs of living. 

Mohammad is requesting a youth loan from the Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to increase his inventory of computers to accommodate new clients and increase his profits. In the future, Mohammad plans to expand his business and add a corner into his shop to serve food and sandwiches.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of computers to accommodate new clients

loans.name: Los Angeles De Vitarte Group

texts.es: Hola  de Perú,   Un grupo conformado por 10  mujeres  responsables a distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellos residen en el distrito de Ate Vitarte. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “los Ángeles de Vitarte” una de ellas es la Sra. Doris de 46 años soltera y sin  hijos, la Sra. Doris  se dedica ya hace 5 años a la fabricación de sabanas   en un pequeño local  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y así poder ayudar a su familia , Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra. Doris   ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y mejorar su calidad de vida , y  así Seguir mejorando su negocio , su mayor sueño en la vida es tener una empresa de telas  , Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más telas  y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
Hello from Perú.  

This communal bank group is made up of 10 responsible women working in various industries. Each of the women live in the district of Ate Vitarte. They call themselves the "Angels of Vitarte." One member of this group is Doris. She is 46 years old, single and has no children. For the last five years, Doris has made a living making sheets in a small store each day with the goal of helping her family to get ahead. With her earnings thus far, Doris has been able to improve her house and her quality of life. She hopes to continue improving. Her biggest dream is to own a fabric business.

With this loan, Doris will invest in more fabric in order to increase her earnings. She sends hugs to Kiva and Edaprospo as well as her thanks for the loan that helps make her progress possible.

loans.use: to buy more fabric.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a fertile area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy seeds for planting. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Sarkar

texts.en:
Sarkar is internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region Chiragli village. He settled in Absheron town Masazir village married. He is 42, has 3 children. His first loan was $400, bought 4 sheeps. 
He spent the second loan amount of $1000  to buy 11 sheeps. 
Now he is planning to buy 20 sheeps in order to increase his incomes.

loans.use: To buy 20 sheeps

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has a business making and selling fashion accessories. She also sells household items and bottled water. Nancy started out two years ago selling plastic items for the kitchen, with the help of a little bit of money given to her by her husband. Over time she also learned how to make bracelets, necklaces, and other items she now sells.

Nancy needs this loan to invest in the raw materials for the manufacture of her products, and to buy more supplies for selling water. She is sure that her sales will increase and she will be able to provide a better education for her children.

Nancy is 41 years old and she has two children who are in school. She helps support the household with the income from her business. Along with the salary earned by her husband, she is able to keep up with the household expenses. She is sure that with this investment she will be able to earn more and help with a better education for her children.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Nancy tiene el negocio de elaboración de bisutería y venta de artículos para el hogar. Nancy empezo con un pequeño capital que le proporciono su esposo con el comercio de artículos para el hogar hace 2 años, vendiendo la línea de artículos plásticos para la cocina.Con el tiempo fue aprendiendo la elaboración de pulsera, collares y otros que ella los comercia. Ella también vende agua en botellones.

Nancy necesita el préstamo para invertir en materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos y comprar mas pomas para vender agua. Ella esta segura que sus ventas crecerá y le podra dar una mejor educacion a sus hijos.

Nancy tiene 41 años y tiene dos niños que estudian. Ella ayuda en el hogar con las ganancias de su negocio. Junta con el sueldo que gana su esposo para poder afrontar con la economía del hogar tiene la seguridad que con la inversión que hará le permitirá tener mejores ganancias y poder ayudar con una mejor educacion para sus hijos.

loans.use: Nancy needs this loan to invest in raw materials for her crafts.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret A. is a 50-year-old widow who supports six children in her household.  She specializes in selling ready-made women’s dresses. Despite the stiff competition in her area, Margaret has always been able to attract old and new customers.  Her hard work, years of experience, good location of her business and well-established clientele base ensure that her business will continue to grow. She plans to use her next loan of  US $600 to purchase more clothing to meet the high demand of her customers.

loans.use: Increase the stock of ready-to-wear clothing in her business

loans.name: Agadadash

texts.en: Agadadash H. is a taxi driver in the town of Devechi which is located on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Agadadash is married with two children and is looking for funding to invest into his business.

loans.use: To invest in his taxi business

loans.name: Carmen Nora

texts.es:
Carmen is 49 years old and she sells much needed products from a small room in her house. She learnt and got to know this trade while she was in the capital working for her older siblings' company which sells these sorts of things. The support it has brought her husband and kids has been vital, and her kids have been able to go to university in their home town. She started this business from a small room and served people from the window. Little by little the business has grown and she now has lots of clients near where she lives. She now has a very organized room with display cabinets, and she would like a freezer now too so that she can sell ice creams, lollies and cold drinks. This means that she would be able to offer a better service to all her clients. In order to do this she needs a loan of $325 which she will repay in 6 months. She would use it to buy the freezer as Carmen's dream is to own a minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Carmen es una señora de 49 años; dedicada al comercio de artículos de primera necesidad en un pequeño espacio dentro de su casa, esta actividad la emprendió y conoció durante su permanencia en la ciudad capital de su país en compañía de sus hermanos mayores pues ellos se dedican hace ya varios años al comercio de abarrotes al por mayor en dicha ciudad.El apoyo incondicional para desarrollar esta actividad satisfactoriamente se la han brindado su esposo e hijos quienes gracias a los ingresos generados han podido acceder a estudiar en la universidad de su ciudad natal. Inició su negocio con una pequeña bodeguita atendiendo por una de las ventanas de su casa y poco a poco hasta la fecha ha ido creciendo por la cantidad de clientes que logró reunir en la zona donde vive.Actualmente cuenta con una bodega bien organizada, con vitrinas de exhibición, estantes y para complementar su negocio requiere adquirir una congeladora, artefacto que le permitirá tener bebidas heladas, hacer hielo y helados. Estos artículos ayudarán a que el negocio pueda ofrecerles más novedades a cada uno de sus clientes y para llevar a cabo este propósito requiere financiar el importe de 325 dólares en 6 meses para poder comprar la congeladora ya que la meta de Carmen es convertir a largo plazo su bodeguita en un Minimarket,

loans.use: To buy a freezer to sell frozen drinks to meet her clients' demands/ADQUIRIR UNA CONGELADORA PARA OFRECER BEBIDAS HELADAS ADEMÁS DE HELADOS PARA SATISFACCIÓN DE SUS ASIDUOS CLIENTES.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is the owner of the Seaman Bar in Kikajjo on the outskirts of Kampala. She is also the vice chairperson for the Nyikira Okole Women’s Lending Group. She is 27 years old and married with two children. She also takes care of 2 orphans. At her bar she serves beer, sodas and spirits. Bars are much more than drinking establishments. They are places for people to gather and visit. Most villages will have one bar. Often the beer is made in-house. Beer is made with millet, sorghum or bananas, with yeast added to the first two versions but not to the bananas. The bananas are first covered with banana leaves and buried in the ground for 3 days. Then they are unwrapped and cooked slightly and reburied for 3 more days. Then they are brought out and mashed in a cut-out log and put into ceramic jars and allowed to ferment for 14 days. Betty plans to use her loan to expand her business and to add food items.

loans.use: To expand her business and add food items

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan lives with his parents and younger son in Emilio Calderon Street, city of La Paz. He paints landscapes and movie posters. Based on the kinds of paintings that he does, he is seen as a very popular painter who earns a living through his art. The credit he wants is for the purchase of materials so that he can make more paintintgs and then mount them on special wooden frames and glass. This way he can increase the value of them and improve his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan vive en casa de sus padres con su hijo menor en la calle Emilio Calderón de la zona Belén de la Ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que el realiza es el arte de pintar paisajes además de elaborar carteles para los cines; por el tipo de pinturas que realiza, Juan puede ser catalogado como un pintor popular que se gana la vida a través de su arte. El crédito que solicita es para comprar material y poder elaborar mas cuadros pero con marcos de madera especial y vidrio para que adquieran mas valor y de esta manera poder mejorar sus ingresos. No tiene crédito con Impro, pero su actividad emprendedora lo califica como sujeto de crédito dentro de nuestra visión social y consiguientemente sugerimos concederle una oportunidad.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for his paintings

loans.name: Endurance

texts.en: Mrs. Endurance O. sells baby items. She needs the loan of $275 to buy more baby things for sale. She is 35 years old and married with two children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more baby items for sale

loans.name: Aida
