Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Lebanese Kiva borrower is a 47-year old married man and has four school-age children. He has been working as a professional taxi driver since 1985. His income from his taxi business is essential to the development and care of his family. His main route is between his town and the surrounding villages. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 to perform much-needed repairs to his taxi, including improving the car’s body and engine after being in bad circumstances. He says that with the modifications, he will present a comfortable transportation service to his clients. In the future, he is hoping to expand his business by purchasing a new car.

loans.use: To perform much-needed repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Kisa Kya Maria Women's Group-Kayunga

texts.en: David William S. is 44 years old and 'Kisa Kya Maria' is the group he belongs to. He has been operating a retail shop in Ntenjeru- Kayunga for the last three years. David is happily married with four kids. He also operates rentals, coffee sales, and stone quarrying. He says to start up in this business, he used his savings. 80,000 shillings is what he makes in a week. With this loan, William says he is going to purchase more general merchandise for resale at his shop.

loans.use: purchase of more general merchandise for resale

loans.name: John Kabare

texts.en:
John Kabari K. is 40 years old. He is married to Gladys Wangare and is a father of two children, aged two and a half and four years. John is a businessman and he deals with electrical services. He has been in the business for the past ten years.
  
John learned about KADET from a member of a group within his locality. This will be his fifth loan and he is planning to buy more electrical items to expand his electrical business. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to reinvest in the business and build a house for his family.

His dream is to become successful in his business and be known country-wide.

loans.use: To buy electrical items to expand business

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Chum S., age 39, is a worker in the garment industry. She is married to Vanny, age 37 a motor taxi driver in Phnom Penh City.  They have three children all of whom are students. Chum S. has been working in ther job since 2008,  Her house is only partially built.  Chum S. says that her savings are insufficient to pay to finish the house. To solve this problem, Chum S. would like to request a loan to be used to finish building the rest part of her house and adding a toilet and kitchen.

loans.use: To  finish building the rest part of her house.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen A. O. is twenty eight years old. She is married.  Her husband is a teacher, and they have two children, aged ten years old and five years old. Her business is located at a busy market in Kisumu known as Dago market. She has a grocery stand at which she sells such items as vegetables, tomatoes, onions and fish. She has been in this business for five years now and she says that this business is profitable .  The only major challenge she has is the long distance she walks in search of wholesalers from whom she purchases the items she sells. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She will use her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy cabbages, tomatoes and onions to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to grow her business to wholesale and provide employment to people through her business. She describes herself as obedient, disciplined and a risk taker.

loans.use: Cabbages, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Asim

texts.en: Asim X. is a 40 year-old-man who lives and works in Sabirabad. He never received a formal education but all his life did his best to provide for his family. Asim is married and has one son, aged 16. His wife actively helps him in his cattle-breeding business, which he started in 2005. Asim buys animals at profitable prices and then raises and sells them in the livestock bazaar for a profit. Asim also has a little poultry business. His monthly income  is 300 AZN to support his family. This is the first loan that he has taken from Aqroinvest and Kiva. He used this loan of 1000 AZN to buy three cows. Asim says that the success of his business lies in the quality of his meat and dairy produce. Now he has six cows but after repaying this loan he would like to take out another loan to buy four more cows.

loans.use: to buy three cows

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her business of selling paper envelops. She receives orders from different stationary shops in the market and fulfills them in a timely way to earn an income for her family. With the loan she will buy paper envelops in bulk and increase her sales.
 
She started this business after the death of her husband. It was a time of great difficulty for her, but she faced it bravely.
  
Shahida couldn’t provide education facilities to her children due to financial constraints. Now both of her sons also work to contribute to the family financially. Her elder son works in the motor workshop while the younger one is an employee in a general store.
 
She lives with her family in Okara, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy paper envelops for selling

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alicia; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pescados, la socia vende pescados en el mercado desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pescados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pescados al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the El Molinito II Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Alicia is 40 years old and single.  She has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling fish.  She sells fish in the market from 6:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  Through this business she gets her children ahead.

She wants to expand and improve her business of selling fish.  She is requesting the loan to buy fish wholesale.  She is very happy about the loan, and she pledges to make the payments in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy fish wholesale

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie B. is from the village of Samay, Gingoog City. She is 24 years old. Rosalie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconuts for copra in the local community. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosalie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts to sell

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
CARLOS ALBERTO B. E., ES DE MANAGUA, EL TRABAJA DIARIO COMO FONTANERO, ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE TRES HIJOS, Y ESTOS  ACTUALMENTE DEPENDE DE ELLA Y SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
DON CARLOS ALBERTO ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ARENA, CEMENTO, PIEDRA Y HIERRO  PARA LA CONSTRUCCION DE UN MURO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION.
TODO ESTO PARA MEJORAR LAS CONDICIONES DE VIVIENDA PARA SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto B. E. is from Managua. He works every day as a plumber. He is the father of a family with three school-age children who all depend on him.

Carlos Alberto went to CEPRODEL's office to request a loan for making improvements to his home. He will invest in the purchase of construction materials like sand, cement, stone, and iron bars for building a wall in his house. He wants to do this in order to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace W. has been the owner of a retail store business for 10 years, and she works seven days a week. Grace sells her products from her home. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cans of cooking oil. The main business challenges for Grace include defaulters and the ever-increasing prices of commodities. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at the wholesale level.    

Grace and her husband own a home in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. The have four children, all of whom are in school. The family has access to electricity and to piped water. Their major monthly expenses include food, school fees, and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cans of cooking oil

loans.name: Luis Salomon

texts.es:
LUIS SALOMON G., tiene 52 años de edad, es divorciado, vive con los 3 hijos, vive en San Miguel  en el Recinto Tangara perteneciente a la Provincia de Bolívar.

Esta Ventanilla se llama CAMPECINOS UNIDOS  esta ubicada en el recinto Tangara y se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del Cantón San Miguel, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y trigo por que son los productos que mas se venden.
Comprar sus productos, como semillas, en San Miguel y los vende en la Feria del mismo Cantón.

El crédito lo solicita para la comprar de insumos agrícolas fertilizantes y semillas, el crédito apoyado en el negocio familiar ya que produce mas y se tiene que trabajar para pagar la deuda. Su sueño es construir una chanchera grande y comprar cerditos para vender.

Los desafíos que se enfrenta son plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Le gusta festejar el carnaval con la familia.
texts.en:
Luis Salomon G. is 52 years old and divorced. He lives with his three children in Tangara, San Miguel Canton, Bolivar Province, Ecuador.

The credit window to which Luis belongs, Campesinos Unidos, is located in Tangara, about 15 minutes from the San Miguel Canton. (A canton in Ecuador is similar to a county in the USA.) The members of this credit window work in agriculture and trade.

Luis works in agriculture, planting corn and wheat, because these are the most commonly bought agricultural products. He buys his products, such as seeds, in San Miguel, and sells them in the market of the same canton.

He is applying for this loan to buy agricultural inputs, such as fertilizers and seeds. The credit will be supported by this family business, which will produce more as a result of the inputs and be able to pay back the debt promptly. His dream is to establish an operation to raise pigs for sale.

The biggest challenges that Luis faces are pests and sicknesses in his crops. He enjoys going to the carnival with his family.

loans.use: to buy inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar tiene 60 años y es soltero. Vive en casa familiar en el distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Cliente vive en la parte rural del distrito no cuenta con servicios de agua y luz. Gana la vida vendiendo ganada para engorde. El vende animales menores a clientes de su caserio y sus alrededores que los crian y los engordan para luego venderlos a los comerciantes que suelen visitar los mercados locales. Oscar desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales menores y alimento balanceado. Con esta inversión, podrá seguir generando buenos ingresos que usa para solventar sus gastos familiares y de su hogar.
texts.en:
Oscar is 60 years old and single.  He lives in his family home in Motupe district, an agricultural area in Lambayeque province, one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.  Oscar lives in the rural part of the district and he doesn't have access to water or electricity services.

Oscar earns a living selling livestock to be fattened.  He sells young animals to customers in his village and surrounding areas who then raise them and sell them to the traders who visit the local markets.

Oscar would like to expand his business by purchasing more young animals and balanced feed.  With this investment, he will be able to continue making good profits which he uses to cover his family and household expenses.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Albert Einstein once said, "Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow." This is what Gloria S., 60, does to make the most out of her life. At 60, Gloria has already lost her life partner. She currently lives with her children and young grandchildren in Silang, Cavite. Gloria finds fellowship and entrepreneurial training in CCT*, where she is one of thousands of Community partners.

Gloria is a fruit and vegetable dealer. She primarily sells tropical fruits like mangoes and pineapples, as well as fresh vegetables for every-day meals. Gloria's commercial space is located in another municipality; while she lives in Silang, her store is located in Kawit (still in Cavite). Monthly she earns a net income of Php5,400. 

Due to previous financial struggles,  Gloria decided to request a loan of Php10,000 to help her grow her business. She will use this to purchase more fruit and vegetables to add to the array of goods in her store. Gloria will only pick the freshest produce to sell to her valued customers. Gloria says that this loan will impact greatly on her business capital.

At present, one struggle she has is the long lists of debts accrued by some of her customers. Gloria will make use of her 38 years of experience in the business to solve this issue. She aims to improve her business and include more products to sell. Above all, she hopes that her children will be successful and that her grandchildren will finish their education. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 61 years old and married with four adult-aged children. She earns PHP 4,000 per month as a farmer working in the Philippines.

Erlinda has been growing corn for 25 years. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

In the future, Erlinda hopes that her farming business will become progressive to be able to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 52 years old and lives in Bagacay, Sibutad Zamoboanga del Norte, She is married with one child.

To earn a living, Anecita has a grocery store where she sells a variety of food products. She earns about 4,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. Anecita has a requested a loan to purchase more products for her grocery store.

She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her grocery store

location.town: Calamba - Bagacay, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a single woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past five years, she has operated a restaurant business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase twenty plates, cooking pots, three bags of beans and four bags of maize. She decided to join Yehu to access loans because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: To purchase twenty plates, cooking pots, three bags of beans and four bags of maize.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin, 28, is married to Florence and has two children. He has been running his grocery business for the past two years. He earns a monthly income of about KES 20,000, which is used to meet family expenses and pump money back in the business.

He is asking a loan of KES 30,000 through KADET Ltd. He intends to use the loan to purchase more stock i.e. sugar, wheat flour, rice in bulk, maize flour in bulk, among others.

He plans to use the anticipated profit to open another shop. In the future, he hopes to open a super market.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of grocery items like sugar, wheat flour, rice in bulk, maize flour in bulk, among others.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 35 years old and she is a hardworking and determined businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two children, aged 16 and 13. She has been selling clothing for the last four years to make ends meet and supplements her income from the earnings she gets by offering hairdressing services.

In the next five years, she wants to have expanded her business and bought a plot so that she can actualize her dream of owning rental houses.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy ladies and gents undergarments. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for advancing her loans to inject into her business.

loans.use: to buy ladies and gents undergarments.

loans.name: Elena Nancy

texts.es:
Elena es madre de familia de 44 años, vive con su menor hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con el servicio de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de San José que pertenece al departamento de la Libertad.  Zona de actividad agrícola, ganadera y turística.

Elena cuenta con su negocio de venta de comida en su domicilio, brinda pensión a los trabajadores del Banco de la Nación de la ciudad donde vive, actividad que realiza desde  hace varios años, cuenta con su propia clientela, pero a pensado en solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1800 nuevos soles para comprar insumos y utensilios, con la finalidad de seguir brindando un buen servicio y satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo.

Con su trabajo y sus ganas de salir adelante Elena se ha ganado la confianza y el respeto de sus vecinos, demostrando que cuando uno se propone una meta se puede hacer realidad, con el objetivo de que su hijo tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Elena is a mother and 44 years old. She lives with her youngest son in their own house, which has water and electricity. It is located in the district of San José, which belongs to the department of La Libertad, which has agriculture, cattle, and tourism.

Elena has a business selling food in her home and she rents rooms to workers from the Bank of the Nation in the city where she lives. She has had this business for several years and has her own customers. She thought to request a loan from Edypme Alternative for PEN 1,800.00 to buy ingredients and utensils, with the goal of providing better service and satisfying the needs of her customers. With the income she receives she will be able to cover her loan and improve the quality of life for her son.

Through her hard work and her desire to get ahead, Elena has earned the trust and respect of her neighbors, demonstrating that when she sets a goal, she can make it into reality, so that her son can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils so she can continue making the food she offers to her customers.

loans.name: Nova Niza

texts.en:
Nova Niza is 25 years old and is married with one child. She lives in Talairon, Oroquieta City. For the past four years, Nova Niza has run a shop where she sells a variety of goods such as candies, soft drinks, and bread. She has been a member of PMPC for ten years.  

Nova Niza is requesting a 3,000 PHP loan to purchase more merchandise for her general store. In the future, she hopes to own big grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase products for her general store

loans.name: Laura Isabel

texts.es: Laura tiene 33 años, casada con Ítalo quien trabaja de albañil y tienen 4 hijos cada uno de 12, 9, 8, 3 años y son estudiantes en instituciones fiscales. Ellos viven en la zona suburbana del fortín (localidad de Guayaquil), Laura empezó hace 2 años en su negocio, a ella le gusta tener sus propios ingresos y además contribuir con los gastos del hogar. Inicia sus labores desde la 6h00 hasta las 21h00. La zona en la que vive tiene lomas y caminos de tierra por lo que se hace dificultoso salir a hacer alguna actividad fuera de casa. Con el préstamo que ella espera obtener está pensando comprar 100 cuadernos para venderlos en $1,50; 20 láminas educativas a costo $0.50  entre otra mercadería para comercializar, espera obtener una buena ganancia y seguir apoyando a  sus hijos  para que el futuro sean una excelentes profesionales.
texts.en:
Laura is 33 years old, and married to Italo who works as a bricklayer. They have 4 children, aged 12, 9, 8, and 3, who are students in tax-supported institutions. They live in the suburban zone of El Fortin (a locality in Guayaquil). Laura began her business 2 years ago. She likes to have her own  income and also to contribute to covering household expenses.

Laura works from 6:00 am until  9:00 pm.  The zone where she lives  is hilly and has dirt roads, which makes it difficult to carry out any activity outside the home.

With the loan she hope to obtain, Laura plans to buy 100 notebooks to sell at $1.50, and 20 laminated school sheets at $0.50, among other merchandise, to sell. Laura hopes to obtain good earnings and to continue helping her children so that in the future they may become excellent professionals.

loans.use: to buy notebooks and paper products to sell.

loans.name: Las Palmas Km 14  Portoviejo Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Palmas KM 14 se reúne cada quince días en el  en el sitio D. mismo nombre D. Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de personas que hace 4 meses atrás decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido  de mucho ya que con los créditos ellas han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Ruth, es socia fundadora D. Banco comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. Tiene 49 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 4 hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad y el menor de 7 años el mismo que estudia en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que lo da todo por su hogar y por sus hijos, ella para ayudar a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica a la venta de zapatos y sandalias por catálogo, trabaja cuatro días de la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta pues ella visita a sus clientes en estos días mas que todo por las tardes cuando está desocupada, nos cuenta que ya lleva dos años dedicada a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastantes clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar zapatos y sandalias ya que tiene varios pedidos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y en el banco comunal.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank, Las Palmas KM 14, meets every fifteen days in the Canton of Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its arts and crafts which are nationally and internationally recognized.  They are also known for their famous Panama-style hats.

Four months ago, these members decided to organize and form a communal bank.  The credit that they have been able to receive has helped them improve their small businesses.  All of the members work in diverse areas, such as business, services, food sales.

One of the members of this group is Ms. Ruth.  She is one of the founding members of the communal bank and likes it very much because she can easily obtain loans.  She is 49 years old and has 4 children, three of whom are adults and one of whom is a minor of seven years old who attends school.  Her husband is a business man.

She is a very good house wife who gives her all to her home and to her children.  In order to help her husband with their household costs, she works in the sale of shoes and sandals by catalog.  She works four days a week and sells them door to door, mainly visiting her clients in the afternoon.  She has been doing this for over two years and states that is has been going very well, as she has numerous customers.

This loan will be used to purchase shoes and sandals, since she already has many orders.

Her dreams are to expand her business and the communal bank.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Khlok's Group

texts.en:
This 5-member group of people, led by Klork, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area with a variety of businesses including agriculture, livestock-breeding, and fisH..

Klork is a 46-year-old married woman who lives with her common-law husband with whom she has six children, one of whom is already married and living separately. The other five are single, living with her, and attending high school and primary school. A very hard-working woman involved in the fisH. business, she can earn enough income to cover her family’s expenses.

Klork is now requesting her first loan with Kiva partner HKL in the amount of $100USD to buy fisH. materials. She and her family hope that it will contribute to her family's financial well-being, and they are very grateful to all of Kiva's lenders for their support. Klork’s dreams are to have a large house and enable all of her children to at least finish high school.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Glem Americo

texts.es:
Glem casado, su hijo estudiante, trabajador, de profesión ingeniero, junto a su compañera de vida tiene un negocio en el cual tiene planes de ampliarlo e ingresar mayores cantidades y variedad de productos. Su negocio se basa en la venta de comida siendo el principal factor de comercialización. Inicio su negocio en pequeñas cantidades y de la idea de vender tacos leoneses. El negocio está establecido desde hace un tiempo siendo rentable. Es su primer ciclo de préstamo el cual requiere para realizar mejoras en el local del negocio. 
Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, azulejos, láminas de zinc, cielo rasó, pinturas,  bloques entre otros. Ya que remodelara la cocina del restaurante, le pondrá cielo rasó, cambiara algunas paleta de ventana, lo pintara. Dándole mejor presentación y mayor comodidad a los clientes que lo visita. Agradece a ala financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Glem is married, his son’s a student.  He’s hardworking and is an Engineer by profession.  He has a business together with his life partner that he’d like to expand and add larger amounts and variety of products.  His business is based on food sales, the main products he sells.  He started the business with small amounts and the idea to sell León-style tacos.  The business has been in operation for some time now and it’s been profitable.  This is his first loan cycle and he wants to use the loan to make some improvements to the business’ locale.

He will use the loan to buy building materials and supplies like: cement, sand, tile, metal sheeting, ceiling panels, paint and concrete blocks, among others because he will remodel the locale’s kitchen, install a ceiling, replace window hinges and paint to give it a better appearance and more comfort to the customers who come by.  He thanks the financial institution for the support for his business’ development and to his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Gerlyn

texts.en:
Gerlyn is 33 years old. She is married with 3 children.

Gerlyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Gerlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Gerlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell
